2423906082.title: Bushcraft Gear - Tools
2423906082.description:
[b]Adds 6 new vanilla friendly weapons to your world:[/b]
- Hand Hatchet
- Splitting Axe
- Cheap Survival Knife
- Survival Knife
- Kukri Machete
- Rancher Machete
(Default weapons has not been replaced, they are still in the game)

Every weapon/tool has different states to make them suite to different combat styles.
The "Hand hatchet" for example is a shorter hand axe which is quicker and more accurate (slightly higher crit and attack speed) than the default handaxe, but has a shorter range and deals less damage to zombies and doors.

Feel free to leave feedback to the drop chances and stats. :)

Credits to [url=steamcommunity.com/id/heafoxyz/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]Hea[/url] for creating the russian translation and helping out with some balancing!
Credits to [url=steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198010825091]Stonechild[/url]  for updating the loot distribution to the new system!
Credits to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Arkorinho/myworkshopfiles/] 「Arko Piktuviry」 [/url] for creating the spanish translation!
Credits to Ankha for ukraine translation!
Thanks!

[h1] [b]FAQ:[/b][/h1]
[b]Will this mod change the overall weapon count?[/b]
Yes and no.
Weapons attached in zombies are as rare as before since they share one loot table with the default weapons.
But since the new weapons have been added to several containers it might increase the overall weapons in the world.

[b]Will this mod work with a existing savegame?[/b]
It should, but you may wont find them in already discovered loot places.
Its usually better to start a new savegame with new mods.

 [b]Which game version works with this mod?[/b]
I have tested it with game version 41.71

 [b]Do you take comission for new weapons?[/b]
It depents.
If i like a idea or weapon i might add it if i want to play with it, but mostly the anwser is: no

[b]Am i allowed to use this mod in a Server mod pack?[/b]
Yes

[url=https://ko-fi.com/scavengersmods][img]https://i.imgur.com/k8tvuaC.png[/img][/url]

Workshop ID: 2423906082
Mod ID: BCGTools

2766626985.title: C.O.N. Research & Testing Facility
2766626985.description:
Single Cell map mod that adds a giant research and testing facility to the west of March Ridge,
as well as spawn points in March Ridge.

There are some career-specific spawn points in the Research Facility as well.

The cell the facility is located on is 31x42, making it tucked off in the woods for a nice hidden lab.

Included in the lab is a mechanic garage, a security room and armory, offices, apartments, and a staff lounge. Also attached is a gas station and a Spiffo's!

[h1][b]Also check out [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2778676843]March Ridge Expansion[/url] that expands the North West end of March Ridge! This expansion was created to connect the Facility to March Ridge![/b][/h1]

Workshop ID: 2766626985
Mod ID: CONRTF
Map Folder: CONRTF

2905027525.title: Can Repair Doors
2905027525.description:
[img]https://i.ibb.co/BnbFX35/prevent-to-update.png[/img]
[quote=AuD][i] info: the double doors have changed on the vanilla side, now it is no longer / not necessary to repair the central walls of the double doors, the PZ dev's have made sure that the central walls auto-repair themselves by opening and closing the double door, just repair/reinforce the side walls of the doubles doors (look the picture)  [/i][/quote]

[h1]Can Repair or reinforce the Doors[/h1]

[b]With this mod, you can repair and reinforce doors with new world-distributed items or craftable items.[/b]

The effectiveness of door repair is tied to your carpentry skills. 

Carpentry and Metalworking skills will be required to craft some items.

If you reinforce a door, its health will be improved according to the sanbox options that you have configured.

It works on classic doors, double doors and garage doors, on all doors really, whether it's a mod or vanilla, as long as it's a model recognized as a door, it will be taken into account in the calcule, my code is global, it will be compatible.

When a door takes up several squares, a garage door for example, it will contain several repairs, a garage door actually has 3 boxes. look at the pictures and the video.

For example, the indication "good condition" does not mean that the door is at 100% health, it is the carpentry skill that will make you get closer to 100% health or not, "good condition " is just approximate. (If the door's condition is above 400/500, it will be considered "good condition")

In MP only, door health doesn't seem to be synced regarding zombie damage, unlike in single player, in MP only players have the sync of repairing or strengthening a door. If I find a way to fix it, I will...

[code]
[h1][b]3 items :[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]repair kit for doors (Craftable)
[*]reinforce kit for doors (Craftable)
[*]epoxy glue for repair doors (Distribued in the world)
[/list]
[/code]

[code][code][h1]Work in SP and MP-COOP (certainly)/ Existing Save / Safety to remove / no rewrite vanilla code[/h1][/code][/code]

[code]
[h1]SandBox Options[/h1]
CanRepairDoors = {
        -- Minimum=0 Maximum=10 Par défaut=1
        RepairSkillNeeded = 1,
        -- Minimum=0 Maximum=10 Par défaut=3
        ReinforceSkillNeeded = 3,
        -- Minimum=1 Maximum=1000 Par défaut=6
        multiplyerMaxReinforcement = 6,
    },
[/code]

IT par TheSanctuary0

3125338860.title: Canvasback Studios
3125338860.description:
[h2] Welcome to Canvasback studios, where your dreams can take flight! [/h2]

Our secluded, state of the art facilities feature everything required to tackle all scales of projects. Featuring 3 separate recording suites, mastering room and dubbing facilities, in addition to onsite accommodations and activities! Take a dip into the lake or the pool between takes, stroll our picturesque grounds, shoot a music video at our configurable set, have an in-house chef prepare all your meals, enjoy a cocktail at our fully equipped bar, and rest comfortably and privately in our tailor-made accommodations. Facilities include:

[h3] Studio A: The Great Hall [/h3]

[i] Featuring a historic church organ from the 1880s, this bright and airy massive hall is perfect for those larger than life productions! Features two ISO booths, as well as a massive bay window looks upon the scenic Canvasback Lake. The main room is large enough to accommodate a Franz Kimmer production, including a large upper balcony perfect for choral sections. The control room features the latest LLS 4000 C+ console, and bespoke L'Transmission monitoring system, in addition to a dubbing suite should you need to feature a synchronous soli or dialog. [/i]

[h3] Studio B: The "Live" Room [/h3]

[i] Centred around a rare, Steve 8058 console, this room is perfect for the authentic artist. Featuring a greenhouse style roof, elevated playing positions and circular layout, it makes studio B perfect for collaborative, world, jam, or live off the floor styles of recording. [/i]

[h3] Studio C: The Factory [/h3]

[i] Affectionately referred to as the "bunker" this punchy, yet configurable room gave birth to the famous Bill Frollins drum sound. Featuring one of a kind pair of Push-Mech compressors and a punchy LLS 4000V console, this room is great for drums, as well as solo acoustic acts. [/i]

[h3] Studio D: Mastering Suite [/h3]

[i] Featuring the latest Innuendo software and a perfectly neutral LLS 4000D console, our fully equipped mastering suite can run the gamut from Classical, World, Rock, Jazz and Score recordings. We even mastered last years box office smash "The Chaperone" right in here! [/i]

[h3] 3 Full Accomodation Suites [/h3]

[i] Our comfortable suites allow for stays of parties up to 10 combined, and feature fully stocked facilites, laundry, kitchen, bar and free reign of the studio. All suites are also self contained for those seeking privacy, or those Ball & Barley style situations! [/i]


Our nestled amongst the pines facility is staffed 24/7, features ample parking and is a short drive from the small town of Muldraugh!

[b] Book today! [/b]

[hr][/hr]

Adds a large recording studio complex west of Muldraugh.

Goes great with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2997342681&searchtext=lifestyle]Lifestyle: Hobbies[/url] mod!


[h2] Features: [/h2]

[list]
[*] West of Muldraugh
[*] All Vanilla tiles, occupies Cell 33x34 - [b]no known conflicts[/b]
[*] Tested, compatible and neighbours [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2398274461]Save Our Station[/url] MULD-650 if you want to broadcast your records hot off the press!
[*] Fully zoned for everything, including spawns, foraging, vehicles + minimap
[*] Low zombie spawn area in a centre cell of the map
[*] Most sinks have barrels pre-placed, just need to connect them with a Pipe Wrench!
[*] Locations include a Groundskeeper's Farmstead, Greenhouse, Videoshoot, Gravel Road, Bridge and Secrets!
[/list]

This is my first map, so let me know if you encounter any bugs/errors/mod incompatibilities or have any suggestions!


Huge thanks to Daddy Dirkie Dirk for the tutorials, and r/projectzomboid for the initial inspiration and motivation for me to finally get off my butt and make something!

[img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1660101375273576639/0C12E325C464F5DC166E5FF2AB70A43581BED64F/[/img]

	[h1]Permissions[/h1][code]This mod's permissions fall under TIS's policy [url=http://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php/topic/2530-mod-permissions/?p=36478][b][u]Ask For Permission[/u][/b][/url]
[url=https://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php/topic/2530-mod-permissions/?p=36478][img]https://i.imgur.com/l9ciVMC.png[/img][/url]
This mod can only be added to and extended with the express permission from the original creator. Having received permission, credit must be given to the original creator, both within the files of the mod and wherever the mod roams online.

If no permission is received you may not alter the mod, and it must be treated as a mod that is [b]'On Lockdown'[/b].[/code]

Want to add this map to an existing save? Follow [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2547762158]this guide by EPD.[/url]

Mod ID: Canvasback Studios
Map Folder: Canvasback

2955723750.title: Car Door Open Indicator
2955723750.description:
[h1]Description[/h1]

Adds a simple flashing and beeping alert when any Door/Trunk/Hood is open whilst in the drivers seat of a car.

[b]Features[/b]
- Adds Radial menu options to close Doors, the Trunk and Hood when the car is stopped
- You can right click the Engine/Door/Trunk icons to mute the beeping

[h1]FAQ[/h1]

[b]Is this safe to add to an already started game[/b]
Yes
[hr][/hr]
[b]Does this work with vehicle mod 'x'[/b]
Yes this should work with any Vehicle mod that is using normal vehicle part names.
Vehicles that have more than 1 Trunk or Hood, may only be triggered when the first object is open.
Doors only trigger when they are directly tied to a seat.
[hr][/hr]
[b]What happens if the doors are missing[/b]
If the door is missing then the alert will be triggered.
[hr][/hr]

Source: https://github.com/AaronFoley/CarDoorOpenIndicator
Workshop ID: 2955723750
Mod ID: CDOI

Workshop ID: 2955723750
Mod ID: CDOI

2904860811.title: Car Hotwire Magazine
2904860811.description:
This mod adds a magazine that will give you the Burglar trait (ability to hotwire cars and less chance to break locks). It cannot be found in stores or libraries, instead it will apear in houses and other locations. It's a very long read.

In this 9th of July 1993 issue of Burglar's Buddy we will show you how to efficiently break through a window, hotwire cars and MORE! Interviews with the best burglars from around Kentucky and the rest of the country!

Update 1.1

Changed the number of pages from 600 to 25, because waiting for things in this game is not fun.


Workshop ID: 2904860811
Mod ID: BurglarBuddy

2894296454.title: Change Sandbox Options (by Star)
2894296454.description:
You can change sandbox options in SINGLEPLAYER during the game.

[h3]Where is it?[/h3]
There is new menu item "Sandbox Options" in the ingame menu.

[h3]Use with Caution[/h3]
This sandbox options window is a workaround and may lead to undefined behavior.  

[b]Best use:[/b] Adjusting mod sandbox settings or light sandbox settings that don't require a game restart. However, even in these cases, functionality is not guaranteed.

[h3]Optional hotkey[/h3]
B41: You need [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]ModOptions[/url] if you want to set hotkey. No hard dependency.
B42: Native.

[h3]Compatibility[/h3]
Compatible with 41.78 and 42+.
It won't work if your game version is below 41.78.

Workshop ID: 2894296454
Mod ID: ChangeSandboxOptionsByStar

2732834772.title: Cheat Menu: Rebirth
2732834772.description:
[h1]There is an update for multiplayer users who disabled DoLuaChecksum. Check out the multiplayer section or changelogs for details. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/changelog/2732834772/1644054289/[/h1] 

[h1]Please [b]READ[/b] this description first [b]BEFORE[/b] using the mod.[/h1]
[h1]Please  [b]DELETE/UNSUBSCRIBE[/b] [u]YOUR OLD CHEAT MENU MOD[/u] OR [u]ANY CHEAT MENU RELATED PLUGIN MOD[/u] [b]BEFORE[/b] USING THE MOD.[/h1]
[h1]THE MOD WILL NOT WORK WITH ANY OTHER CHEAT MENU MODS.[/h1] 


[quote]
[H3][b]Cheat for everything, Cheat for your life.[/b][/h3]

[H1]Cheat Menu: Rebirth (CMRB)[/h1]
[/quote]


[b]Have you been surviving too long and want to do something different, create your own terrain, or safely explore the world of Project Zomboid? 

Your painstaking character is dying, and you want to bring him back to life? 

Are you a person who doesn't like debug mode because it's too complicated, so looking for a way to use cheats outside of it? 

Are you looking for a mod for administrators needed for server management?[/b]


If you answered [b]"YES"[/b] to any of the questions above, then this is the mod you are looking for.


[h1][b][Description][/b][/h1][quote]
Cheat Menu: Rebirth is a redesigned mod that supports the latest version of Project Zomboid (41.65+) and multiplayer.
Following Cheat Menu developed by the developer "[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/123ii854734653463]dude person(ethanwdp)[/url]", I fixed the problems, bugs, and errors reported by numerous users and added various new features.[/quote]


[h1][b][How To Use][/b][/h1]
[quote]
[h3][b]Installation[/b][/h3][olist]
[*]Subscribe and enable this mod in the "Mods" window.
[*]Disable the original "Cheat Menu" if you installed it.[/olist]

[code]If you want to add this mod to an existing save file, please do BACKUP first. And then, on the main screen, click [b]LOAD[/b] -> Select your world -> Click [b]MORE[/b] -> Click [b]Choose Mods[/b] -> Find Cheat Menu: RB and [b]Activate[/b] -> Load your save. [/code]

[h3][b]Single-Play, Co-ops[/b][/h3]
[*]Once the game has loaded, right-click on the screen to see if there is a "Cheat Menu: RB" menu option.
[*]If you see the "Cheat Menu: RB" option, the mod has been installed successfully and is ready to use. Please enjoy :) [/list]

[h3][b]Multiplayer[/b][/h3]
[*] The user must enable the mod by following the steps
[code]Host - manage settings - Edit selected settings (if exists) - Steam Workshop 
(Depending on your default steam language, the mod name may show as different)
https://imgur.com/zsZi9va.png
[/code]
[*] [u]The server owner does not need to get the admin privilege anymore. (1.0.1a~)[/u]
[*] However, other users must have at least the "MODERATOR" privilege. If you are using the lua console, grant permission by entering [i]setAdmin()[/i] or [i]getPlayer():setAccessLevel("<privilege-name>")[/i]
[code]If you are a server owner and want to give admin access to you or others, type [i]/setaccesslevel <username> admin"[/i] on chat. For game master, [i]/setaccesslevel username gm[/i], for moderator, [i]/setaccesslevel username moderator[/i]. [u]*IMPORTANT*[/u] Username is case-sensitive![/code]
[*][b] [u]*IMPORTANT*[/u] If the server you are trying to join does not enable the integrity check (DoLuaChecksum) option, you [b]MUST UNCHECK[/b] the integrity check option (Default is true) in the CMRB mod option before joining. 
DoLuaChecksum is an important feature to prevent hacking. However, you may need to disable it in some circumstances.[/b]
[*]If the above conditions are met, you can use Cheat Menu: RB. Please enjoy :)[/list]
[/quote]

[h1][b][Features][/b][/h1]
[quote]
[*] Old and New Cheat Modes
[*] Spawning door key, Unlock/lock door/window, Repairing window glass
[*] Various terrain features such as Terraforming, Deletion, Zombie creation & deletion, Fire creation & deletion, Barricade creation & deletion
[*] Various combat modes such as Instant Kill (Melee), Infinite ammo, and No Delay Shot
[*] Suicide function (Non-Zombify or Zombify)
[*] Teleportation: coordinate-based and location-based, over 200+ predefined points of interest
[*] In-game time change (single player only)
[*] Creating, deleting, controlling, and repairing items and vehicles
[*] Character skill level change, recipes learning and forgetting
[*] Mood state adjustment
[*] Disabling all cheats in use at once
[*] Easy to exit from terraforming and selection modes
[*] Check privileges and apply & remove cheats depending on changing of status
[*] Remove cheats on character death
[*] Multi-language (EN, KO, CN, DE, PTBR)
[*] More features coming soon...[/list]
[/quote]


[h1][b][Disclaimer][/b][/h1]
[quote]
[b]Cheat Menu: RB might cut the fun of Project Zomboid in half[/b]. Using Cheat Menu: RB is not highly recommended to use normal in-game unless you are a mod developer, need to cheat your own world, explore a dangerous area, or have a specific reason (fun, game feature check, etc.)

The mod developers (RelationLife and the original developer dude person (ethanwdp)) are [b]not responsible for any problems caused by using this mod on a server or own your save file[/b]. Please be sure to make backups a habit. 

Permissions are checked using basic security function elements. However, server administrators MUST TEST THIS MOD BEFORE ADDING IT TO THEIR MAIN SERVERS. 

A way over criticism or "not working" comments without specific explanation will be considered trolling, reported to Steam & Zomboid forum moderators, and permanently deleted.

2763647806.title: Clear description for Moodles
2763647806.description:
[h1]Updated language description for everyone! (Hello World!)[/h1]

Considering that "More Description for Traits" exists, I was surprised nobody made a mod for moodles. I figured it would be quite handy to have this mod alongside it. So I made this little QoL mod. Enjoy!

This mod will display positive and negative effects of moodles whenever you hover your mouse over it, all it does is replace the original description with a more detailed one. All information about moodles has been tested and taken from the game’s code. If anything is wrong or missing do let me know in the comments.

[b]English[/b] – Chillax! + Unamelable

[b]Ukrainian[/b] – Unamelable
[b]Spanish[/b] – Chillax!
[b]Korean[/b] – Hyn
[b]German[/b] – MrStriker81

[b]Chinese[/b] – Surgeol

[b]Polish[/b] – DajmondFM/realvelrin/Krukiness

[h1]Adding/editing translations:[/h1]

Allows you to save clothing presets, reload them, dress and undress in a click.

[*]All is accessible from the Character Protection Page.
[*]When you load a preset or undress, the removed clothes got to the target loot container.
[*]Presets are based on item types and not on actual item instance as instance is very difficult to track accross MP and game reload.

[*]All is accessible from the Character Protection Page.

2635550102.description:
[h2]Info[/h2]
- Work with latest version.
- Work with multiplayer.
- Work with existing savegame.

[h2]FAQ[/h2]
[b]Where can I find a Computer?[/b]
You can find computer at the military base, military outpost and Louisville offices.

[b]How does the computer work?[/b]
Make sure it has a power source then turn it on with right-click menu.
Insert Game CD and play it.

[b]What can I do with a computer during the apocalypse?[/b]
Start a game collection and play game to help your depression.

[b]Where do I find games?[/b]
Living rooms bookshelves, wardrobes, lockers, electronic stores, mailbox...

[b]I have a Game CD but no game on it?[/b]
If you have a Game CD without a game name, right click it in your inventory it will assign a random game.

[b]Do I need all gamepack?[/b]
You do not need any gamepack, the main mod Computer already add games. Game packs are optional.

[b]Disabling game packs[/b]

2625625421.title: Containers!
2625625421.description:
This time something for base builders out there! ISO Containers!

Containers are perfect for storing heavy things, vehicles parts, unused furniture etc... Gas tanks have all the functions of a gas tanker trailer. Perfect for large backups of gas in your base. They will spawn all around the world, containers mostly in McCoy spawns and tanks in fossoil spawns. 

They can be towed with vehicles but are slow. They are not meant to be used as trailers so don't load them up and try to drive, it will not go well. Also use something else than a Dart to tow it please.

[*]B41 / B42 Compatible
[*]Animated doors / removable objects
[*]You can use it in your current save game, just enable the mod in the load menu
[*]It can be towed
[*]Not recolorable
[*]You will need the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2392709985]Tsar's Common Library[/url] for fuel storage in B41 to work
[/list][/b]

so I don't fall asleep while making new mods and supporting old ones :)

2892795238.title: Coryerdon or Dirkerdam to OTR road
2892795238.description:
[h1]Welcome! Roads are cool![/h1]
Simply put, this map connects Dirkerdam or Coryerdon to Over the River. There's also a spawn point, and the map can sustain itself somewhat via foraging, fishing, rummaging through the various buildings, etc.

[h1]Features![/h1]
[list]
[*] 40 custom buildings, with some being based on real locations from my childhood.
[*] In game map support, with POIs such as a grocery store, gas station, book store, etc.
[*] Forest trails (hidden on map) w/shelter houses, fishing holes, wells, and stuff!
[*] One spawn point, but in a tight spot resource-wise for a little challenge.
[*] Vehicle spawns, working foraging, some great spots for secluded bases, and more.
[/list]

[h1]Please realize...[/h1]
My main connecting road goes to the very edge of its cells without obstructions, besides zombies of course. There isn't anything I can do about how the other map authors treat their roads. So for now, you'll want to move/destroy those road blocks on the edge of Coryerdon, and clear out some trees and maybe even lay concrete down on the edge of Over the River. If you choose Dirkerdam instead of Coryerdon, it's a clean seamless connection.

I chose not to overwrite the adjoining cell of Over the River or Coryerdon as this would require a specific map load order to line everything up, and that would surely cause confusion, not to mention I didn't feel comfortable with overlaying my work onto someone else's.

[h1]Huge ass thanks to Daddy Dirkie Dirk[/h1]
...his videos were absolutely critical in learning how to pull all this off, thanks dude. Also want to thank TIS, what an awesome game!

Cells used - 35x19 35x20 36x19 36x20
Known map conflicts - Liberty City, which also conflicts w/Coryerdon and Dirkerdam.

2782415851.title: Coryerdon-科里尔登
2782415851.description:
coryerdon-科里尔登
坐落于河畔东部跨河城市，总面积约为路易斯维尔的五分之三。
僵尸密度较高，主要集中于城区入口，难度较高，前期略高于路易斯维尔
物资主要集中于城区，郊区有一个军事基地，拥有较多的河边别墅，更适用于多人联机以及服务器的安全屋设置。
城区更类似于小型渡鸦港，高楼较多，总体物资量与路易斯维尔大致持平.

Located in the river crossing city in the east of the river, the total area is about three fifths of Louisville.
The density of zombies is high, mainly concentrated at the entrance of the urban area, which is more difficult, and it is slightly higher than Louisville in the early stage
The materials are mainly concentrated in the urban area. There is a military base in the suburbs, with more riverside villas, which is more suitable for multi person online and server safe house settings.
The urban area is more similar to the small Raven harbor, with many tall buildings, and the overall material volume is roughly the same as that of Louisville

2744114761.title: Craft Engine Parts
2744114761.description:
[hr][/hr][h1]Craft Spare Engine Parts yourself![/h1]

This mod adds the magazine "[i]The Machinist[/i]". Find it and read it! This adds [u]three different recipes[/u] for making spare engine parts. Alternatively, you can unlock them by reaching a certain level in each required skill without ever reading the magazine (B42+ only).
[olist]
[*]Needs metal working skill and more metal parts
[*]Needs mechanics skill and some additional uncommon parts
[*]Needs electronics skill and additional electronic parts
[/olist]
It can be used for single player but the true reason I created this is multiplayer. Because often vehicles of entire towns are stripped of their engines to get these juicy spare parts, and this mod is meant to help with exactly this issue.

[h3]Version and language support[/h3]
This mod is compatible with B41 & B42. It is safe to add or remove in existing games. In version 1.3 English, German, Russian, French, Spanish (ES and AR), Traditional Chinese, Hungarian, Italian, Dutch, Polish, and Portuguese (PTBR) are supported, but on player requests and with a little help I will definitely add more.

[h3]Future of the mod[/h3]
As B42 progresses, crafting is expected to get a great revamp, and a lot more recipes and items will be added. In response to this, the recipes in this mod will likely be changed in the future to better match B42's new crafting system.

[h3]Reuploading and modpacks[/h3]
For server owners it can be very useful to have their own modpack. That's why I allow reuploads of my mod as part of a modpack for a server if credit is given and if the modpack is unlisted on steam and only shared with the server members. Under all other circumstances please abstain from reoploads.

[h1]Important: balancing settings[/h1]

When installing the mod, it comes as four separate ones named "expensive - original", "moderate", "cheap", and "cheapest". These four mods all do basically the same, but the cost, results, and requirements of the crafting recipes are hugely different as can be seen in the images above. This allows you to choose a difficulty, how much impact you want this mod to have on your gameplay, and how much you would like to spare those poor car engines from looting.
Only choose and activate one of the four mods. If more are activated, it won't break the game, but it will cause a recipe redundancy.

I chose to implement difficulty / balancing settings this way and not via actual options within a single mod in order to prevent the need to add the ModOptions mod as a dependency. I have done this to avoid breaking people's save games and servers which already used the CEP mod before Version 1.2 and haven't got the ModOptions mod.

[hr][/hr][i]Workshop ID: 2744114761
Mod ID: CraftEngineParts / CraftEnginePartsModerate / CraftEnginePartsCheap / CraftEnginePartsCheapest

[u]Also check  out:[/u] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3401280772]Simple Rolling Papers[/url] [/i]

2787291513.title: Craft Helper Continued
2787291513.description:
[h1]Craft Helper for build 41.65+[/h1]

This is an updated version of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2186592938]Craft Helper (41.x) by b1n0m[/url] (not required) with additional features and improved UI.

This mod will add a "Craft Helper" context menu option when right-clicking on any item with associated recipes.
Selecting that will bring up a UI with list of recipes that this item is part of, as well as ways to craft this item.
Selecting a recipe will show information about it (required items, skills etc). Result icon and required items are right-clickable.
Detailed information about interface can be found under ⓘ (info) symbol next to close button.

Apart from item tab, there is also two common tabs:
[list]
[*] Search tab, where you can find all items and recipes
[*] Favorite tab, where you can find all your favorite items and recipes
[/list]

Safe to add/remove to/from existing saves
Should be compatible with all mods and MP (except [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=3122080147]beta version[/url])

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Features:[/h2]
[list]
[*]Close window on ESC
[*]Category selector. Select desired category and filter that huge list of recipes.
[*]Window position saved to config. No more hassle with resizing/moving!
[*]Search bar. Supports custom rules (click on magnifier)
[*]Buttons to order list by name or type
[*]Ability to favorite recipes and items. Even unknown ones!
[*]Presets for favorite recipes and items.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Options ([url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url] required to change):[/h2]
[list]
[*] Enable custom rules for search (by default ON)
[*] Show icons of items in list (ON)
[*] Show hidden items/recipes (OFF)
[*] Close all tabs on close (OFF)
[*] Select font size for items in list (Medium)
[*] Modifier keys (Shift, Ctrl) for some keybinds (all None)
[*] Show recipe origin (Mod) (ON)
[*] Show favorite items in inventories (OFF)
[*] Enable editable category selector (OFF)
[*] Delayed search (Need to press Enter to perform search) (OFF)
[*] Behaviour when right-clicking items in inventory (only "Craft Helper" option)
[*] Window opacity (80%)
[*] Scroll speed (100 ms)
[/list]
Also, with "Mod Options" you can set keybinds (Key bindings -> Craft Helper) for some actions.

[hr][/hr]
[h3]Supported languages:[/h3]
[list]
[*]English
[*]Russian
[*]Spanish
[*]Thai
[*]Korean
[*]Brazilian Portuguese
[*]Traditional Chinese
[*]Polish
[*]German
[*]Italian

[*]French

[/list]

If you would like to help with translation, please go to Crowdin page:
[url=https://crowdin.com/project/craft-helper-continued][img]https://i.postimg.cc/0NPptXbN/localization-at-white-rounded-bordered-1x.png[/img][/url]


[h3]Thanks to everyone who made this mod better![/h3]
[list][*][url=https://github.com/lanceris/pz_crafthelper/blob/main/CONTRIBUTORS.md]List of contributors[/url][/list]

[url=https://github.com/lanceris/pz_crafthelper]Source code[/url]

3197857648.title: Decoholic
3197857648.description:
[h1]Overview :[/h1]
There may be multiple patterns of furniture overlay graphics, but the patterns are defined per coordinate, not per item. Therefore, when you bring furniture back to your base and place it there, you may see a different graphic than the first time you picked it up. This mod solves that problem and allows free selection of overlay graphics for furniture. And for world-placed items other than Moveable, the placement position can be adjusted.
[b][i]Confirmed to work with Build 41/42.[/i][/b]

[h1]Features - 1.Change Furniture Display :[/h1]
You can change the overlay graphic freely by following the steps below.

[img]https://imgur.com/KxT9P0m.png[/img]
(1) Execute "Change furniture display" from the item or world context menu.

[img]https://imgur.com/RHS8pQg.png[/img]
(2) You can select the graphics to display from the configuration window.
[list]
[*]Press the "Select" button below the graphic you want to display.
[*]The currently selected graphic will be marked with a red circle icon in the upper right corner.
[*]"Default" will return to the original display mode. In this setting, the graphics displayed will change depending on the coordinates of the placement.
[/list]

[h1]Features - 2.Adjust Item Position :[/h1]
You can adjust the placed item position by following the steps below.

[img]https://imgur.com/0oqM9m5.png[/img]
(1) Execute "Adjust item position" from the world item context menu.

[img]https://imgur.com/SHLOYDw.png[/img]
(2) You can change the item positions and rotations from the adjust position window.
[list]
[*]"--" button : Decrease value a lot.
[*]"-" button : Decrease value a little.
[*]"C" button : Clear value to zero.
[*]"+" button : Increase value a little.
[*]"++" button : Increase value a lot.
[/list]

[h1]Options :[/h1]
These options are available in Sandbox Options.
[list]
[*]Meta > Enable Adjust Item Position : Enables Adjust Item Position. This option is intended for cases where you want to limit this features to users in MP.
[/list]

[h1]Q&A :[/h1]
[list]
[*][h2]Which furniture can I select graphics?[/h2]
This includes container-type furniture such as shelves and furniture with overlay graphics such as chairs covered with sheets.

[*][h2]Can furniture from other mods be made to work?[/h2]
It's possible, although it needs to be handled individually. Please request the mod name.

[*][h2]How do I do a piece of large furniture that has been divided?[/h2]
You can select graphics in each divided part.

[*][h2]What happens if I rotate the furniture?[/h2]
If the furniture is rotated, it will be processed as a different item. Therefore, please select the graphics for each direction. However, if the same direction is made again, the previous selection is kept.

[*][h2]Already I have been selected, but before I know it, it's back to the default display..?[/h2]
It may have reverted to the default display for an unknown reason. Try moving items in and out or re-placing furniture.
[/list]

[h1]Supported Mods :[/h1]
This mod supports overlay images added by the following mods.
[list]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3282215361]Functional Clothesline[/url]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2877535263]My So-Called Snack[/url]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3183799205]Pineville[/url]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2890440427]Pump Pury[/url]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2961722002]Tile Fixes[/url]
[/list]

[h1]Known Issues :[/h1]
[list]
[*]If the overlay graphic of the oven has been changed, there is a problem with the overlay graphics disappearing when the device is turned on or off. In this case, the graphics will not be restored unless it is manually changed again.
[*]The menu of sinks does not appear in the world context menu. However, this is due to the vanilla implementation and cannot be resolved at this time. If you wish to change the display of a sink, please pick it up once and then execute the change process from the item context menu.
[*]If an item is removed from a square that contains an item whose height (Z) has been changed by the Item Adjust Position feature, the height of other items in the same square will be restored. This is a vanilla specification, but I'm considering how to handle this on the mod side.
[/list]

[h1]Future plans :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Bug fix (if it exists)
[/list]

[h1]Remarks :[/h1]
[list]
[*]This mod requires that "DISPLAY > Textures > Double-sized Textures" in GAME OPTIONS is ON. If this option is OFF, the correct size will not be displayed. I don't plan to support this option now, but I will consider it if there are enough requests.
[/list]

[h1]Release Notes :[/h1]
[list]
[*]v1.13 - Compatible with Build 42.
[*]v1.12 - Added Sandbox Options.
[*]v1.11 - Added ContextSubMenu, Added translation (RU), Supported Pineville Mod.
[*]v1.10 - Supported Functional Clothesline Mod.
[*]v1.9 - Supported Tile Fixes Mod.
Please refer to "Change Notes" for the older history.
[/list]

[code]
If you enjoy this mod and would like to support its development, you can do so through the services below. Your support helps keep me motivated and allows me to continue improving and updating the mod. All contributions will be used for development purposes, such as AI service subscriptions. 

[url=https://buymeacoffee.com/pepepepepeil][img]https://imgur.com/7QRjOtP.png[/img][/url]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/pepepepepeil][img]https://i.imgur.com/ULMwSUt.png[/img][/url]
[/code]

Workshop ID: 3197857648
Mod ID: P4Decoholic

2981571303.title: Definitive Zombies B41 (No Longer Supported)
2981571303.description:
[h1]NOTICE[/h1]
This is for B41. I have stopped updating this mod in favour of a code revamp and focusing on B42. Discussion boards and comments will be left up in case people need help/troubleshooting.

If you are looking for B42, an early version can be found here:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3415451766


[h1]What is this mod?[/h1]
This mod seeks to combine the multitude of zombie stat modifying mods into one cohesive package. If you prefer how another mod handles a zombie stat, you can disable the corresponding stat in Definitive Zombies.

Definitive Zombies comes with a "realistic" preset so you do not have to adjust any settings:
[list]
[*][b]Daylight[/b] gives a boost to the zombie's sight and memory
[*][b]Night[/b] lowers zombies sight and memory. They gain a boost to their hearing
[*][b]Temperature[/b] slows the zombies down when the weather reaches 0C (32F)
[*][b]Fog[/b] greatly reduces the zombie's sight and memory
[*][b]Rain[/b] reduces the zombies sight and hearing, heavier rain affects their memory as well
[*][b]Snow[/b] reduces the zombies sight and memory
[*][b]Clouds[/b] slightly reduces the zombie's sight and memory
[*][b]Wind[/b] will reduce the zombie's hearing ability
[*][b]Moon[/b] phases negates the negatives of the [b]night[/b] when a full moon appears, boosting the zombies sight and memory
[*][b]Entropy[/b] will cause zombies to degrade depending on the number of days the world has existed.

[/list]
There are other stats which are turned off by default:
[list]
[*][b]Time[/b] of day will affect zombie's stats, this is set up with a dawn/dusk cycle
[*][b]Randomisation[/b] contains a suite of settings to randomise the zombies. Want 5% of sprinters to ignore the temperature? This is the setting for you
[/list]

[h1]Compatible[/h1]
Braven's Camouflage
Horde Night
Here They Come!
Please Don't Feed The Zombies
Random Rally
Calm Before The Storm
Fear The Sun
Wandering zombies

[h2]Partially Compatible[/h2]
[b]Under Cover of Darkness[/b]
Disable "Sight" on Definitive Zombies
[b]CDDA Zombies[/b]
Disable "Speed", "Strength", "Cognition" and "Toughness"
[b]Random Zombies[/b]
If you want the "speed" settings from random zombies, disable "Enable Speed" on Definitive Zombies
If you modify "fragile" and "tough" from random zombies, disable "Enable Toughness" on Definitive Zombies
If you modify "smart" on random zombies, disable "Enable Cognition" on Definitive Zombies
[b]Night Zombies[/b]
Disable everything except for "Strength" (just disable DZ at this point)

[h2]Incompatible[/h2]
Persistent Zombies
Reactive Zombies
[h2]Unknown Compatibility[/h2]


Workshop ID: 2981571303
Mod ID: DefinitiveZombies

3134776712.title: Descriptive Tooltips for Skill Levels
3134776712.description:
[h1]Updated February 24th 2024 :[/h1]
[list]
[*] Added Russian translation.
[*] Added Korean translation.
[*] Added partial Spanish translation (~90% complete).
[/list]

[h1]Updated January 28th 2024 :[/h1]
[list]
[*] Added Polish translation.
[*] Added simplified Chinese translation.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Update: January 16th 2024 :[/h1]
[list]
[*] Added support for Artillery skill (from [u][url=]Snake's Modpack - Ammo Maker Reloaded)[/url][/u].
[*] Added support for Hunting skill (from [u][url=]Snake's Modpack - Le Gourmet Revolution)[/url][/u].
[*] Added support for [u][url=]Lockpicking skill[/url][/u].
[*] Added support for [u][url=]Driving skill[/url][/u].
[*] Added support for Archery skill (from [u][url=]Bow and arrow[/url][/u]).
[*] Translations are now OPEN.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Update: January 13th 2024 :[/h1]
[list]
[*] Added support for [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2944004910]Woodcutting skill[/url][/u].
[*] Added support for [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2903135820]Scavenging skill[/url][/u].
[*] Added support for Tinkering skill (from [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2932853467]Weapon Modifiers[/url][/u]).
[*] fixed typos.
[*] made more text translatable.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
This mod adds tooltips for each skill levels, detailing the stat gains, builds and recipes unlocked by that specific level, as well as other information/abilities relative to that skill level.

This way, new players can have an easier time learning the game, and honestly, even the majority of experienced players will learn something new from this mod.

The tooltips are displayed when hovering over a skill level with the mouse, in the skills tab of the character info window.

The info available in these tooltips is based on a combination of my own knowledge, the game's non-exposed Java files (that I learned how to decompile), the game's exposed Lua files, the wiki of PZ, and Trombonaut's videos.

If you notice a typo, or know of an effect that is not listed, or spot something that is wrong or poorly worded, please leave a comment in one of the discussions to point it out to me. I don't think I got every single effect that could be listed, and I may have made a mistake somewhere, so I'm relying on you guys for that.

This mod was made so it can easily be supported by other Skill mods, as well as dynamic trait mods.

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Crafting recipes requiring Skills[/h1]
Crafting recipes unlocked from one (or two) skills are dynamically added to each skill level tooltip.
This means that crafting recipes from mods (such as Scrap Weapons for example) will also show up on the tooltip.
Crafting recipes requiring 3 or more different skills will not show up.
Also, only 10 recipes per tooltip will show up.

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Buildable constructions requiring Skills[/h1]
Due to how messy the building system is, only vanilla constructions are displayed in the tooltips. Modded constructions (such as More Builds mod for example) will not be displayed.

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Foraging stats & info[/h1]
For the Foraging skill, the information of what each level unlocks is taken directly from the foraging system of the game, which means it will account for potential additions or tweaks from mods (such as Soul Fisher's Foraging time for example).

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Fishing stats[/h1]
For the Fishing skill, the fishing stats are calculated with the chosen Nature Abundance as well as the current time of day and current season.

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Future plans[/h1]
Support for more modded skills.
Currently working on : Driving Skill , Artillery Skill, Hunting Skill.
Will next work on : Lockpicking skill , Archery skill. Maybe Gunsmith skill .

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Translations[/h1]
I am not opening translations until this mod has been out for a week at the very least. This is so I can correct as many things as possible in the first week, otherwise the translations could be wrong.

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
Mods that change skill tooltips will probably not be compatible with this mod.
This mod uses the ISSkillProgressBar:updateTooltip(lvlSelected) and ISSkillProgressBar:render() methods. That's it.

[hr][/hr]

Workshop ID: 3134776712
Mod ID: DescriptiveSkillTooltips

3162507273.title: Dig Worms
3162507273.description:
[h1]Say goodbye to worm furrows.[/h1]
Worms in Project Zomboid are versatile little fellows. You can use them as bait in fishing, in trapping, you can even eat them if you're desperate; they never perish, and they don't require crawling around "foraging" with crippled view cone, exposing yourself to a sudden bite from behind.
However, what they do require... is digging.
How many times did you dig furrows purely to get some worms? How many times have you been wondering why there's no "Remove furrow" cursor, and gone ahead removing them one by one via context menu?
If the answer is "one time too many", then this mod is for you.

[h1]What does it do exactly?[/h1]
It adds a new context menu option: "Dig Worms". Once you select it, your character will dig the same patch of ground until you decide you have enough worms (or until a stray zombie gnaws on their neck from behind). Zero unneeded furrows will be produced. Only worms and exhaustion.
You will need a shovel though, or anything that digs.

[h1]But is it balanced?[/h1]
See for yourself:
[list]
[*]One iteration of worm digging takes exactly as long as digging furrow and removing it would.
[*]Calorie consumption is unchanged.
[*]Exhaustion is unchanged.
[*]Chance to get a worm per digging iteration is [strike]unchanged[/strike] [b]slightly increased[/b] when it's raining (because it makes sense).
[/list]
One thing that's gone is monotonous button pressing. You're welcome.

[h1]Still not convinced?[/h1]
You can keep digging worms the old-fashioned way - but that doesn't mean I can't help you. This mod also adds a "Remove furrow" cursor.
From now on, "Remove" function, apart from just removing a furrow, produces a cursor that you can use to quickly remove furrows you don't need.

[h1]Translations[/h1]
This mod is AI-translated to all available languages. I don’t have the ability to comprehend the quality of translation - but if you see that things don’t look right on your language, I’d appreciate your contribution.

[h1]Special thanks[/h1]
[list]
[*]Tchernobill - his "Auto" series was an inspiration for this mod.
[*]Poltergeist - for his amazing auto translation tool that I believe every PZ modder should use.
[*]Burryaga - for his numerous advice and thorough code review. Modders together strong.
[*]You - if you like, subscribe and/or favorite this mod.
[/list]

[h1]Like this?[/h1]
Try my other mod - [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3175536048]To-Do List[/url]! It allows you to keep your shopping list in a simple, yet convenient UI instead of scribbling it on your map (or the IRL piece of paper). Never forget to grab some milk again with To-Do List!

Workshop ID: 3162507273
Mod ID: digworms

2891779083.title: Dive Through Windows
2891779083.description:
You've jumped through windows, but now you can dive through windows like a badass!
Uses the sprinting fence-hop animations instead of the window climb animation.

Unofficial successor to the Jump Through Windows mod

Thank you for 100k subs!

Approved by Nurse 😁

[h2]Features:[/h2]
[list]
[b]NEW[/b] (1/28/2023)
[*] This mod now fixes edge case bugs that are in the original Jump Through Windows mod

(12/02/2022)
[*] Realistic roll animation chance + new diving animation!
[*] Train your Nimble skill or take Graceful to reduce your chance of falling and rolling.

[*] [b]Sprint (left-alt by default)[/b] towards windows to smash through them.
[*] Detailed injury model
[*] Get a good headstart; not dashing long enough will bounce you back.
[*] Building up a lot to the dive reduces injury risk from smashing into windows.
[*] Running skill, Nimble skill, and armor protection lower the risk of injury.
[*] Traits also affect your window-diving experience. (Overweight, Graceful, Thick Skin, etc.)
[*] Tap Sprint while walking into an open window to safely climb it.
[*] Tested to work in MP
[*] Sandbox custom settings; decrease or increase injury chances or even roll animation chance to your liking
[/list]

Sprint (not run) to dive through windows in your path.
For the best experience, I recommend for Sprint to be rebound to Ctrl and to uncheck the 'Toggle _ key to Sprint' in settings.

Can be added to and removed from existing saves.

Do [b]not[/b] use with the Jump Through Windows mod at the same time; it may lead to conflicts

Workshop ID: 2891779083
Mod ID: diveThroughWindows

2602450182.description:
Gives the player the ability to repair the vehicle heater and glove box.

Repairing vehicle heaters is accomplished as normal, using small metal sheets and a propane torch.

For repairing glove boxes there are three available repair options. The duct tape and glue options are actually provided as part of the vanilla game but not normally available. The metalworking option is added by this mod to provide a less costly option.

2925034918.title: Easy Laundry
2925034918.description:
Adds options to Washers and Dryers to quickly load dirty, bloody, or wet clothes and quickly unload and reequip them.

[b]Load Carried Clothes[/b] will load clothes in your character's inventory and in equipped bags except the clothes you are currently wearing.
[b]Load Worn Clothes[/b] will load clothes your character is currently wearing.
[b]Load All[/b] will load both carried and worn clothes.

Only clothes that are dirty or bloody will be loaded into Washers.
Only clothes that are wet will be loaded into Dryers.
Dirty, bloody, or wet clothes will be loaded into Combination Washer/Dryers.

[b]Unload[/b] will take all the clothes in the machine and put them in your main inventory.
[b]Unload and Wear[/b] will take all the clothes in the machine and equip them to your character (even if they are wet from the wash).

Chinese translations courtesy of why u camping me & aneBlack
Russian translations courtesy of Runa

2582648054.title: Easy Lightbar Repair
2582648054.description:
Updated June 21, 2024: Fixed a bug where the lightbar would not be repaired if the condition was already 96% or higher. Lowered the skill requirements slightly and roughly doubled the condition increase for the number of parts needed.


Gives the player the ability to repair the lightbar if a vehicle has one.

How to repair a lightbar:

1. Raise your Electrical skill to the level listed in the tool tip. This will vary by vehicle type and will be one level below what is required for the Mechanics skill to work on the engine, or level 5, whichever is less. If the current condition of the lightbar is 0%, this requirement will be increased by one level of the Electrical skill (but capped at level 6).
2. Collect the needed parts to repair in your inventory. This includes Electronics Scrap, and Electric Wire. If the current condition of the lightbar is 0%, you will also need two (plain, without a named color) Light Bulbs and one Amplifier.
3. Open the Vehicle Mechanics menu and right-click on the Lightbar in the parts list.
4. Click on the "Repair" option in the context menu.

The lightbar's condition will be increased according to how many Spare Electrical Parts and Wire you have in your inventory. Currently this is set to a 10% condition increase for every 5 Electronics Scrap and 1 Electric Wire.

Written for and tested only in Project Zomboid version 41.53. Updated for Project Zomboid 41.78.16. All other versions are untested.

Workshop ID: 2582648054
Mod ID: EasyLightbarRepair

2841030649.title: Eggon's Worthwhile Cars 2.0
2841030649.description:
[h3][b]FEATURES HIGHLIGHT - ALL FEATURES ARE OPTIONAL![/b][/h3]
★ Tweak impact of damage on trunks' capacity - prevent capacity reduction, slow it down or speed it up!
★ Adjust capacity of trunks for all cars (both modded and vanilla (with exceptions listed in Compatibility section)) - choose [b][i]Eggon's Capacity Balance[/i][/b] and/or use multiplier to further modify capacities accross the board!
★ Balance cars' loudness according to their size (type has an effect too) from lowest (Chavalier Dart) to highest (Chevalier Step Van & Chevalier Cosette).
★ Balance cars' engine force to make things more interesting

- everything is available through Sandbox Settings.
[h3][b]TWEAKING DAMAGE EFFECT ON CAPACITY[/b][/h3]
Adjust the value of [b][i]Capacity loss rate multiplier[/i][/b] setting to change the effect of damage on trunks' capacities. You can set the multiplier to:
1) Zero - to block capacity reduction (DEFAULT)
2) Number between 0 and 1 - to proportionally slow down capacity loss.
3) 1 - to keep the vanilla rate.
4) Number above 1 to proportionally increase capacity loss.
[h3][b]EGGON'S CAPACITY BALANCE[/b][/h3]
This setting will change the trunk sizes proportionally to car size ranging from 25 (Chavalier Dart) to 300 (Chevalier Step Van) for the vanilla cars. See one of the Steam page slides to find capacities of all vanilla cars. For large trucks from different mods capacity might be even higher.
[h3][b]CUSTOM CAPACITIES TWEAKING[/b][/h3]
Adjust the value of [b][i]Capacity multiplier[/i][/b] setting to further change the capacities of ALL trunks. The adjustment will be applied on top of vanilla trunk sizes or on top of [b][i]Eggon's Capacity Balance[/i][/b] if you selected it. Multiplier of value 1 means no change is applied. Value below 1 means proportionally smaller trunks, value above 1 - proportionally larger.
[h3][b]EGGON'S LOUDNESS BALANCE[/b][/h3]
This setting modifies cars' loudness proportionally to their size. The larger the car, the louder it will be. Sports cars, such as Chevalier Cosette will be loud too. See the relative loudness of cars on one of Steam page's slides.

Range of cars' loudness is the same as in vanilla, however it is allocated differently to various cars. Some cars are louder, some more silent than in vanilla (most cars are slighlty more silent). Large trucks from other mods might be ca. 8% louder than the max vanilla level.
[h3][b]EGGON'S ENGINE POWER BALANCE[/b][/h3]
This setting influences power of a few cars to add additional flavors. Pickups and some cars with light bars get more power, so will be better for towing and trailers. Station Wagons will get less, to offset theit excellent loudness to capacity ratio. They will be sluggish and you should avoid driving them offroad especially when having the "Sunday Driver" trait.
[h3][b]COMPATIBILITY[/b][/h3]
EWC 2.0 should be compatible with all modded cars! (unless someone did something really crazy ;) ) In particular this means that [b]all modded cars[/b] will be impacted by [b][i]Capacity Multiplier[/i][/b] and [b][i]Capacity Loss Multiplier[/i][/b]. Also there should be no more clashes with mods modifying vehicle files (like [b][i]Refrigerated Spiffo Van[/i][/b] and [b][i]Vanilla Vehicle Enhancer[/i][/b]), because EWC 2.0 does not modify these files.

However, if you decide to choose [b][i]Eggon's Balance[/i][/b] the configuration of the cars for this balance might not be yet implemented, because there are LOTS of modded cars. I will do my best to add the configurations for at least a few most popular mods. It will also be possible to make plugins to EWC 2.0 to create your own balances for any cars and/or cover mods not covered by me.

Confirmed compatible mods:
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1896907770]Filibuster Rhymes' Used Cars[/url] - compatible - full balance is added!
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/KI5/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]KI5's cars[/url] - compatible, full balance is added.
- [b]Shark and Cytt Kentucky Car Overhaul[/b] - compatible (based on a few tested cars). As it overwrites vanilla cars, Eggon's Balances for vanilla cars can be applied.
- [b]fhqwhgads vehicles[/b] - compatible (based on a few tested cars). No balance is provided.
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2281256511]Paint Your Ride[/url] - compatible
- [b]Autotsar's Trailers[/b] - compatible No balance is provided.

Please let me know if you identify any compatibility issues and if you can confirm other mods that you use to be compatible - I'll add them to the list.
[h3][b]PLUGINS TO EWC 2.0 FROM OTHER CREATORS[/b][/h3]
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2846495827]Trunk Capacity Bonus Addon[/url] by UdderlyEvelyn
[h3][b]SWITCHING FROM EWC to EWC 2.0[/b][/h3]
To switch from original [b][i]Eggon's Worthwhile Cars[/i][/b] mod to the [b][i]2.0[/i][/b] version just remove [b][i]EWC[/i][/b] and add [b][i]EWC 2.0[/i][/b] with support mods to your savegame!
[h3][b]EXISTING SAVES AND MULTIPLAYER[/b][/h3]
The mod should work with existing saves. All new values should be immediatelly applied. I expect the mod to work on MP. The mod will be added to a savegame with default settings. See below for limitations on changing the settings in an existing game.
[h3][b]CHANGING SANDBOX SETTINGS MID GAME[/b][/h3]
After settings are changed, game needs to be reloaded. Changes to capacity and loudness should get applied after reload. Turning off [b][i]Eggon's Engine Force Balance[/i][/b] will not work for cars already interacted with. Therefore if you're planning to turn it off after adding EWC 2.0 to your savegame, do so when not standing next to a car. This way you will prevent this balance from being applied.
[h3][b]REPORTING BUGS / KNOWN ISSUES[/b][/h3]
Additional trunks attached to cars (eg. roof racks) and or non-standard trunks of modded cars might display unmodified capacity in the mechanics menu. They should displayed correct, modified capacity in the loot menu.

Please post any other bug reports [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2841030649/3459345750020191245/]here[/url].
[h3][b]REQUIREMENTS[/b][/h3]
Two support mods are required:
1) My support mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2617575303]Eggon's Modding Utils[/url] and
2) [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1430463738]Vehicle Tweaker API[/url] - by [b][i]soulfilcher[/i][/b]
[h3][b]HOW IS THE MOD DIFFERENT THAN THE ORIGINAL EGGON'S WORTHWHILE CARS?[/b][/h3]
EWC was my first mod, I knew nothing about modding PZ. The design therefore was simple and not without drawbacks. EWC 2.0 comes to address those issues:
1) All features are now optional
2) Capacities and capacity loss rate can be now smoothly adjusted
3) Cars created by other modders can be adjusted too
4) There should be no more compatibility issues with car mods
5) EWC 2.0 should be much less prone to issues resulting with PZ updates changing desing of vehicles.
[h3][b]SUPPORT ME[/b][/h3]
If you appreciate my content and want to encourage me to deliver more... consider supporting me on Ko-Fi or Patreon! Also check out [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198093590691/myworkshopfiles/?section=items&appid=108600]my other mods![/url] :)

🎨 Ellie's Tattoo Parlor
Transform your apocalypse with style!

Ellie's Tattoo Parlor is here to bring personality and flair to your survivors in Project Zomboid. Whether you want a subtle, meaningful tattoo or a full sleeve to intimidate the undead, this mod adds customizable tattoos to spice up your gameplay.

🖤 Features:
Customizable Tattoos: Choose from a variety of tattoos to express yourself in the apocalypse.
Immersive Design: Carefully crafted tattoos that blend seamlessly with the game's aesthetic.
Roleplay Ready: Perfect for those who want to add depth and story to their survivors.

💡 How It Works:
Find Ellie's Tattoo Parlor in your game world, select your design, and let your creativity shine. Whether you're playing solo or in multiplayer, these tattoos are bound to leave a mark—literally.

🙌 Support My Work!
If you love this mod and want to support its development or future updates, consider buying me a coffee! Your support means the world and helps keep the ink flowing.

3022165560.title: Elliot Pond
3022165560.description:
Welcome to Elliot Pond

Elliot Pond In the summer, the sandy shores of Elliot Pond are a lovely place to sunbathe. In autumn, the famous fall colours are on full display. In the spring, hike, bike, or ride the trails around Elliot Pond to enjoy the flora, fauna and beautiful lookout points. Elliot Pond is a community that combines the hospitality of a small town with the services of a larger, urban centre. The pristine wilderness and thousands of lakes that surround the area provide residents and visitors with many opportunities for hiking, camping and fishing.

You will find everything that you could ever need/want during a zombie outbreak in this map from nice and quiet  suburbs, a robust and varied shopping district, as well as decent industrial zones. 


Over 300 Buildings all of which are custom built and decorated for you to explore, and survive in. 

This map is compatible with the current versions of Eerie County, and Raven Creek. Anything else down in that area i'am not 100% sure about as i haven't tested every map out there. If there are compatibility issues please let me know and ill see what i can do.




P.S. Sorry about all the tile requirements i kinda got excited and went overboard. But hey isn't variety the spice of life?

2950902979.title: Equipment UI - Paper Doll Equipment Interface [B42/41]
2950902979.description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/w5yeFNP.png[/img]

[h1]Equipment UI[/h1]
Equipment UI is an addition to Project Zomboids interface that adds a paper doll (STALKER / tArKov inspired) equipment panel for managing and viewing your character's equipment.

[i][b]Use mod options to hide equipped items from your inventory.[/b][/i]

[h3][i]Part 2 - NOW AVAILABLE [/i][/h3]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2982070344][img]https://i.imgur.com/agDCBaI.png[/img][/url]


[h3]Drag and Drop[/h3]
Drag and Drop items to and from the equipment ui to easily adjust your equipment!
Equipment slots will highlight and change color to visualize conflicting equipment.

[h3]Customize Your Layout[/h3]
The equipment window can be detached and positioned anywhere. It will follow and collapse with the inventory when it is attached. The layout is saved between sessions.

[h3]Hotkey[/h3]
Includes a customizable control for opening/closing the Equipment UI. The keyboard control can be adjusted in the game's regular control options. The controller binding can be changed via Mod Options.
The keyboard defaults to comma.
The controller defaults to SELECT (or LS/L3 if using [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2922618524&searchtext=wookie]Wookiee Gamepad Support[/url])


[h3]Mod Options[/h3]
Install mod options to adjust the mod to your liking!
Hide equipped items from your inventory and change the scale of the Equipment UI!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/31mCw6B.gif[/img]

[h1]FAQ[/h1]
[h3]Does this work in multiplayer?[/h3]
Yes.

[h3]Does this work with modded items?[/h3]
Yes. I've accounted for many non-vanilla body slots, anything not accounted for will neatly display at the bottom of the equipment ui before the hotbar slots.

[h3][i]Part 2 - Click Here[/i][/h3]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2982070344][img]https://i.imgur.com/agDCBaI.png[/img][/url]


[h3]If you enjoy my mods, consider supporting me on Ko-fi![/h3]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/notloc][img]https://i.imgur.com/jLt3Dyv.png[/img][/url]
Or, just come check out some previews of what I'm working on next!

[h1]Other Mods To Check Out![/h1]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2901962885][img]https://i.imgur.com/XS0ayqq.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2804531012][img]https://i.imgur.com/vYXoAU6.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2903771337][img]https://i.imgur.com/gxEDz2R.png[/img][/url]

[h2]Special Thanks[/h2]
[list]
[*] dhert - Providing a comprehensive list of bodyslots and helping hide equipped items.
[*] Burryaga - Controller support feedback and testing
[/list]

Workshop ID: 2950902979
Mod ID: EQUIPMENT_UI

1793461606.description:

Item artwork by Lith @ TheGoodOldDayz server.

Adds working night vision goggles. B41 IWBUMS compatible.

Midnight and midday screenshots shown above. 
Screenshots were taken with maximum nvg brightness setting (100%), default night darkness.

[h1]Features[/h1]
[list]
[*]Item weight 0.7. Equipped weight 0.21.
[*]Item weight (with battery) 1.2. Equipped weight 0.36.
[*]Battery powered: three game hours per full battery.

[list][*][spoiler]1 in 10,000 chance in counters - giftstore, departmentstore, electronicstore.[/spoiler]

[*]Random chance for newly spawned item to have battery inside (40%). 
[*]Spawned battery has random charge amount (0-100%).
[/list]
[*]Uses PZ's translation data for all text except item name.
[*]Item ID (for admin spawn or with necroforge): /additem eris_nvg.nvgoggles

[h1]Upcoming features[/h1]

[/list]

[h1]Incompatible Mods[/h1]
None yet.

2914075159.title: Evolving Traits World (ETW) [B41/B42] - alternative to "Dynamic Traits"
2914075159.description:
[h1][b]B42 INFORMATION[/b][/h1]
[h2]Can be found in this thread ->>> [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2914075159/595136072544954599/]CLICK ME[/url] <<<-[/h2]

[h1]Welcome to the world of Evolving Traits[/h1]
This mod allows you to get really ripped in PZ and see an actual character progression besides getting your skills from lvl 0 to lvl10. You'll be able to purge the majority of negative traits and earn a lot of positive ones (but also earn some negative ones as well). This would help you to go from your average Joe to actual GigaChad in-game. You repair a lot of cars? You get better at it. You train yourself to take long-range kills with proper rifles? Why wouldn't it warranty getting Eagle-Eyed? You pick up thousands of plants through your lifetime and still can't call yourself Herbalist? Yea, that doesn't sound right to me. You maintain great sleeping schedule but for some reason you still need same amount of sleep as when you were sleeping whenever? Not anymore. Welcome to the Dynamic Traits World, ladies and gentlemen!

[h1]Features[/h1]
[list]
[*][h3]NEW! UI with all the mod information in-game! Default hotkey is "["
[*]70+ dynamic traits (vanilla + added by the mod), full list on [url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1405szVLTetMioT0P8ddvPUJTv6VyLtTEvWxyn0cuZjI/edit?usp=sharing]this spreadsheet[/url].
[*][h3][b]FULL sandbox customization[/b]. Choose which perks you want to be dynamic, choose how fast you get them, choose how fast you lose them, customize anything with more than 150 sandbox options. Nothing is forced upon player, if you like 1% of the mod, you can literally set it up so you get to use that 1% and nothing else.[/h3]
[*]Advanced systems that affect a lot of traits. Affinity system, that allows you to stick to your starting traits better. Delayed traits system, that allows you to get/remove traits with random delay.
[*]QOL (Quality of Life) submod - mark all traits that are dynamic so in character creating you can see which perks are obtainable during gameplay! Can be enabled without enabling main mod, so if you don't like main features added by this mod and just want to see which traits are dynamic in your game with SOTO/MST/MT/DT - you can do that.
[*]For new traits (aka not vanilla game), customization is also present. Want Hoarder perk to give you more carry weight per point of STR? Go adjust it in Sandbox. Want to be even happier under rain with Pluviophile? Sandbox it is.
[*]Client-sided configuration available with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url].
[*]Don't like some/all traits added by this mod but only want to have vanilla traits dynamic? Also possible, with help of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2934686936]Evolving Traits World (ETW) - Disable Selected Traits[/url].
[/list]

[h1]Compatibility and Installation (b41)[/h1]
Installation instructions can be found in [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2914075159/3767857092594929252/]this discussion[/url].
List of compatible/incompatible mods can be found in [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2914075159/4290313152633468883/]this discussion[/url], including details on: Dynamic Traits, Expanded Taits, More Traits, zRe ARMOR PACK by kERHUS, Simple Overhaul: Traits and Occupations (SOTO), More Simple Traits (MST), Explorer Trait, SixthSense, Superb Survivors!, Snake's Mod Pack 41.77

[h1]Recommended Mods (b41)[/h1]
[list]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2694448564]Mod Manager[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725216703]Mod Manager: Server[/url] - for the love of god, use these and not vanilla mod manager
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2854030563]Moodle Quarters[/url] - so you can clearly see which stage your moodle is in right now
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2763647806]Clear description for Moodles[/url] - so you know what your moodles do
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2685168362]More Description for Traits[/url] - so you can read what your traits do
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2894296454]Change Sandbox Options (by Star)[/url] - use this to change SP starting options mid-game. [b]ATTENTION[/b]: upon changing any settings it's highly recommended to reload save (if SP) or rejoin server (if MP) for technical reasons (mod decides what to run based on sandbox settings when character is loaded in game world)
[/list]

[h1]GitHub and Discord[/h1]
If you want to submit translation files, make suggestions or report bugs, the easiest way to do it would be on Discord.
[url=https://discord.gg/8pBN5Ccm7z][img]https://cdn.iconscout.com/icon/free/png-256/discord-3691244-3073764.png[/img][/url][url=https://github.com/MusicManiac/DynamicTraitsWorld][img]https://cdn.iconscout.com/icon/free/png-256/github-163-761603.png[/img][/url]

[h1]Credits and Translations[/h1]
List of credits, contributors and translators can be found in [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2914075159/3785877016603169742/]this discussion[/url] (hitting description limit so had to move it).
Currently mod supports following languages (note that not all translations are 100% complete as mod is getting updates):
[list]
[*]English
[*]Italiano / Italian
[*]Español / Spanish
[*]簡体中文 / Chinese
[*]繁體中文 / Traditional Chinese
[*]Português Brasileiro / Brazilian Portuguese
[*]한국어 / Korean
[*]Türkçe / Turkish
[*]Deutsch / German
[*]Українська / Ukrainian
[/list]

[h1]Afterword and Permission[/h1]
If you like this mod, check out collection on top of page for other mods I made or collaborated on! Rate ups are appreciated, and if you wanna send me a coffee, that's a real homie move, and you can do it here:

2774834715.title: ExtraNoise's Newburbs Tiles
2774834715.description:
Standardized suburban development exploded in popularity in the 1980s and 1990s and continues to this day. The kind of communities where all the houses look a little too similar, where the sprawl stretches for miles in all directions. This is a collection of tiles for Project Zomboid that add those kinds of style walls, roofs, doors, windows, and other details that you would typically see these kind of communities.

[h1]Regular players[/h1]
You only need to subscribe to this mod if you've downloaded a map that makes use of the tiles in this pack.

[h1]Map makers[/h1]
You can download the raw tiles (with instructions on how to use them) here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/isiwcuki7zo9wmv/en_newburbs.zip?dl=0

For anyone that would like to use the houses in the screenshots (and some apartment buildings I created), I've dropped everything into a ZIP file here: 
https://mega.nz/file/zRZx2b6J#DHr6Ao6npHgSpi9D-Fpqp35u6XsLNZCpHhzsglgNzSY

This is a work-in-progress with plans for future expansion including brick siding, new windows, and construction elements.

Anyone is free to modify the content of this pack as they need for their map.

[h1]Where I hang out & post updates[/h1]
[url=https://discord.gg/ZyeW8puzmh][img]https://i.imgur.com/eMLKTaU.png[/img][/url]

Workshop ID: 2774834715
Mod ID: EN_Newburbs

2904920097.title: Fancy Handwork
2904920097.description:
[h1]Supports B41. Works in Multiplayer[/h1]
[h3]A new save is not required[/h3]
[h1]A VERSION FOR B42 WILL BE AVAILABLE SOON.[/h1]
[h3]There is currently a bug in B42 where Animation Sets are not recognized from the new B42 folder structure, and thus have to be duplicated which doubles size of a B42 mod. This is an issue unique to Animations. Once this is fixed by the developers (it's been reported), the B42 version will be made available.[/h3]
[img]https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hlfstr/pz-mods/devel/like_fav.gif[/img]

A Suite of Animations to make your player more alive!

[h2]Features[/h2]
[list]
[*] Attaching or Detaching an item to your Hotbar now has a chance to be done with the left arm
[*] Equipping and Unequipping your secondary item is now done with the left arm
[*] "Hand Swap" action to quickly swap the primary and secondary held items
[*] Modifier key to quickly equip items in secondary hand using from your Hotbar
[*] Animation Mask for the Left and Right Arms to correct the Positions and Rotation of the held item
[*] Includes 2 new poses when aiming a handgun and holding a secondary tool, based on your "Aim" level!  Configurable in the Sandbox Options.
[*] World Interaction animations!
[*] [b]NEW:[/b] World Interaction animations from the rear!
[*] Cooking Animations!
[*] Appropriate Vanilla Animations have now been placed on [b]over 50![/b] TimedActions that previously did not have one.
[*] [b]NEW:[/b] Wrench Repair Animation!
[/list]

[h2]Updates[/h2]
Important information is updated on this page, but full information and release notes are available in the Discussions.  Please see the latest: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2904920097/3762228679801751286/]Fancy Handwork - "It's Over 9,000!" Update[/url]

[h2]IMPORTANT[/h2]
If you receive an error about missing actions, or world interactions are simply not playing, you may need to restart Project Zomboid.  I have noticed that enabling this mod for the first time on an already-existing save and starting the game will result in the new animations not being loaded until the game is restarted. This is a [b]BASE GAME[/b] issue, but should only happen the first time.

If you receive an error following any update, please see: [url=https://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php?/topic/42925-how-to-fix-updated-mods-in-build-41-multiplayer/]How to fix updated mods in Build 41 Multiplayer[/url]
This mod adds many additional animation and action files, which may change between releases.  I try to minimize this, but sometimes it is necessary.  Unfortunately, Steam sometimes doesn't like to update these correctly resulting in errors.

[h2]Usage[/h2]
When Attaching or Detaching an item on your Hotbar, you have a chance for the action to automatically be done with your left hand.

A modifier key is added as well, which by default is bound to "Left Control".
[b]Note:[/b] By default, "Left Control" is the "Aim" key.  I personally do not use the keyboard to aim (its right-click on the mouse anyways) so I disable this keybind.  You are free to rebind the key in options.

When you press the Modifier Key and a Hotbar slot, the item slotted there will go into your Secondary Hand.  Example: (Left Control + 2) equips a Hammer to your left hand.

Pressing the Modifier and "E" will swap the items in your hands. (Configurable)

Interacting with the world normally, such as opening and closing doors and curtains, flicking light switches, and more, all now have an Animation!

Almost ALL TimedActions now have an Animation!  No longer will your character just stand there, waiting for a progress bar to fill up!

[h3]Notes about World Interactions[/h3]
If you are standing still you will turn and face the object you are interacting with if you are not already doing so. There is a Sandbox setting to control how long of a delay before you character is standing still, or the forced turn can be disabled or required.

When performing a World Interaction and moving your character will slow down slightly, and stop altogether in the case of opening a Garage Door, for a very brief moment.  I have no plans on this being a configurable option, and this is done intentionally.  It is a fantastic inclusion for immersion in my opinion, and in tight situations makes planning your movement all the more important.  After time, you will hardly notice it.
[b]NEW 01/19/2023[/b] - The speed reduction has been reduced from 50% to 25%.  This should help prevent the player from being trapped, while still being a nice addition to immersion.

[h2]Multiplayer[/h2]
Animations should sync across multiplayer with little to no issues!

[h2]Controllers[/h2]
There is currently no support for controllers, unless an action is done via the Context Menu. I will be working on Controller Support in a future Update.

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]
Mouse Click World Interactions are not triggered from: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2795987309]Left Click Redux - Click To Act[/url]
Compatible with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2915572347]The Only Cure but better[/url]. Thanks Pao!
Should be compatible with everything else.

[h3]Recommended other Mods:[/h3]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2366717227]Swap It[/url] by Chuckleberry Finn
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2706426546]Danger Zone (Dual Wield)[/url] by OgreLeg
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2651128766]Body Remodel - FINGERS.[/url] by Akyet

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2921029369]Skizot's Carryable Boxes and Garbage[/url] - by Skizot
[b]OR[/b]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2809719515]Visible Generators and Corpses[/url] by planetalgol

Source: [url=https://github.com/hlfstr/pz-mods]GitHub[/url]

Workshop ID: 2904920097
Mod ID: FancyHandwork
