2812828771.title: Fencing Kits!
2812828771.description:
[h2]Fencing Kits! : A solution to a really overpriced fence building cost! [/h2]


Tired of permanently staining your world by disassembling every appliance in a 5 mile radius, just to build two fences?
Would you like to avoid using unappealing wooden walls?
[i]Do you wish you had more friends?[/i]

[b]Well here's a answer for two of those questions, Fencing Kits![/b]

[h3]Items[/h3]
Unbundling One Fence Kit gives:
[list]
[*] 12 Metal Pipes
[*] 1 Chain Roll  (Equivalent to 25 units of wire.)
[/list]
This is enough for 3 big wired fences, constructed via the metalworking context tab. (only available with a propane torch, welding mask and metalwork knowledge from Metalwork Magazine Vol. 3)
[u][i]Propane Torches, Welding Masks, The Metalwork Magazine Vol. 3, and Scrap Metal is [b]NOT[/b] included![/i][/u]

It is possible to re-bundle fencing kits after un-bundling them!

[h3]How To Use[/h3]
Just right click the fencing kit to unbundle it.
You can unroll the chain roll to get wire, or mangle it with a saw and hammer to get some scrap metal.
You can then construct them via the metalworking context tab (Right Click, view requirements above under Items.).

[h3]Spawns[/h3]
Around three to five fencing kits can spawn in a large warehouse.
Farming crates, garages, and tool store containers also spawn fencing kits (Although rare).

[h3]Durability Specifics[/h3]
The big wired fence, and the big pole fence, both have 700hp, regardless of metalworking skill.
With the Handy trait, it is bumped up to 800hp.
For comparison, a Log wall with level 10 carpentry has 900hp, or 1000hp with Handy.

[h2][url=https://steamcommunity.com:/linkfilter/?url=https://liberapay.com/east/]Donations help immensely and are very appreciated![/url][/h2]

[h3]Compatible with existing saves![/h3]
in order to get new loot in existing saves, you will need to loot new regions.

[h3]Want to contribute, open up a issue report, or just need a alternative download link?
Fencing Kits is on [url=https://steamcommunity.com:/linkfilter/?url=https://codeberg.org/east/FencingKits]Codeberg![/url][/h3]
[i]Alternatively [url=https://steamcommunity.com:/linkfilter/?url=https://github.com/ea-st/FencingKits]Github[/url], but the main branch is on [url=https://steamcommunity.com:/linkfilter/?url=https://codeberg.org/east/FencingKits]Codeberg.[/url][/i]

[h3]Check out our other mods! [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198867427025/myworkshopfiles/]east[/url] & [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198046694819/myworkshopfiles/]balergus[/url].[/h3]

[h3] Please rate the mod! [/h3]

[code]
Please do not re-upload the mod or use any assets without [url=https://steamcommunity.com:/linkfilter/?url=http://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php/topic/2530-mod-permissions/?p=36478]explicit permission.[/url]
Yes, you are allowed to use this mod in steam collections.
[/code]

Workshop ID: 2812828771
Mod ID: FencingKits

2791656602.title: [B42/B41] The Motorious Zone Vehicle Pack
2791656602.description:
This mod will add several vehicles to the game. The vehicles are vanilla-styled (including lore-friendly names, or optional real names), era appropriate (1993 and earlier), and support all the features of vanilla vehicles. The pack will be a variety pack, aiming to add a little bit of everything to the game from everyday sedans, vans and SUVs to sports cars, with sports cars being much more rare than everyday machines.

All cars that are capable of it also support [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2281256511]Paint Your Ride[/url] in B41, or [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=3464606086]HDCP Immersive Vehicle Paint[/url] in B42!

[h1]Also supports Build 42![/h1]
The ID is slightly different for B42 (finally fixed the typo in it), but the B41 version should still work fine
[h1]!!//////////////////////Notes for B42\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\!![/h1]
[list][*]The max vehicle texture size must be at least 1024 for now. The textures break if the game has to scale them down currently. [b]Texture compression does still work, and can be enabled if you need it[/b]
[*]If the vehicle mechanics UI doesn't work, another mod in your list is likely breaking it. Mods that haven't updated to the new crafting system can break UI elements, and any mod that breaks the mechanics UI can also break other UI elements as well.
[/list]


[h1]If you were using my existing standalone vehicle mods, it is [b][u]safe (and best)[/u][/b] to switch to this mod.[/h1]
This mod contains the following vehicle mods of mine: Lancia Stratos, R32 Skyline, Supra, Fox Body, Kei Sports, LM002, 240SX Coupe, Diablo, 300ZX, GT40, Miata, Toyota X90s, and Reliant Robin Mk. II. Disable these mods and use this instead if you plan on using this mod, as they can cause issues when used together.

[h1]You can choose which cars you would like to spawn naturally, from 3 selections of car lists[/h1]
[b][u]If you want all cars to spawn, you don't need to enable the optional Spawn Selection sub-mods[/u][/b]
To choose which types of cars you'd like to have spawn, enable the Spawn Selection sub-mods of the cars you would like to allow to spawn in addition to the main mod. There are 3 lists to choose from, and you can select any combination of them: [list]
[*][b]US Motors:[/b] This list contains cars that were available and sold in the US. Examples include the Bronco, Mustang, and 240SX.
[*][b]Imports:[/b] This list contains cars that were not available and sold in the US, but common in other countries. Examples are the R32 Skyline, Toyota Mark II, and Reliant Robin
[*][b]Rares and Exotics:[/b] This list contains cars that are either very expensive or produced in very low numbers. Examples are the GT40, Diablo, and Stratos. [/list]
Also note that the imports and exotics are both very rare in the base spawn lists, and the Spawn Selection sub-mods will not make them more common.

Additionally, the mod has been translated to German thanks to Eaglefire. Check out their German Project Zomboid community [url=https://discord.gg/project-zomboid-de]here![/url]

[h1]This mod pairs well with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2793164190] Vehicle Spawn Zones Expanded. (B42 Update pending)[/url][/h1]
Since the exotic and import cars are very rare, I started work on the spawn zones to give some specified areas for these cars to spawn, so there is a decent chance to find them on a save without it potentially becoming overwhelming. It eventually became more, adding a variety of new spawn areas beyond that. It works very well with this mod, and has many spawn lists for cars in this pack.

[h1]Also check out these complimentary MZ-themed mods![/h1] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2895585037][img]https://i.imgur.com/POZK84w.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2841969842][img]https://i.imgur.com/IrKA7bh.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2856740739][img]https://i.imgur.com/TixgJf8.png[/img][/url]

[h1]FAQ[/h1]

[b]Q: Multiplayer compatible?[/b]
A: [b][u]Yes![/u][/b] In general, all of my (and many of others') vehicles will be MP compatible unless stated otherwise.

[b]Q: Can this be used with other vehicle mods?[/b]
A: [b][u]Yes![/u][/b] It will work with other vehicle packs, and standalone vehicle mods. This mod was even made with use alongside mods like Filibuster Rhymes' Used Cars in mind, and has its spawn chances based around it. It doesn't alter anything vanilla either, so anything that changes vanilla vehicles will also work!

[b]Q: What are the vehicle IDs?[/b]
A: I've set up a post in the discussions with each vehicle ID and some small information about each car, check it out if you need the IDs.

[b]Q: How rare are the exotic/import cars?[/b]
A: They are [i]very[/i] rare, exotics in particular will be difficult to find on default (low) and normal car spawn rates. Exotics and imports will mostly only spawn near high-end houses, or anywhere else you can find the Cossette and Lang 4000 in vanilla, at a lower spawn rate. Some Easter Egg cars will spawn in similar areas to the Easter Egg cars from Used Cars. For some more specific hints, [spoiler]Riverside has a very large amount of possible spawn zones, and the bar across from the junkyard contains only sports car spawns, so that is the best place to look.[/spoiler]

[b]Q: Can this be added mid-save?[/b]
A: [b][u]Yes![/u][/b] Vehicles will only spawn in areas you have not explored yet however, so if you or your server have been all over the map, you may have trouble finding the vehicles. I'd recommend using [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2871002471]Udderly Vehicle Respawn[/url] if you want to use this on an existing save, it will allow new vehicles to spawn in explored areas the world.

[b]Q: I'm having issues joining/starting a server in MP (File mismatch, or connection lost after starting)[/b]
A: First, check AuthenticPeach's guide about these issues [url=https://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php?/topic/42925-how-to-fix-updated-mods-in-build-41-multiplayer/]here.[/url] For more info, check the first post of the "Bug reports" thread in discussions.

[b]Q: Can you make (x)?[/b]
A: If you're going to request a car, note that my main focus at the moment are cars that fit the game's time period (1993 and earlier). I do have cars outside of this timeframe on my list, but it may be a while before I get to them. I also already have quite a few on my list, so there's no guarantee I'll get to all of them.

[b]Q: What about animations?[/b]
A: Animations are planned to officially come to vanilla vehicles, so they are planned for this pack as well. While I will redo some cars before TIS' animations are officially available, they will be released as separate mods for the time being with options to replace the ones in the pack, due to some features not working with animated parts. I'm still going to add vehicles in the current vanilla style to the pack, better set up for the upcoming animations.

[url=https://discord.gg/hMqVf47TXA][img]https://i.imgur.com/fjDnNYl.png[/img][/url]

fhqMotoriusZone
fhqMotoriusZoneRealNames
fhqMotoriusZoneUSDM
fhqMotoriusZoneImports
fhqMotoriusZoneExotics

1510950729.title: Filibuster Rhymes' Used Cars!
1510950729.description:
Hey dudes, the comments are disabled because it's just Russian spam now, haha. Once build 42 is out and stable, I'll update this version and re-enable comments. Until then, if you need any help with it, feel free to join the discord. You should also check out the beta, linked below!

[h1]Update [strike]Coming[/strike] Here![/h1]
This version won't be updated until b42 is released in the stable branch.
If you wanna play the animation beta, though, here you go!
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3315561157

Hey dudes, I quit my job, learned to animate with blender and I've been working on a pretty darned big update for the mod over the last few months!
When I'm done, the mod will have...
[list]
[*]Fully animated vehicles WITH interiors, engines, even radios!
[*]Over 50 base vehicle models
[*]Over 100 variants, such as sedans, coupes, convertibles, station wagons, taxis, police, offroad versions of trucks, etc.
[*]Over 5 trailers!!! (...so like 6, haha)
[*]A few more removable parts, like bumpers and roofs, but still keeping with the vanilla spirit!
[*]A lot of bug fixes.
[*]A lot of new bugs, probably.
[/list]

I've been living off my savings and treating the mod like a full time job, but I'm pretty close to the point where I'll need to get a paying job, haha.
I really hate asking for donations, but I'm not sure I'll be able to get this totally finished up in time. If any of you guys are in a pretty good spot money wise, anything you guys toss my way will help me get more of this finished. If you don't have a lot or just don't feel comfortable donating, that's fine! I don't want you guys feeling guilty because you can't or even don't want to.
I've got a Patreon and a buymeacoffee below! Also discord, for good measure.

https://www.patreon.com/filibusterrhymes

3153010942.title: First Aid VHS Tapes
3153010942.description:
[h2]Contents[/h2]
First Aid VHS Tapes
Adds 4 VHS tapes that can be found in VHS stores.

Each VHS tape teaches the player how to treat a different type of injury.
[list]
[*] Episode 1 – Lacerations
[*] Episode 2 – Deep wounds
[*] Episode 3 – Bone Fractures
[*] Episode 4 – Burns
[/list]

Watching these VHS tapes will also increase the First Aid skill.

[img] https://i.imgur.com/vMWWflp.png [/img]

[h2]Background[/h2]
Not sure about you, but I’ve always felt that the first aid skill was too difficult to increase naturally. Whilst I am aware you can simply roll around in glass shards and treat the wounds as they appear to help boost the first aid skill, it doesn’t seem very immersive... Would you do such a thing in real life to learn first aid?

While there [i]is[/i] an official in-universe way of learning first aid, you need to find 2, hard to find ‘Home VHS’ and I’ve never found them in all my time playing! There is also no official, in-game way of teaching the player how to treat specific wounds. For example, crafting a splint to help fix a fracture, I only found out you could craft one by looking at the wiki…

With that said, I decided to make this mod. Something that, with a bit of searching, allows the player to advance the first aid skill whilst learning the correct medical procedure on how to treat the injuries. (The procedures being the one found on the "First Aid" page of the PZ Wiki)

I designed this mod to fit in with the other skill boosting VHS tapes such as Woodcraft and Exposure Survival. I would also consider this mod lore-friendly.

[h2]Translation Credits[/h2]
Special thanks to:

2940354599.title: Fitness & Workout Overhaul
2940354599.description:
[h1]Description[/h1]
Don't like how the fitness system works ? Too unrealistic ? Too slow ? Too fast ?
Updates how much exp is gained based on some realistic inspired parameters.
Adds 2 new workout options: a working treadmill and functioning bench-press (bring your own barbell).
Lots of customization options to tune it to your liking!

Both mods in this pack can be used individually.
Works in SP and MP.

[b][u]BenchPress&Treadmill[/u][/b]
Both fitness options are integrated into the vanilla fitness system. Meaning they have their own regularity and affect endurance/temperature/sweat/etc. as a vanilla exercise would.
[list]
[*]Working treadmill which requires power to run. Running will increase fitness, sprinting and strength if you carry more then 50% weight
[*]The Bench-press requires you to find your own barbell, after which you can have yourself a good workout.
[*]Regularity shown in right click menu (0-100)
[/list]


[b][u]FitnessWorkoutOverhaul[/u][/b]
Overhauls the way fitness experience is calculated.
[list]
 [*]Take the initial perk bonus into account (75% 100% 125%)
 [*]Get a bonus for the current exercise depending on the regularity
 [*]Get a bonus depending on the average of all your exercises regularity
 [*]Get a bonus per perk level
 [*]Get a bonus when not sulfuring from muscle soreness
 [*]Get a bonus for spacing out your workouts (promotes regular spaced out sessions)
[/list]
Excel in mod folder to play with / test some values ! 

[b][u]Workout With Backpack:[/u][/b]
backpacks/equipables can remain equiped while doing exercises 
For treadmill, benchpress AND Vanilla exercises

[b][u]Workouts Are Fun:[/u][/b]
Workout reduces Stress, Anger, Boredom and Unhappiness.
(disabled if Dynamic Traits is active)

Don't want a passive exp boost outside of doing exercises ? set the passive multiplier to 0 or lower it to your preference.

all rates and values can be adjusted or turned off in the sandbox settings.
For more detailed info check out the "FWOFitnessWorkoutOverhaul XP Multiplier Explained" discussion.

[h1]Languages [/h1]
(feel free to send in your translations or contact me in the colab section)
English 
French
German (ZeroFave)
Spanish (Dr. Nitropic)
Brazilian Portuguese (Kildren)
Russian (𝚅𝚒𝚜𝚑𝚗𝚢𝚊)
CN & CH (NEP IS LIFE)
Korean (정신나간 사람)

[h1]Known Compatibility  [/h1]
(FWOFitnessWorkoutOverhaul)
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2923554542]Exp Recovery[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2908032114]Retroactive Skill Books[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2503622437]Skill Recovery Journal[/url]

(negative stat reduction disabled if Dynamic Traits is enabled )

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2914075159]Evolving Traits World (ETW)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2638088934]Standardized Sprinting XP (may be unbalanced)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2664233895]Standardized Passive XP (may be unbalanced)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2827283808]ultimate xp tweaker[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2942815535]Ducks' No Pain? Yes, Gain![/url]
[spoiler]Simple Overhaul: Traits and Occupations  (TBD)[/spoiler]
[spoiler]More Simple Traits (MST) (TBD)[/spoiler]
[spoiler]More Traits (Hardy)(TBD)[/spoiler]


FWOFitnessWorkoutOverhaul sets the XP multiplier for fitness and strength. 
So any other mod that does this would be impacted. 
although no other aspects should be hindered. 

[h1]FAQ & Notes  [/h1]
Mod folder contains an excel for calculating the XP multiplier. also see the explanation in the discussion section.

Can I add/Remove the mod from an existing (multiplayer) game?
-Benchpress/treadmill are safe to remove.
-Overhaul will however keep the last set multiplier atm (you can work around this by changing the settings to use a 1x and remove after)
Do I need both mods / Can I use 1 without the other ?
-Both mods in this pack can be used individually.
Do you still need "Working Treadmill / WorkingBenchPress" mods ? 
-No (sorry OG devs but credit to you for the inspiration)
Do you still need "exercise with backpacks" mod ? 
-No
How do i change my sandbox settings in Solo game ?
-[url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/108600/discussions/0/3160848559788912153/]Try this work-around or mod[/url]

I'm aware the animation are not 100% perfect.
I can not fix the sprites clipping in certain angles (without a lot of workarounds which is not high in the prio list might consider is requested a lot).

[h1]Disclaimer[/h1]
Be a decent human being and ask for permission first.
For any conflicts or complaints please contact me first or post in the discussions.

2915430406.title: Fix Inventory Tooltip lag
2915430406.description:
[h1]Fix Inventory Tooltip lag[/h1]

This mod fixes a performance issue in the game that causes it to freeze up for a period of time, most commonly whenever you rip up clothing.

The problem becomes exponentially worse with the more clothing item mods you have, hence why it's the primary culprit.

The code is a classic example of "accidentally quadratic" If you care about the details, read on. If not, just download it.

[h2]What the vanilla game does that causes this problem[/h2]

The game wants to show you a tooltip of the top 10 items that are valid for a given recipe, so it:

1. Builds a complete list of all valid items, in no particular order.

2. Sorts this complete list to move all items you actually have to the top - [i]O(n)[/i] complexity.

3. Removes any items that are considered duplicates by virtue of being applicable to different slots (e.g. Left/right handed wristwatch) - [i]O(n^2)[/i] complexity!

4. Renders the top 10 items of the list, ignoring anything else.

This is wasteful because it processes the full list of items, even though we only care about the top 10.

[h2] What this mod makes it do [/h2]

1. We build a complete list of valid items, but any items that exist in your inventory are sent to the start of the list, [b]at the point of insertion[/b].

2. The list is truncated to the first 10 items and only these are sorted. We store the original length of the list for later - [i]O(1)[/i] complexity.

3. Deduplication occurs as in vanilla, but, again, the list is now only 10 items long - [i]O(1)[/i] complexity.

4. We render the list again. If there were more than 10 items, we ensure that the "and X more" text is computed correctly from the pre-truncation list size.

Workshop ID: 2915430406
Mod ID: FixTooltipLag

[h1] [b]FAQ:[/b][/h1]
[b]Is "Fluffy Hair" compatible with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2463184726] "Spongie's Hair Pack" [/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2761200458] "Yaki's Hair Salon" [/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2456540487] "Harry's Hair" [/url] ?[/b]
I gave it a test and it seems work great together.
They also took care of making their hairs working properly with hats.
At Harry's Hair the alternative hat-hairs do show up in the hair menus for some reason.

 [b]I want to make a hat/hair compatible with your mod, how do i do?[/b]
Just Set the Hat-Category or the hair groups like that:
- Group01 If its a normal hat (CowboyHat, Tinfoil, Beany)
- Group02 If its a band (Bandana, Visor, Bandage)
- Group03 If its a hoodie
- Group04 If its over-ear (Winterhat, bicycle helmet)
- Group05 If its just default hair if you dont want any alternative hair
- Group06 If your hairs are fully covered (Shower caps, Surgeon caps)
- Group07 If its the default HatHair Style

[b]Will this mod work with a existing savegame?[/b]
Yes

 [b]Which game version works with this mod?[/b]
I have tested it with game version B41 and B42 and Hosted Multiplayer

 [b]Is this mod compatible with other Mods?[/b]
This Mod will not be compatible with mods which do:
- Change default hat items
- Change default hair styles
Mods which add completly new hairs should be compatible.

[b]Am i allowed to use this mod in a Server mod pack?[/b]
Yes

2890748284.title: Food Preservation Plus
2890748284.description:
[h1]Winter is Coming[/h1]

This mod addresses the need of vanilla friendly food preservation. Make smoked or salted meat/fish, canned food, vinegar, ethanol, glue, salt and much more. Use ethanol to make vodka or to refill a generator, refine food to biogas, find salt rocks and crush them to salt. It is also a good workaround for not having natural cold storage system - YET.

[b]  [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2970858855]HUNTING IS NOT INCLUDED IN THIS MOD AND IS NOT ALSO REQUIRED FOR THIS MOD TO WORK. YOU NEED TO SUBSCRIBE IT SEPARETLY IF YOU WANT TO HUNT![/url] [/b]

[b]Use [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2787291513]Craft Helper[/url]  to see exact unit quantities of some of the recipes.[/b]

[b]Canning details :[/b]
[list]
[*]Can carrots, cabbage and tomatoes. Cans last forever, just as in vanilla.
[*]Overhauled vanilla jarring - jars last about an year now. They also give back a empty jar and a lid when opened.
[*]Vanilla potatoes and cabbages are heavier and potatoes last longer - 30 to 60 days. It is implied the potatoes are kept in somewhere cool.
[/list]
[b]Meatwork details :[/b]
[list]
[*][u]All meat related recipes will accept meat by the unit - no matter how it has been cut.[/u]
[*]Meat can be [u]canned[/u], [u]salted[u], [/u]smoked[/u] or eaten in any other way you want.
[*]All bigger animals(From [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2970858855]Immersive Hunting[/url] mod) , depending on their size, will produce certain amount of steak slabs, leather strips and bones when butchered.
[*]Big steak slabs can be cut into smaller pieces to be shared with a friend, stored, cooked or traded more easily.
[*]Small trapped/hunted animal, both from vanilla and Hunting Mod are butchered the vanilla way.
[*]Raw canned meat needs to be heated in fire so it will change to normal canned meat. 
[*]Smoked meat/fish needs to be smoked for about 10-12 hours. Lasts 6-10 days.
[*]Salted meat can also be made from various meat types. Lasts 15-20 days.
[*]You can also mine salt and various other stuff with my : [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2963057869]Dynamic Mining[/url][/b] mod.

[code] 
[list]
[b]Smoking/Salting Tutorial[/b] : PZ has such thing as units - these units can be either measured in drainable items as delta or they can be hunger value on food items. To prepare your meat for smoking/salting you need ONE unit of whatever kind of RAW MEAT, this will create you a "starter item". The whole system is not not new or made up by me but the usual evolved recipe(Stir Fry, Pie, Soup etc etc). Only difference is that in my version you need to craft the initial item from the food itself - there is no other item involved. Now you can click on that new item and start adding more meat to it, until its full and then cook it over the fire.
[/list]
[/code] 

[/list]
[b]Brewing details :[/b]
[list]
[*]Brew Ethanol from potatoes/corn and yeast.  
[*]Brew Vinegar from ethanol and vegetables.
[*]Brewing and canning equipment such as wooden barrels and can sealers can be either looted or crafted.
[*]Just make a brew and place the barrel on the ground and leave it be.
[*]Ethanol takes 15 days to get ready.
[*]Vinegar takes 10 days to get ready.
[*]When the brew is ready, you can open the barrel while holding 5 empty bottles and voilaa - you get 5 bottles of ethanol/vinegar and your barrel can be used for the next brew.
[*]Ethanol+Water can be mixed into vodka.
[*]Ethanol can be also used as fuel.
[*]You can use the vodka as a drink or to disinfect stuff.
[/list]

[b]Other :[/b]
[list]
[*]Sweet Juice can be stomped out of certain veggies and used as sugar - it also produces yeast as a by product.
[*]Mushrooms can be stomped straight to yeast.
[*]Cook tallow from any animal meat.
[*]Make candles from tallow. Candles last 6 times longer.
[*]Tallow can be used in cooking recipes as an oil/lard/margarine.
[*]Glue can be made out of bones and leather. Glue lasts 2 times longer.
[*]Soap can be made out of animal meat. Soap lasts 5 times longer.
[*]Make dried berries out of strawberries.
[*]Foragable salt rocks that can be crushed into salt(Found in Forests/Vegetation/Farmlands).
[*]Refining Biogas(Propane) from all sorts of food.
[*]You can empty all cans(Vanilla too) from food(Even rotten).
[*]Tweaked strategic lootable food nutrition values(Canned/Dried/Chips/Sweets)
[*]Realistic calories for various vanilla foods. I also suggest using [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2840487215]Calorie burn tweaker[/url][/b] and 
[b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2908032256]Weight change speed[/url][/b] to make the overall hunger system more balanced.
[/list]

[b]Everything related to canning, jarring, smoking, salting and brewing needs a certain skill + a recipe book.[/b]



Updates to this mod are 100% savegame friendly and wont break anything. Works in MP and is friendly with both vanilla and other mods.

2803794394.title: For Science!
2803794394.description:
A mod to add more consistent ways to level First Aid and Electrical.

For First Aid you can train from Level 0 to Level 4 by practicing bandaging yourself with a chance to dirty or lose bandages.
After reaching Level 4 First Aid, you can then dissect zombie corpses to advance your First Aid.
If you have a copy of 'The Journal of the American Medical Association' in your inventory, your chance of successfully dissecting the zombie and the amount of XP you earn from dissecting will increase.

Items on the zombie when being dissected will be placed into an item box.
If you want to add the item box to the world clean up list so they are automatically removed after an amount of time, the box's item id is "Base.FSItemBox".
With [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url], you can disable the item box and all the items on the zombie will be destroyed.

For Electrical you can tinker with certain world objects and gain XP at the cost of Electronics Scrap. Simple devices like Radios will let you train your Electronics up to 4. More advanced devices, like Computers, become available for tinkering at Level 4.
If you have a copy of 'Circuitry for Dummies' in your inventory, the amount of XP you earn from tinkering will increase.

Also allows you to perform a Maintenance action on your weapons which will clean the blood and very rarely restore condtion and give Maintenance XP. Chances scale inversely from the weapon's max condition and chance to lose condition.

Spanish translations provided by CarlosRojasCu
Brazilian Portuguese translations provided by gccoiahy
French Translations courtesy of KwerTTY

[h1]Check out my other mods:[/h1]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2917274631][img]https://imgur.com/OMoGXZ5.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2866542033][img]https://imgur.com/ulY1Djp.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2899457928][img]https://imgur.com/343K5LO.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2925034918][img]https://imgur.com/NfToQzk.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2927625589][img]https://imgur.com/n2W2cRy.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2913065267][img]https://imgur.com/aREpts5.png[/img][/url] 

Workshop ID: 2803794394
Mod ID: ForScience

2968421358.title: Fort Boonesborough [B41/B42]
2968421358.description:
[quote][h1]⚠️MAP UPDATED FOR BUILD 42 UNSTABLE!⚠️[/h1]
This map has been updated for build 42. There might be bugs and issues with the map in this version. This update does not affect the build 41 version, it should still work the same as before.[/quote]

A reconstructed civil war fort located in the forest east of Louisville. The settlement has multiple cabins, blockhouses and a courtyard with a small garden. A small lake for fishing can be found in the forest nearby.

The fort is based on the real-life recreation of [url=https://maps.app.goo.gl/mV6uvKgbVpQMXMGa6]Fort Boonesborough[/url] in Madison County, Kentucky.

This map can be used as a multiplayer safe zone or settlement. The fort has multiple cabins that can be used as safe houses.

[h1]Spawn locations[/h1]
The fort has two spawn locations inside the cabins next to the main gates.

[h1]Map location[/h1]
The fort is located east of Louisville in the forest next to the music festival. This mod will conflict with other map mods that use the same cells. [url=https://map.projectzomboid.com/#14112x1992x400]Link to online map[/url]

[h1]Modpack Permission[/h1]
You are allowed to use this mod in private and unlisted modpacks.

2616986064.title: Fuel Side Indicator
2616986064.description:
[h1]EXCITING NEWS![/h1]
The latest blog post by The Indie Stone (https://projectzomboid.com/blog/news/2023/11/one-door-openz/) seems to hint that they will add a fuel-side indicator to the vanilla game on Build 42. 
I'm so happy that the developers noticed this small UI/UX tweak enough to warrant it to be in the base game. It has always been my intention to make this mod in the hopes of getting it implemented in vanilla.
Cheers to all who have supported this mod and I'm sure it will still come handy until B42 comes out.

Also,
This mod still works even though it's been over a year since I updated it. Works for Build 41.78+

[hr][/hr]

[h1] Build 41.68 Patch [/h1]
- Fixed error with Agrotsar Tractor*
- Fixed compatibility with two-wheeled vehicles**

**For some bikes, the mod makers made it so that you could refuel on both sides, in this case I have disabled the indicator.
*You may also find that the indicator does not appear in certain vehicles, this is because the mod makers have done some weird stuff on their vehicles that hinders this mod to get info on the gas tank location. One example of this is the Agrotsar Tractor that does not have a gas tank area which this mod relies on. 

[b]This mod should be loaded LAST. Specifically, after enabling other vehicle mods.[/b]
For server owners, place FSI at the end of the list of mods or after other vehicle mods. 

[hr][/hr]

[h1] Description [/h1]

Find it annoying to turn your vehicle around in a gas station and attracting MORE zombies? Do you wish there was a way to know which side your car's gas tank is at? 

[i]Fuel Side Indicator[/i] is a simple addition to your vehicle's dashboard that lets you know which side you have to park your car when refuelling!


[hr][/hr]
[h1] Author's Notes [/h1]

This is my first UI mod! Please be patient with any bugs you may encounter and report them in the comments below.

- No need for a new save, just enable it and you're ready
- To disable, just disable the mod itself

Big thanks to the PZ discord modding community! Special shout out to Shurutsue as well!

COMPATIBILITY: Build 41.78+
*Compatible with ALL vehicle mods! (as long as the vehicle has wheels)
*If you have a mod that tweaks the vehicle dashboard, this mod [i]may[/i] conflict with it but not likely if it's a minor tweak.

MULTIPLAYER COMPATIBILITY: 
* This should work since this is a client-side mod. Let me know down in the comments if you have trouble with the mod on your server.



REPACKING is ALLOWED. 
Just credit me and don't whine at me when something breaks when you repack.



[url=https://ko-fi.com/photoshoplol][img]https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/5c14e387dab576fe667689cf/61e11d430afb112ea33c3aa5_Button-1-p-800.png[/img][/url]



Workshop ID: 2616986064
Mod ID: fuelsideindicator

3034144525.title: FuelCraft
3034144525.description:
[h1]  FuelCraft [/h1]

Welcome to FuelCraft! Now you can produce your own gasoline at home.

[b] Features: [/b]
*New magazine to learn how to make homemade gasoline.
*3D distillation bench.
*Balanced recipes.
*You can mix leftover ethanol into a single canister or make disinfectants.
*Less hardcore option for crafting gasoline (from the mods menu).

[b] Instructions: [/b]
[i] Step 1: Learn the recipes by reading the magazine. [/i]
[i] Step 2: Gather the materials to make the distiller (Requirement: Metalwork 6). [/i]
[i] Step 3: Set up a fire and ignite it. Place the distiller in the desired position (the distiller works from the inventory, but
for aesthetics, it looks better placed on the fire, as shown in the photo). [/i]
[i] Step 4: Collect corn cobs, sugar, hot water, and an empty gasoline canister. [/i]
[i] Step 5: Distill the ethanol (Requirement: Cooking 5). [/i]
[i] Step 6: Mix the liquids together with the ethanol canister (6 units), 2 units of gasoline, and an empty canister. [/i]
[i] Step 7: Done! Now you have homemade gasohol! Also, remember that you can make disinfectants with empty plastic bottles and ethanol. [/i]

[i] I recommend the 'le gourmet revolution' mod from [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2719327441] Snake's Mod Pack [/url] to produce brown sugar, as well as the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2947008195] Better Placement [/url] mod for better positioning the distillation bench. [/i]

 Available in English and Spanish.

Bienvenido a FuelCraft!! Ahora podrás fabricar tu propia gasolina en casa.

[b] Características: [/b]
*Nueva revista para aprender como hacer gasolina casera.
*Banco de destilación 3D.
*Recetas equilibradas.
*Puedes mezclar la sobras de etanol en un solo bidón o fabricar desinfectantes.
*Opción menos hardcore para fabricar gasolina (desde el menu de mods).

[b] Instrucciones: [/b]
[i] Paso 1: Aprender las recetas leyendo la revista. [/i]
[i] Paso 2: Buscar los materiales para fabricar el destilador (Requisito: Metalistería 6). [/i]
[i] Paso 3: Colocar una hoguera y encender el fuego. Colocar el destilador en la posición deseada (el destilador funciona desde el inventario pero por estética queda mas bonito colocarlo sobre la hoguera como en la foto). [/i]
[i] Paso 4: Reunir las mazorcas, el azúcar, el agua caliente y un bidón de gasolina vacío. [/i]
[i] Paso 5: Destilar el etanol (Requisito: Cocina 5). [/i]
[i] Paso 6: Junto con el bidón de etanol (6 unidades), 2 unidades de gasolina y un bidón vacío, mezclar los líquidos. [/i]
[i] Paso 7; Listo!! Ahora tienes gasohol casero!! Además recuerda que puedes fabricar desinfectantes con botellas plásticas vacías y etanol. [/i]
[i] Recomiendo el mod le gourmet revolution de [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2719327441] Snake's Mod Pack [/url] para fabricar azúcar morena así como el mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2947008195] Better Placement [/url] para colocar en mejores posiciones el banco de destilación. [/i]

 Disponible en Inglés y Español.

Workshop ID: 3034144525
Mod ID: Siowar_distiller
Mod ID: Siowar_distiller_easy

3042138819.title: Functional Appliances 2
3042138819.description:
[b][h3]New Extractor Hoods in B42![/h3][/b]
Build them in a square where you place your generator to extract the fumes from it out of the building. All automatically, but the hood will not start until power is there and will not extract unless a running generator is under the hood in the same square.

[h3]Popcorn Machines:[/h3] They now have function and will convert instant popcorn packets and Sapph's corn kernels into edible popcorn without the pain of burning the food. Popcorn buckets are also added and you can butter the popcorn when in a bucket.

[h3]Hotdog Machines:[/h3] They also have function and will keep from burning those priceless sausages. It uses the base sausages and sliced bread in the game to make hotdogs. If you have Sapph's Cooking mod installed you can also use the sausages and hotdog buns from that mod as well.

[h3]Soda Fountains:[/h3] Are now plumbed objects and will dispense water for all the uses. It also dispenses soda to fountain cups and refills soda/water bottles for preserved use. They use soda syrups and CO2 tanks to operate. Just drop them into the counter the table top unit is on or put them inside the Slurp 'n Burp stand alone unit. These can now pull materials from any static container in the square or the square behind them. If water is a problem, try using water jugs from the Water Dispenser mod or plumb it like a sink.

[h3]Bar Taps and Kegs:[/h3] Setup the kegs in furniture containers with the taps connected and you can pour them into red cups, beer mugs, and refill bottles. Kegs pulled from any static container in the square with the bar taps. Compatible with More Brews and More Brews kegs now spawn in bar tap counters in 2.0!

[h3]Food Display Counters, Buffet Islands, Rounded Glass Display Counters and Vending Machines:[/h3] These are now temperature settable appliances for food storage. Some have Hot, Warm, or Cold others just Warm and Cold. Each segment has it's own settings. Now automatically spawn on when they can and switch to cold in ice cream parlors, cafes, bakeries, etc. Pizza parlors and other restaurants will default to warm. Soda Machines automatically default to cold.

[h3]Industrial Deep Fryers:[/h3] The deep fryers are now setup to randomly have vegetable oil in them. You can add and drain the oil. If you have power you can turn them on and fry various foods that usually need a pan of oil with Sapph's Cooking mod. A few new recipes have been added: Doughboys, Chicken Fillets, Chicken Tenders, Blooming Onions, and Fried Cheese Sticks. Added Sapph's Cooking Oil for a second option to fill the vats.

[h3]Pay Phones:[/h3] They have a minor interaction. If you touch them they might just ring but they'll attracted anyone that happens to be listening...

[h3]Wall Clocks:[/h3] They will now display the time. Clicking on them will give you the current time. Wall clocks work based on electrical availability, once off the grid they run off a built in battery that slowly drains. Power up a generator and they will recharge over time. If you are desperate, you can drop a new standard flashlight battery into them, but that's a one way trip. Clocks now show 12hr format and stop when dead. All times accurate to the minute when powered.

[h3]Paper Towel and Napkin Dispensers:[/h3] They show up as small containers and come standard with a few loose napkins. Napkins can now dry off players and wet napkins can wash off dirt and blood. In order to allow compatibility, the new ones drop in the dispensers. Vanilla game napkins have a conversion recipe to use them as well.

[h3]Coffee X-Press and Espresso Machines:[/h3] Turn on the machines and make coffee. Use mugs, teacups, and thermos or lowballs from Sapph's. Tea and instant coffee options exist in the vanilla game to make a quick fix. Add Sapph's to get coffee beans that can be ground in the espresso machine. Then you can brew coffee or espresso. Take the espresso and foam it up in the espresso machine with any "Milk" type item and turn it into a latte or cappuccino. Don't forget you need power and water. If the water is off, any source in inventory will be used for the coffee.

[h3]Bulletin Boards:[/h3] Both large and small corkboards, you can now add things into it's container and the random notices appear as overlays.

[h3]Peg Boards:[/h3] Containers that spawn with tools and have an overlay.

[h3]Pool Cue Stands:[/h3] Containers that spawn with pool cues and have an overlay.

[h3]Green Oven Silo Generators:[/h3] It has the same depletion of fuel as a standard generator and the same radius of power. It can be turned on/off manually and has an auto start feature. It can be used as a backup to other generators and sense when it's time to start. It can be repaired with electronic scrap or scrap metal but will need the generator skill, electrical 4, or mechanics 4. The standard generator manual can spawn with the machine. It has a 500 fuel unit capacity and can be filled or emptied while running. There is no need to connect these as they are stationary and already connected. If found indoors they are also vented to keep the toxins out. If they run out of fuel they will shutdown, if they run out of condition they make a loud *BOOM* that attracts zombies in the area. Now moveable in 2.0 thanks to the Green Oven Corporation! "When your power is lean, buy Green!" 

[h1][b]***Fuel and Condition of generators zeros out when moving, empty first!***[/b][/h1]

v2.07 Updated for B42 Not all aspects of the original Functional Appliances are available due to changes in the game.
   Display cases, buffets, and vending machines still have temperature settings.
   Peg boards still load tools.
   Bulletin boards now have photos and fliers.
   Napkins can be used to dry or wet them to wash yourself off in a pinch. Vanilla napkins can be converted to FA 
      versions.
   Beer taps work with the kegs and pour into an empty vessel of choice.
   Soda Fountains now have all the flavors available in the game, non-vanilla sodas will spawn with cans and bottles 
      too.
   Popcorn machines use vanilla items to still make the popcorn.
   Hotdogs can now be made with sausage or wieners and use the vanilla buns or bread slices. All can be cooked in 
      the machine.

v2.08 hotfix
   Corrected error with distribution in 42

[h1][b]***On servers you may need to set anti-cheat 21 as false if it kicks players, it points to a file mismatch between player and server.***[/b][/h1]

If you see any bugs let me know. I tried to make the functions and items as unique as possible to keep from any conflicts. A big thank you to everyone that has helped with identifying the bugs and Lazarus for his support and time fighting them on our server to try and make things right.

Thank you and enjoy!

My other mods:

[h3]All New: True Music Radio! Powered by True Music media[/h3] Now with multiplayer sync!
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3100475013

[h1]The new multiplayer true music jukebox is now available![/h1]

2463499011.description:
[h2] Disclaimer: This is an unstable release. For Grapeseed-related issues, please use the bug report section—do not contact Indie Stone.

A big thank you to Indie Stone for reigniting our passion for mapping, 
Build 42 is truly incredible![/h2]

[h2] Grapeseed is a map mod located North West of Rosewood.[/h2]

[img]https://i.ibb.co/x8W752B/New-Project.png[/img]

[h3]The Build 42 Update:[/h3]
[b]Expanded Cells:[/b]
From just 1 cell originally to 12 cells.
[b]Increased Buildings:[/b]
Grew from 60+ buildings to over 200.
[b]Authenticity[/b]:
Transitioned from a meme-heavy, anachronistic design to a time-period-appropriate setting.
[b]Complete Overhaul[/b]:
Entirely rebuilt from scratch, ensuring a fresh and improved experience.
[b]New Assets[/b]:
None of the previous buildings have been reused—every structure is brand new.
[b]Returning Brands[/b]:
Familiar favorites like Royale With Cheese and Tristan's Tools make a comeback.
[b]Custom Tiles[/b]:
Thoughtfully designed custom tiles to avoid bloating your game or server performance.
[b]No Additional Tile Packs[/b]:
Eliminated the need for extra tile packs, simplifying installation.
[b]Balanced Zombie Spawns[/b]:
Carefully tuned zombie spawns for a more immersive experience—no overwhelming hordes.

[b]Known Issues:[/b]

Grapeseed doesn’t display correctly on the start location map.
Foraging system needs adjustments.
Basements are not yet implemented.
Occasional tree clipping near fences.
Big Boulders spawning in farm / residential zones.
In-game map clips further than the space it occupies.
Note: These issues will be resolved once the official Build 42 mapping tools are released.

3033014448.title: Greenport, KY
3033014448.description:
Greenport, KY

Established in 1818, Greenport relied heavily on the fishing industry that the Ohio River provided for many years.  The local Cannery, was opened shortly after in 1821 by the town's first Mayor, Harrison Harrington.

Over the decades, the town continued to grow and become more self sufficient, attracting in many different professionals and businesses.

By the late 1980's the interest of most residents of Greenport had moved on from fishing due to the growing prosperity of the town, resulting in the Cannery scaling back production.  Seeing the changes in the town, the Mayor believed promoting the town's growing local business scene would help draw in the tourists and bolster the coffers of Greenport.  His plans included renovating parts of the large Cannery into a Tourism center, granting local artisans vending liceses to operate out of the historic town square and the construction of a community swimming pool and open air gym adjacent to the square.

Amenities in Greenport include: multiple fishing piers, gas station and mechanic shop, doctor's office, hunting and camping store, K-12 school, daycare, church and cemetary, bank, post office, book store, coffee shop, sewing store, barber shop, grocery and tool store, police station, bar as well as a beach and Fish n' Chip restaurant.



A BIG thank you to SlenderGreen for her huge help in making this map become a reality. Your keen eye for detail and design helped bring this map to life! Also, another BIG thank you to the NoMiS Plays community for joining me on this map making journey on stream. Your ideas and concepts for the town really helped carve out a unique corner of the Knox Country map!

Additional thanks to Daddy Dirkie Dirk for your hugely helpful mapping tutorial videos, Juan for your guidance through the mapping stumbling blocks and the many other mappers and modders that stopped by the stream throughout the duration of this project.

Follow NoMiS here:

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/nomisplays
Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/nomisplays
Kick: https://kick.com/nomisplays

Check out SlenderGreen's mods here:

Lone Wanderer's Saving Grace
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2454293014

Vanilla Food Extension
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2454453639

Pass On Your Knowledge
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2683736489


Cells 27x24, 27x25, 28x24, 28x25
Located between Riverside and West Point along the river.


- Over 100 custom buildings
- Extensive forage zones
- Car spawns
- Zone specific zombie types

Known conflicts:

Dirkerdam - South bridge
Hillcrest
O'Connor Farm
Riverwood
Walnut Ridge
Echo's Fishing Cabin

If there are others, let me know.

Workshop ID: 3033014448
Mod ID: Greenport
Map Folder: Greenport

2544353492.title: Has Been Read
2544353492.description:
[h1][b]In v2.14, support for Titled Literature (e.g. Books and Magazines) has been added. However, please note that these items, will be marked as "Already Read" they are read after enabling the mod or updating it. The icon display for these items can be turned off from the options.[/b][/h1]

[h1]Overview :[/h1]
Add the unread mark on the book's icon that has not been read or has been read only halfway.
[b][i]Confirmed to work with Build 41/42 and also work on MP.[/i][/b]

[h1]Features :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Books that have not been read will display the original icon with "?". This includes skill books that are no longer needed at current level.
[*]Books that have been read only halfway will display the original icon with "!".
[*]Books that have been read completly will display the original icon only.
[*]You can mark a book. For example, you can check to see if you got it or not. Marking can be done from the context menu of the target item.
[/list]

[h1]Options :[/h1]
These options are available with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url] in B41.
[list]
[*]Show "Not Read" mark (?) : Can specify whether to show or hide.
[*]Show "Not Completed" mark (!) : Can specify whether to show or hide.
[*]Show "Already Read" mark (v) : Can specify whether to show or hide.
[*]Show "Not Completed" mark as "Not Read" mark (! -> ?) : Can specify whether to change the display or not.
[*]Show "Self Marking" mark (/) : Can specify whether to show or hide.
[*]Show "Current Target" mark (o) : Can specify whether to show or hide.
[*]Show mark on Map : Can specify whether to show on Map.
[*]Show mark on Flier : Can specify whether to show on Flier.
[*]Show mark on Brochure : Can specify whether to show on Brochure.
[*]Show mark on Titled Literature : Can specify whether to show on Titled Literature. [img]https://imgur.com/cvRLqOL.png[/img]
[*]Show mark on CD : Can specify whether to show on CD.
[*]Show mark on VHS : Can specify whether to show on VHS.
[*]Show mark on HomeVHS : Can specify whether to show on HomeVHS.
[*]Auto Marking : Automatically mark when retrieved to your inventory (including holding containers).
[*]Reverse Marking Display : Reverses the display of Self Marking (defaults to all books with Self Marking displayed).
[*]Share Flier Mark : Can specify whether to share the flier marks.
[*]Share Brochure Mark : Can specify whether to share the brochure marks.
[*]Share Titled Literature Mark : Can specify whether to share the titled literature marks. [img]https://imgur.com/cvRLqOL.png[/img]
[*]Share Self Marking : Can specify whether to  share the self marking.
[/list]

[h1]Known Issues :[/h1]
[list]
[*]For CD/VHS/HomeVHS, only the "Not Read" mark will be displayed, the "Not Completed" mark will not be displayed at this time and will be treated as unread.
[/list]

[h1]Future plans :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Bug fix (if exists)
[/list]

[h1]Remarks :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Modded books should also work as long as they comply with the vanilla's book-implementation.
[*]To make the map already read, the map must be read after enabling this Mod. Maps read before enabling this Mod will be displayed as not read.
[*]You may add it to your mod pack without confirmation and credit. However, please use at your own risk, as I have not been able to verify that it works with SP.
[*]Since v1.1, the implementation is very dependent on vanilla code. Therefore, I hope that the function of this Mod will be implemented on the vanilla side in the future.
[*][h3][b]If you were unable to log in to the MP server due to an upgrade of this mod, please try the previous versions by downloading them from "Change Notes".[/b][/h3]
[/list]

[h1]Release Notes :[/h1]
[list]
[*]v2.14 - Supported Titled Literature, improved compatibility with Inventory Tetris (B42).
[*]v2.13 - Supported Flier/Brochure, added share options.
[*]v2.12 - Supported options for Build 42.
[*]v2.11 - Compatible with Build 42.
[*]v2.10 - Added Auto Marking (Optional).
Please refer to "Change Notes" for the older history.
[/list]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561199151439614/myworkshopfiles/][img]https://imgur.com/VE2Dqpw.png[/img][/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2890440427][img]https://imgur.com/7nnRZhd.png[/img][/url]
[b]My most favorite mod, "Pump Pury" has been flagged as sensitive content and is no longer visible to many users. Please help rescue this mod![/b]

[code]
If you enjoy this mod and would like to support its development, you can do so through the services below. Your support helps keep me motivated and allows me to continue improving and updating the mod. All contributions will be used for development purposes, such as AI service subscriptions. 

[url=https://buymeacoffee.com/pepepepepeil][img]https://imgur.com/7QRjOtP.png[/img][/url]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/pepepepepeil][img]https://i.imgur.com/ULMwSUt.png[/img][/url]

2891494114.title: Herbal Medicine Plus
2891494114.description:
[h1]Simple and effective[/h1]

Craft your own herbal vitamins, painkillers and antibiotics with high level medicine skills and with some stuff from the forest. Good for roleplay when XP multiplier is set very low and you can have characters with different set of skills, doing mostly their specialised jobs.

[b]Details:[/b]
[list]
[*]Painkillers need level 5 doctor skill and Antibiotics level 6, both need to be made into a brew mix first and then left to brew for a 8 days. Both also require recipe book to be red.
[*]Vitamins can be crafted with level 4 doctor skill + a reciepe book. 
[*]Herbal Antibiotics are not as effective as the modern ones. Painkillers and Vitamins are the same.
[*]Disinfecting a rag/wound takes only 2/10's of a bottle of alcohol instead of full.
[*]Break pieces of charcoal and eat them to soothe food poisoning. Make charcoal with : [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2900671939]Real Metalworking[/url][/b]
[*]Drink herbal tea or eat honey to sooth cold and flu.
[*]Most recipe details are up on the screenshots.
[/list]


Should not conflict with any other mod or with vanilla. [b]Works with old savegames.[/b]




[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2888082232][img]https://i.imgur.com/vQWLiea.png[/img][/url]





[b]Credits :[/b]
Spanish translation - Thank you [b]XpaDDer[/b]
Italian translation - Thank you [b]TheSanctuary0[/b]
Russian translation - Thank you [b]Ксерокопия члена[/b]
Polish translation - Thank you  [b]KepaS[/b]
German translation - Thank you [b]brudermusslos[/b]


[h1] This is part of... : [/h1]
[b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2900697796]Project Realistic Overhaul[/url][/b] - Set of mods I've created that will overhaul the vanilla game experience to be more hardcore and true to life, but on the other hand leaves you the option to make it through and survive. It makes items and actions have more value and makes the world more alive.


Workshop ID: 2891494114
Mod ID: HerbalMedicinePlus

2553593324.title: How Much Fuel 41.51
2553593324.description:
How much fuel is there in the pump?  (For Build 41.51+)  Also works in Multiplayer Builds 41.60+
Confirmed to work in build 41.71.
Known Issue:  PZ has a bug where if you set the custom initial fuel setting to "Full" it sets all pumps to have infinite fuel.  And if you set it to "Infinite" it gives you a lot of fuel (15k+ units on each pump).

When I was a boy, my dad took me to his friend's gas station.  While dad was hanging out with his friend, I wandered the station, and noticed that there was a little display on the pumps indicating how much gas there was available for that pump.

I don't know if those were on every pump in 1993, but for the sake of this mod let's assume they are.

Right click on a gas pump for the context menu to check the fuel amount.

TODO: Display "Infinite" when the game is set for infinite fuel.  Currently displays 1000 instead, because that is the amount PZ returns for infinite fuel.  I will not change this item until after Indie Stone fixes its Infinite fuel bug.  When you set fuel amount to "Infinite" it is actually just set to a large amount (over 15k).  When you set fuel amount to "Full" the pumps actually have infinite fuel (displaying 1000 in this mod).

If you want to know how much fuel is typical in Project Zomboid, I did a test in Muldraugh:
https://www.reddit.com/r/projectzomboid/comments/optrpl/how_much_gas_in_a_4152_gas_station_gas2go_in/
(The amount of fuel in 41.71 appears to be the same as it was in build 41.52)

Workshop ID: 2553593324
Mod ID: HowMuchFuel

2883633728.title: [B41/B42]I Might Need A Lighter
2883633728.description:
[h1] Updated for the b42 update, please report any bug[/h1]

[h2]Philosophy behind this mod[/h2]
The first iteration of this mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2714198296] I Don't Need A Lighter[/url] missed the balance I was aiming at when writing it. It made the Smoker trait even more a freebie point than it should. With this version I want to keep the vanilla's lighters as the best option to light a cigarette, but also provide the player with more risky and/or scarce alternate options .

[h1]DISCLAIMER :[/h1]
[List]
[*]MP has been tested and work
[*]You can submit bug reports [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2883633728/3493131640454215245/](here <3[/url])
[*] Changelog : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails//changelog/2883633728/
[/list]

[h1]Car lighter overhaul : [/h1]
[list]
[*]Car lighters are no longer guaranteed to be found in every car. The car lighter socket can be empty or even in need of repair before becoming usable.
[*]Car lighter is now an object that can be carried by players, removed from cars containing one or installed in cars in need of one.

[*][strike]The time it takes to warm up a car lighter is now directly tied to the car battery durability and charge level[/strike](Broke by b42 update)
[/list]

[h1]Stove smoking overhaul :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Lighting a cigarette on a stove top now comes with a risk. If you accumulate too much malus(possible malus are currently coming from : Fatigue/Pain/Panic/Drunkeness/Hand Injuries) you risk having an accident when doing so.
[*]The time it take to light up a cigarette on a stove top is now directly tied to multiple current stat of your survivor ( Panic / Pain / Fatigue / Drunkenness / Hand injuries )
[/list]

[h2]Mod Compatibility[/h2]
[list]
[*]Smoker : https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2026976958
[*]Green Fire: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1703604612
[*]More Smokes : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2923439994 (not yet thoroughly tested)
[/list]

[h1]Planned to be added[/h1]
[list]
[*] Add more possible outcome when failing to light a cigarette on stoves
[*] Add the risk of breaking the car lighter and/or the car lighter socket when using it with a low durability/charge level car battery
[*] Add a 3d model to the car lighter
[*]Update translation strings (to all supported language in the v1)
[/list]

[b][url=https://github.com/Fingbel/I-Dont-Need-A-Lighter/tree/V2]Github [/url]

[h3]My other mods:[/h3]
[list]
[*] I Don't Need A Lighter : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2714198296
[*] Fasten You SeatBelt : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2722218474
[/list]

[b][url=https://ko-fi.com/fingbel][img]https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/5c14e387dab576fe667689cf/61e11d430afb112ea33c3aa5_Button-1-p-500.png[/img][/url][/b]

Workshop ID: 2883633728
Mod ID: IMightNeedALighter

2970858855.title: Immersive Hunting
2970858855.description:
Dynamic and immersive hunting mod that lets you scavange for traces of animals and then track and hunt them. It uses the foraging system combined with player's skills, traits, weather, luck and mood Once you find and pick up the traces they will spawn infront of you on the ground, from where you can further investigate and track the game (You can't take the traces/tracks with you and are forced to hunt where you foraged/investigated them. They will dissappear in 3 days if not used to hunt). [b]Works both in SP and MP and can be added/removed mid-game[/b].


[img]https://i.imgur.com/v8UuOlU.png[/img]
[code] 
[list]
[*]Four different types of animals can be tracked and hunted : Rabbit, birds, deer and wild pig.
[*]Traces of animals can be found in every zone but they most likely appear in deep forest.
[*]Small game traces can be found with foraging skill 2 and up
[*]Big game traces can be found with foraging skill 4 and up
[*]Often birds can be spotted without any skill and don't need to be tracked.
[*]Most important skills for tracking is foraging and sneaking.
[*]Traits like Hunter, Outdoorsman and Former Scout get better results while tracking.
[*]Bad weather conditions such as heavy rain, fog, snow or wind make it harder to track game.
[/list]
[/code] 



[img]https://i.imgur.com/afrrOVw.png[/img]
[code] 
[list]
[*]Hunting action will make an actual shooting sound and will attract zombies.
[*]Hunting rifles have better chance of getting a big animal then shotguns. Shotguns are better against birds.
[*]If your rifle have a scope then this helps along a lot too. Just make sure your rifle is equiped while hunting.
[*]Most important skills for hunting with a gun is Aiming and Sneaking. 
[*]Most important skills for hunting with a spear is Spear, Fitness, Strenght and Sneaking.
[*]Traits like Hunter, Outdoorsman, Desensitized, Eagle Eyed and Former Scout get better results while hunting.
[*]Traits like Clumsy and Short Sighted lower the chances a bit to succesfully hunt a game.
[*]Bad weather conditions such as heavy rain, fog, snow or wind make it harder to hunt game.
[*]When you are sick or just feel cold then this will lower the chances a bit to succesfully hunt a game as well.
[*]Hunters get mood bonus when hunting, tracking or butchering game. Hemophobic's get stress from hunting and butchering.
[*]Birds and rabbits have the vanilla nutrition value(Its is raised if you also use [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2890748284]Food Preservation Plus[/url][/b]) and [b]deer(base 17000 calories)[/b] and wild [b]pig(base 10000 calories)[/b] is from this mod. Nutrition values are multiplied randomly from 0.5 to 1.5. 
[*]Small animals give the meat you'd get from vanilla trapping and Deer/Pig will give you chunks of meat(Renamed steak, item won't change and can be used in all the recipes a regular steak could be)
[*]I did not add more bigger animals as I wanna make a fine balance between fishing , farming and trapping food supplies. Just roleplay the bears and elks were zombified as well.
[*]Works good in combination with my food resource re-balancing series: [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2886457020]Hard Forage[/url][/b], [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2909936075]Hard Trapping[/url][/b], [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2899681016]Hard Farming[/url][/b] and [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2886456626]Hard Fishing[/url][/b].

Added compatibility to [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2256623447]Firearms B41[/url][/b], [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2208315526]Bow and Arrow[/url][/b](Can only hunt rabbits with a bow) and for some weapons from [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2200148440]Brita[/url][/b].


[/list]
[/code] 

Use [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2890748284]Food Preservation Plus[/url][/b] mod to have a lot more options on what to do with the meat. If this mod is enabled then you also get bones from big animals that can be made into glue. You can also make smoked meat, tallow and all kinds of other stuff in that mod.


[img]https://i.imgur.com/n9Hd0Zg.png[/img]
[code] 
[list]
[*]Everything is ALMOST exactly the same as in the regular version but the animals ALSO spawn in urban areas more often.
[/list]
[/code] 



[img]https://i.imgur.com/YgbKDsd.png[/img]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2900671939][img]https://i.imgur.com/ASem8Pd.png[/img][/url][/th]
 [th][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2903127760][img]https://i.imgur.com/HmVDQ0y.png[/img][/url][/th]
[th][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2890748284][img]https://i.imgur.com/Nlo9bLy.png[/img][/url][/th]

    [/tr]
[/table] 




[img]https://i.imgur.com/h9W20Zp.png[/img]

2857584360.title: Immersive Overlays Retexture
2857584360.description:
This is a retexture  and integration of two mods:

[h1][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=533622988&searchtext=overlays]-Immersive Overlays[/url][/h1]

[h1][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2782389502&searchtext=overlays]-ImmersiveOverlaysExtanded[/url][/h1]

[b]The .lua scripts are NOT created by me![/b] I just redone the overlay textures for both of them and I couldn't find a way to replace only the textures files, both of the mods are merged in this one [u][b]SO MAKE SURE ONLY THIS MOD IS ENABLED!!![/b][/u]

[h1][b]Please, make sure to endorse BOTH of the original Immersive Overlays Mods okay?[/b][/h1]

If any of the creators of the Immersive Overlays and ImmersiveOverlaysExtanded mods want this mod down just contact me and I will remove it from Workshop as soon as possible :)

I tried to make that the overlays doesn't fill too much of the screen in a realistic/intense style.

The wet texture doesn't fill all of the screen feels like you're really wet and sweaty.
Pain, injury and bleeding gives you a intense feel like you've been trully damaged.
When you are tiered IRL doesn't feel strange and like you're tripping a little bit? That's what i tried to reach.
Hypothermia gives you an icy chilling feel and Hyperthermia gives you that burning feeling :)
When you become a zombie everything is trippy and strange.

There is a Less intrusive version too. But only enable ONE OF THEM!

I'm always open to suggestions!

2857548524.title: Immersive Solar Arrays (v41, GitHub reupload)
2857548524.description:
[code][h1][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2969478819]>>> Check out b42 beta, it's a work in progress. <<<[/url][/h1][/code]

[h1]Description[/h1]
Immersive Solar Arrays (ISA) adds new items and lets you harvest solar power for the needs of your base!

[h1]Required Mods[/h1]
You need to have [URL=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2969455858]TARGET SQUARE ON LOAD COMMANDS[/url] added to your save mod list if you want to spawn special crates with this mod. It is rather safe to add / remove on existing saves.

[h1]Links with useful resources[/h1]
[URL=https://github.com/radx5Blue/ImmersiveSolarArrays/wiki]Mod's wiki pages on github[/url]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/linkfilter/?url=https://discord.gg/denwquecsf]Original Mod's Discord Server Link[/URL]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2623458493]Original Mod's Workshop Page[/url]
[URL=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wLQXwUip1Rk]Video Guide: Project Zomboid Immersive Solar Arrays A to B by Shrek296[/url]

[h1]Notice![/h1]
[i][list]
[*] Use only one version of the mod. Latest mod id is "ISA_41". If you have installed mods with same mod_id then you won't be able to select which one is loaded.
[*] Mods that delete changes made to default actions like inventory transfer and generator interactions can cause problems.
[*] Enable x2 Textures in options or tiles will appear wrong in world, if you have other tile problems try to identify which map or tile mod is incompatible. Disable any other mods and see if the issue persists.
[*] [URL=https://steamcommunity.com/app/108600/discussions/0/3767859894285799675/]Missing recipes link[/URL]
[*] [URL=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2857548524/3463857594042602200/]MP troubleshooting link[/URL]
[*] If you have problems downloading the mod with steam, you can find the latest version of the mod on GitHub.
[*] Some options require game reload, Stash Houses might need a new game to work properly.
[*] It's advised to test this mod in debug before adding it to your modlist, if you add it to an existing save then you should create a save backup.
[/list][/i]
[h1]I found a bug that's not covered above, what to do now?[/h1]
First of all, you should try to reproduce the bug with only this mod enabled and write the steps necessary to reproduce the bug. If you can't reproduce it with only this mod then try to limit it to a specif set of mods. Check your logs for errors and post them with any other relevant information.

2948824747.title: Inspect Weapon
2948824747.description:
[h1] About [/h1]
Tired of scrolling to your equipped section of the inventory to check your weapon's status and attachments?

This mod allows you to inspect your currently equipped weapon on your primary hand at anytime, by:

- Hold down the reload button and choose "Inspect Weapon"
- Right click on any weapon in your inventory or a world container and choose "Inspect Weapon"  will automatically try to equip it in your primary hand slot and inspect it
- Pressing [b];[/b] button to inspect current weapon. You can rebind this button through PZ's default option menu

This mod comes with a simple UI and a terrible animation that took an hour to make :)

[h1] Stats & Navigating UI [/h1]
Unlike the exact stats that are shown within the weapon's tooltip, the "condition" and "number of repair" stat are shown in estimation text (yes, I took this out of the DayZ book). I personally think that this will give players a better immersion on how their characters physically see the condition of the weapon, rather than numbers on a datasheet.

[b] Condition [/b]
- Pristine: This weapon has a perfect 100% condition, and on top of that, it was never repaired
- Used: This weapon has a condition between 50%, all the way to 100%. Weapons that are 100% but were repaired even once will get knocked down from "Pristine", to this category
- Damaged: This weapon has a condition between 30% to 50%
- Badly Damaged: This weapon has its condition less than 30%

[b] Number of repair [/b]
- No sign of repair: Pretty self-explanatory, this weapon hasn't been repaired even once
- Slightly repaired: This weapon has been repaired, but less than 3 times
- Heavily repaired: This weapon has been repaired at least 3 times

It is sort of hard to determine what's the good number for "Number of repair" stat. Realistically, I think 3 times duct taping or replacing some parts of a firearm would look noticeable enough to be deemed "Heavily repaired"

[b] Repair [/b]
If weapon is damaged, an "information" button will be shown next to "Number of repair" stat. You can press on it and directly fix your weapon from the pop-up context menu, just like how you usually do it within the inventory pane

[b] Attachments [/b]
This section is only shown for ranged weapon. I am not too sure if the melee weapons can use attachments (or any mods out there that allows it), prove me wrong :)

Attachments can be equipped by clicking on a blank attachment slot, and a list should show options for compatible attachments for that slot. To un-equip it, double clicking on a currently equipped slot.

For "Magazine" slot specifically, ammo will be shown for each one, and you can choose to load or unload them by right clicking on them.

[b] For controller [/b]
You can navigate the UI using D-Pad buttons, with [i]A (South) Button[/i] as accept, [i]B (East) Button[/i] as Back/Close, and [i]X (West) Button[/i] as Context/Sub menu

Also please be advised, I am aware of the issue that the radial menu entry not showing. This has to do with other gun mods overwriting all the radial menu entries. For VFE specifically, I am working with the devs to figure out a solution to that.

[h1] To-do list [/h1]
[b] High priority [/b]
- [strike]Repair weapon[/strike]
- [strike]Indication for screwdriver in inventory[/strike]
- [strike]Potential fits into attachment slot[/strike]
- [strike]Magazine display (if applicable)[/strike]
- [strike]Working with multiplayer[/strike]
- [strike]Custom keybind to inspect current weapon[/strike]
- [strike]Window position save[/strike]

[b] Low priority [/b]
- [strike]Controller support for all my Steam Deck homies out there[/strike]
- [strike]Splitscreen coop support[/strike]
- Add ability to move window for controller
- Skill check to enable potential fits into attachment slot

[h1] Frequently asked questions [/h1]
[b] Is this compatible with VFE? [/b]
- Some adjustments to the mod has been made for VFE for attachments of several firearms to show up. There might be other undiscovered issues, so if you have found any, let me know how to recreate it.

[b] Is this compatible with other weapon mods? [/b]
- So far several of them were confirmed to be working, but some might have some issues, if they introduce new mechanics to how vanilla weapon should work. I can't test it all myself, so do try it for yourself. My goal for this mod is to keep it as compatible with the vanilla as possible, so any changes in the future by IndieStone wouldn't affect it too much.

[b] Why don't those melee weapons have inspect animation? [/b]
- I actually do not know how to make the animation for this to look interesting enough...? I'm open for suggestion on this one.

[b] Does it work with B42? [/b]
- Currently, yes!

[h1] Feedback [/h1]
This is my first ever published mod. It took about a week of work to make. Any feedback from the end-user experience, to code improvement is appreciated.

[h1] Credits [/h1]
Massive thanks to:
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/vilespring]Vilespring[/url] for helping with VFE integration
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Booker_D_Fred]Booker_D_Fred[/url] for code review/suggestions
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/thesmeg]Jarl44[/url] for potential attachment feature suggestion
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/mrshersh]Mr.Shersh[/url] for reminding me to add disclaimer about having attachment in main inventory

- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/BryanXim]BryanComY[/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/NopOYes]NopOYes[/url] for Brazilian Portuguese translation
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561199401473704] Inferno [/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Dydimos] Dydimos [/url] for Spanish translation
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/safc] Riko Prushka [/url] for Thai translation
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Booker_D_Fred]Booker_D_Fred[/url] for Russian translation
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/HugoTLS]HugoTLS[/url] for French translation
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ishev4enkoI]secdet[/url] for Ukrainian translation
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/NozownikHere]Nozownik[/url] for Polish translation
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198412478002]Dunganga[/url] for Turkish translation

3020000656.title: Item Tags Compatibility Patch
3020000656.description:
[b][h1]ITCP - Item Tags Compatibility Patch[/h1][/b]
[b]Compatibility patches for various other mods that uses hardcoded item name, this mod patches them to use in-game existing tags instead.[/b]

[h2]Problem[/h2]
[list]
[*]Items added by [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2870742794]Tools of The Trade[/url] correctly uses in-game [b]Tags[/b].
[*]The Spiffo Army Knife has [i]"Scissors"[/i] and [i]"SewingNeedle"[/i] [b]Tags[/b].
[*]But [b]actions[/b] from mods [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2584991527]Auto Sewing[/url] won't work with it.
[*]As it will only works if you specifically have these items [i]"Scissors"[/i] & [i]"Needle"[/i].
[*]So tools from other mods that are tagged correctly won't be usable with other mods (pre tags patch) that have hardcoded values.
[/list]

[h2]Solution[/h2]
[list]
[*]This mod fixes that by using the corresponding [b]Tags[/b] instead.
[*][strike]Recipes or[/strike] Only [b]Actions[/b] added by these patched mods will correctly recognize the items added.
[*]Optional but highly recommended: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2942762545]Universal Recipes[/url] mod that fix all [b]recipes[/b] (pre tags patch) in more efficient way.
[/list]

[h2]Installation[/h2]
Subscribe to this mod normally and enable it.
ITCP will automatically run patch if any of the patched mod is installed.

[h2]Patch lists:[/h2]
[list]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2588598892]Auto Mechanics[/url] - [i]Screwdriver[/i] tag to Train Mechanics
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2584991527]Auto Sewing[/url] - [i]SewingNeedle[/i] tag to Train Tailoring
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2875848298]Common Sense[/url] - [i]Crowbar[/i] tag to Pry Doors
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2923979345]Crafting Enhanced Core[/url] - [i]Screwdriver & Hammer[/i] tags to Create Crafting Tables
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2803794394]For Science![/url] - [i]Scissors & SharpKnife[/i] tags to Dissect Corpse & Tinker
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2012990668]Reorganized Info Screen[/url] - [i]Razor[/i] tag to Cut Hair/Beard etc
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2870742794]Tools of The Trade[/url] - [i]Pipe Wrench[/i] (New Tag) tag to Plumb
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2392709985]Tsarslib[/url] - [i]Screwdriver & Wrench[/i] tags to Install Vehicle Upgrades
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2996978365]Dynamic Backpack Upgrades[/url] - [i]SewingNeedle & Scissors[/i] tags to Add/Remove Backpack Upgrades
[/list]
