566115016.title: Build 42+ UNSUPPORTED - Item Tweaker API
566115016.description:
Workshop ID: 566115016
ModID: ItemTweakerAPI

--EDIT 3  - End of Support --
I thank you all who have subscribed, and with these numbers am humbled. 
I am aware this mod no longer works for build 42. I am okay with this, and in fact am glad, as this mod was honestly never really needed. It has been 9 years, and was once drastically needed to help spread modding awareness, this is by far no longer true. 
It is time to return the attention this mod has been given back to the Zomboid devs, who laid the framework this mod piggybacked.

For Context: 
This mod was built during a time where new Zomboid modders would release mods containing entire files worth of item definitions, in order to only change a single entry, thus removing any changes a mod loaded previously would make.

This mod mod makes use of code that Zomboid always had simply to make new modders know how to make mods more compatible. I honestly never intended for people to continue to use this mod for their mods for the last 9 years instead of discovering the real method behind how to do it themselves. 

That being said, while I appreciate the support, and the sheer number of people subscribing, I am going to keep this mod in a mothballed state, ending support for build 42 onward, but keeping it available to any mod still relying on it in build 41. Feel free to unsubscribe when the time for it comes, but it's still been quite a trip.

--EDIT 2--
For those of you who are -still- getting missing file errors, Unsubscribe from the other item tweaker here.
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2510747487

Having both versions subscribed list alone can cause issues, as they are using the same ModID, and is 100% confusing your game's mod enabling/loading attempts.

This alone is making it try to load both my still working code, and the outdated version's now broken code.

Furthermore, if this issue is still happening, and you know you haven't subscribed to this mod, then there may be another mod you've subscribed to that is still using the outdated mod's script files.

I recommend looking into which those are, and suggest those mods switch back to this still working version.

 ---EDIT---
It's come to my attention that there is another version of item tweaker that had been updated at one point. While it may have been an improvement at one point, and I thank him for trying to keep this mod alive, his version is apparently causing many issues in the new build. This version seems to still work very well.

I have not been modding for PZ in quite a long time, however knowing this mod still works now as it did before makes me feel glad to have been part of the modding community. Should this start acting up for real, I may pass it on to someone more active, but as of now, I hope you continue to enjoy it. Thank you again Brybry and Blindcoder for helping to make improved mod compatability possible all these years



---ORIGINAL POST---

This modding API allows any modders to more simply make multiple changes to any items loaded into the game's current database, while leaving the rest of the remaining values alone. This uses code that Zomboid already has implemented, but intended for new modders that haven't discovered those commands yet.

Change any item's weight, display name, display category, hunger reduction, or anything else, while keeping the item as mod friendly as possible. 
(WARNING: changing TYPE will delete all instances of already spawned items) 

You can change only an item icon, while another mod changes the same item's weight, all without conflict (Unless mods do not use this mod to do so, or two mods try to change the same value, in which case, the last loaded mod will win) 

For the Simplest Implementation through LUA: 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------Begin File 
if getActivatedMods():contains("ItemTweakerAPI") then 
require("ItemTweaker_Core"); 
else return end 

TweakItem("Base.Needle","Icon", "Worm");
TweakItem("Base.Needle","Tooltip", "Wearable: Waist");
TweakItem("Base.Needle","DisplayCategory", "Repair");
-----------------------------------------------------------------------End File 
For each item and property you wish to change, create a new line, and place the related values in place. 

You can even add custom ModData to items.
TweakItem("Base.Needle","BaseValue", "500");

Organized Item Names is an example mod to hopefully show beginner modders how to make use of this API

Mods I know of using this API:

2553809727.title: KillCount
2553809727.description:
Details kills by weapon category and by weapon in a new dedicated tab of character window.
[Solo]Adds to the genuine character panel the number of Z that died of other things than player weapon.

[h1]Technical details[/h1]
[list]
[*]Total number of kills can be exported (if selected in sandbox options) to %username%/Zomboid/lua/killcount.txt (windows path)
[*][Solo only] Counts the car & fire & explosion kills in addition to vanilla weapon kills on the genuine character sheet.
[*][Solo only] Explosion Kills are included as Fire Kills in genuine character panel.
[*][Solo & Multiplayer] Details kills by weapon category and by weapon in a new dedicated tab of character window.
[*][Multiplayer] You can visualise the kills of other players, with a delay (configurable in sandbox options).
[*][Multiplayer] You can visualise the total number of kills on the server (same delay).
[*][Multiplayer] You can deactivate the sharing of dead characters from sandbox options (to reduce GlobalModData size on never-wiping servers).
[*][Multiplayer] You can deactivate the sharing of kill count from sandbox options (to remove GlobalModData use).
[*]Visible at death time in the PostDeathUI text (can be removed in sandbox options).
[*]Handles character specific counters (saved with mod data, so server must be stopped properly for the values to be saved).
[*]Works only for one local player. i.e. not for multiscreen.
[*]Ask your questions on [url=https://discord.gg/theindiestone]Discord mod_support channel[/url].
[/list]

Credits where it is due: this is inspired from [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2451245497]Additional Kill Counter[/url]

Workshop ID: 2553809727
Mod ID: KillCount

2874678809.title: Lingering Whispers...
2874678809.description:
Features:
Throughout your play-through, you may hear a singular murmur in the horde, a contorted voice at the door as it tries to break in, pleading souls hidden away, fleeting minds of men giving guidance or begging for mercy as well as lot more.

This occurrence is exceptional rare (0.1% chance but adjustable), you may forget this mod even exists. Their minds are extremely broken & degraded, but despite it all, you can sometimes witness 1-4 understandable words amongst the endless thrum of undeciphered protospeech. This mod is purely text-based (no voice acting) as well as state-sensitive depending on what the zombie is doing, it is meant to be an immersive, somewhat vanilla-friendly, creepy horror mod & works in Multiplayer. 

This is my first mod, hope you enjoy :) There is a lot that i'd like to add to this, such as even more whispers, multi-speak lines, state-sensitivity based on current zombie decay level (how far they are gone), a whole bunch more creepy scenarios where they can talk & so on but unfortunately I am not a very competent coder, so if you'd be interested in helping out with this or future projects, let me know.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

STORY VIDEO NARRATION:
"Dwindling minds...

Trapped bodies no longer their own, an internal struggle takes root... Festering psyches on fire, it sputters & cracks with madness! The horrors they've committed... the loved ones they betrayed... And the struggle for control through waves of insanity & the tortuous decay of thoughts and flesh!...

...But somehow, through that seemingly endless ocean of hallucinogenic thought, rare cases of unfathomable mental resilience somehow occurs... Is this the human spirit...?! Or echos of deeply nested psyche barely holding on! Whatever it may be, through that manic & necrotic choir, Lingering Whispers are heard!

. . . █ █ █ █ █ █ . . .

What was that.... real?!

Or is it just a cruel trick of the dwindling mind of my own...?"

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Also, check out Lingering Reflexes, a mod created by Mr Sunshine that expands upon this concept and takes these dwindling minds a little further!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Special thank you to Albion for assisting with fixes & additional content this mod!

ᴺᵒ... ᵈᵉᵉʳˢ ᶜᵃⁿⁿᵒᵗ ˢᵖᵉᵃᵏ... ʳᶦᵍʰᵗˀ

Credit for the original code goes to Morry - Creator of the Talking Dead mod:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1135650782

Workshop ID: 2874678809
Mod ID: Lingering Voices

Workshop ID: 2874678809
Mod ID: Lingering Voices

2542249811.title: Little Township
2542249811.description:
Little Township is a small community in the middle of Knox County near Pony Roam-O.
Made for 41.60+

Q: Does it...
A: Yes it works in MP, yes it works with the new map, yes it works on any MP server rented or otherwise. No I am not going to help you with rented servers or MP servers in general.

Q: Could you...
A: No.

This little town adds:
- 14 new houses + garages/sheds
- A farm
- Fossoil fuel station + Ice parlor
- Mojo's Motel
- Grace's Groceries
- Brandon's Bar
- A few hidden things

This map mod changes cell 27,28 and will be incompatible with any other mod that changes this cell. Anything else goes.

I created this mod to spice up the middle of the map and to go together with my other mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2485420813][b]Ed's Auto Salvage[/b][/url] but it works just fine on it's own. Probably a more balanced place to start your game then Ed's. :)

It was not specifically made to include a player base, but the farm or one of the larger houses can certainly be used as your base.

Big thank you to Trash Queen who made a [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2551854952][b]plugin for the Eris Minimap![/b][/url]

I made this for myself and I may or may not update this mod, I may or may not fix any issues, no promises. [b]Requests to add or change anything will be largely ignored.[/b]

Permissions:
Anyone may include it or make it compatible with any other mod or modpack, go nuts!

Adds an option to the right click context menu to load/unload all magazines of the selected type. Does not effect radial menu reloading.

[h2]Endless Possibilities[/h2]
Louisville Shipping Port is not just a port; it's a gateway to limitless possibilities. Whether you are a small business looking to expand or a large corporation seeking to optimize your supply chain, our port is designed to meet your unique needs.

[h2]Economic Prosperity[/h2]
Join a thriving community of businesses that have harnessed the power of the Louisville Shipping Port to drive economic growth. Enjoy a competitive edge in the market and contribute to the prosperity of the region.

[h2]Customer-Centric Approach[/h2]
Our commitment to excellence extends beyond logistics. Experience a customer-centric approach that prioritizes your needs, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable experience every step of the way.

Don't miss out on the incredible opportunities that await you at the Louisville Shipping Port. Elevate your business to new heights â€“ where efficiency meets excellence. Contact us today to unlock the full potential of your logistics journey!

Louisville Shipping Port - Your Gateway to Success!

2920089312.title: Maintenance improves repair
2920089312.description:
[h1]What does this do?[/h1]
[list]
[*] When you repair an item, the % repaired scales with your maintenance skill level
[*] Every level of maintenance adds 5% to the total amount repaired, up to a max of 25% additional repair.
[*] Gives a small amount of maintenance XP for each repair
[/list]


[h1]Which repair recipes are changed?[/h1]
All weapon and tool repairs.

Vehicle repair recipes, for example repairing hood with metal sheet, are [b]NOT[/b] changed.


[h1]Customization[/h1]
You can configure which items, materials and skills should not be affected with sandbox variables.

[h1]Multiplayer[/h1]
Works with multiplayer.

[h1]Is this compatible with <Mod> ?[/h1]
I have not tested this with any other mods, use at your own risk.

In theory, it should be compatible with all mods, as it patches the repair recipes on game load. All it does it add the maintenance skill to every repair recipe.

To modders: The mod can be configured to skip repair recipes for certain items, repair materials or skills. See top of patchFixers.lua

Workshop ID: 2920089312
Mod ID: MaintenanceImprovesRepair

2650547917.title: Manage Containers
2650547917.description:
Works with existing saves for singleplayer and multiplayer.

[IMG]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/949594676172630940/DE4E29B45DA7A9A0F0C11E05869F6156D3D1A170/[/IMG]

[h1]What's the purpose?[/h1]
You've just finished a big haul, you're back at your base and now you have to unload everything.  Wouldn't you want to be able to select everything and ask the game to filter for you?
Well now you can!  All you have to do is set which category your containers accepts and you're set.

[h1]How to use[/h1]
Right click any container and select "Configure Container".  This will bring up the list of item categories based on the items present in that save.
It works the same as
[list]
[*]Left click to set one category.
[*]Ctrl + Left click to add/remove a single category.
[*]Shift + Left click to bulk add/remove categories from the previous click to the current click.
[/list]
After you've set the item categories you want this container to receive, here are the two ways to transfer.
[list]
[*]Selecting multiple items in your inventory, right clicking and selecting transfer to assigned containers.
[*]Shift + transferAll for your selected inventory.
[/list]

[h1]Helpful Tip[/h1]
If want to prevent item(s) from being transferred, mark them as favorite and they will stay in your inventory.

[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
This works with any mods that recategorize items (In fact it's better with!).  Including [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2313387159]Better Sorting[/url] or any other mod that recategorize items

[h1]Gamepad Support[/h1]
Gamepad support is barebone but functional (best of my knowledge)
[list]
[*]To manage the specific container, make sure it is highlighted.  You can toggle the inventory in order to cycle nearby containers.
[*]To Transfer All applicable Items, select the option Transfer All + Right Trigger
[/list]
[IMG]https://pbs.twimg.com/media/C6KLWgKWYAAwrAk?format=jpg&name=small[/IMG]

[url=https://Ko-fi.com/jeffv][img]https://i.imgur.com/2uTskWl.png[/img][/url]

Workshop ID: 2650547917
Mod ID: manageContainers

2710167561.title: Map Legend UI [B42\41]
2710167561.description:
[h1]Works with Build 42![/h1]

Playing build 41, but [i]still[/i] don't remember what all the building colors stand for?

Or, perhaps, like me, you think that the vanilla build 42 map key looks a bit... [i]off[/i]?

Suffer no longer.
This mod adds a legend from old town maps to in-game world map.


[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
[list]
[*]Works with all stable builds (41.65 or newer), [b]including build 42![/b]
[*]Might work with newer experimental builds, but no guarantee
[*]Compatible with Multiplayer
[*]Сompatible with the following mods:
[list]
	[*][url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2701170568]Extra Map Symbols & Extra Map Symbols UI[/url]
	[*][url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2280875467&searchtext=russian]Russian Language Pack (41.x)[/url]
	[*][url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2815560151]Share Annotations[/url]
	[*]Any other mod, theoretically.
[/list]
[/list]

[h1]NEW IN VERSION 2.0:[/h1]
[list]
[*]The legend window is now an actual UI element
[*]Created a standalone button to close and open the legend window.
[*]Added support for translations
[list]
	[*]Currently supported languages are listed in the pinned discussion
	[*]Legend window size adjusts automatically depending on your language setting
	[*]Adjusted text alignment (padding) when using languages with non-standard fonts
	[*]Want to submit a translation? Post it in the pinned discussion!
[/list]
[/list]

[h1]FAQ[/h1]
[b]Q: "Can I use this mod in my modpack?"[/b]
A: Yes, as long as you credit the original owner of the mod (me)
[b]Q: "Can this mod be used in an existing world\save?"[/b]
A: It should, but back up your save file before enabling the mod just in case. No guarantees here.

[h1]Special Thanks:[/h1]
[list]
[*][url=steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198117640434]MrBounty[/url] for a bunch of useful information on building a UI and help with the code
[*][url=steamcommunity.com/id/wipe2238]Wipe[/url] for creating compatibility between this mod and the "Extra Map Symbols UI" mod
[/list]

[h1]If you like this mod, don't forget to leave a rating[/h1]

3093700684.title: Medicine Moodles
3093700684.description:
[h2]Works on 41.78.16 SP/MP[/h2]
[h2]Safe to add to/remove from existing saves[/h2]

I just took a painkiller. When should I take the next one?
Medicine Moodles will help you know the duration of pills.
Moodle Level 1: 0%-10% remaining time
Moodle Level 2: 10%-40% remaining time
Moodle Level 3: 40%-70% remaining time
Moodle Level 4: 70%-100% remaining time

[h3]Here are some notes.[/h3]
Antidepressants need some time to take effect.
Drinking alcohol gives a combination effect of Antidepressants, BetaBlockers, Painkillers and less effective SleepingTablets.
Intensity of SleepingTablets stacks. Hover your mouse over the moodle icon to check.
LemonGrass has an internal cooldown for reducing food sickness or poison level.
Other drug mods using vanilla mechanism should be shown as well.

Enable MedicineMoodlesSkillRequirements submod if you want to add skill requirements for moodles instead of showing unconditionally.
The values can be changed in sandbox options.

Workshop ID: 3093700684
Mod ID: MedicineMoodles
Mod ID: MedicineMoodlesSkillRequirements

2866258937.title: [B41/B42] Mini Health Panel
2866258937.description:
A minimalistic wounds display without the need to open the health panel. Can be disappeared when no wound need to be treated.

[img]https://i.ibb.co/vZ2Lghv/gif-mod.gif[/img]

[h1]Updated for Build 42[/h1]
The add-on has been [b][u]updated for Build 42[/u][/b] while a separate version for [b][u]Build 41 remains untouched and fully compatible[/u][/b], thanks to a new files structure system where each version of the mod is only visible by its respective game build, ensuring seamless functionality for players on both versions.

[b][u]Only for B42[/u][/b], It now includes a new muscle strain indicator for each body part. The indicator evolves by becoming less transparent and changes color from orange to red as muscle strain worsens.

If auto-hide is enabled, the silhouette is revealed with a brief blinking effect when a strain threshold is reached.

This feature can be toggled off if not needed.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/BnjPXPr.gif[/img]

[h1]What does it do?[/h1]
It give a permanent overview of your character's wounds on a minimalistic display. The body silhouette disappear when there are nothing to treat and appear when there is a wound.

When a body part is flashing red, there is a wound that needs to be treated.
When it's white, the wound is either bandaged or splinted.
When it's orange, the bandage is dirty and needs to be replaced.

If the wound is bandaged but it's still flashing that means you didn't fully treated the wound (glass still lodged, deep wound needs to be stitched, etc...)

[h1]How to use it?[/h1]
Right clicking on the component will bring a contextual menu with all wounds and the settings of the addon.

Left clicking just brings up the classic health panel of the base game.

You also can drag it around and place it where you desire.

[h1]Optional mod[/h1]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url] is optional and adds an option to disable my mod (mainly for public servers)

[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
This mod should work with any other mod (no incompatibility has been reported so far)
This mod works in single and multi-player.
This mod doesn't work in split-screen and won't be.

[h1]Known issue[/h1]
[list]
[*][strike]Several reports about bandage not properly working, which I couldn't replicate myself. This sounds like a conflict with another addon which I still don't know which one.[/strike] 
[list]
[*]This should be now fixed.
[/list]
[*]The panel may look small or big depending of your game resolution, this is unfortunately a common problem for most of interface add-ons.
[list]
[*]B42 may have fixed GUI scaling, I will look if scaling my panel still makes the silhouettes ugly or not.
[/list]
[/list]
[h1]Support me[/h1]
If you really like my mod you can support me through [b][u][url=https://ko-fi.com/speedy_von_gofast]Ko-fi[/url][/u][/b]

Workshop ID: 2866258937
Mod ID: MiniHealthPanel
Mod ID: MiniHealthPanel

[h2]You can[/h2]

[*]Order mods by name, enabled/disabled, date added, created and updated;

[/list]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725216703]Mod Manager: Server[/url]

[h2]Details[/h2]
[b]ACCEPT[/b] button applies all changes.
[b]BACK[/b] button discards all changes (except saved presets and saved filter settings).

Filters and order:
- [b]Save[/b] button will save selected filters and order, [b]Reset[/b] - click ones to revert to your saved values, long press to reset to defaults;
- Filter "with translation" will show mods that translated into the currently selected game's language;
- Order by "recent" sorts your mods in order you added them to the game.

Mods list:
- [b]FAVORITE[/b] - enables mod in ALL saves. You will be prompted to confirm this action. Removing from favorites will disable it in the current list only;
- [b]HIDE[/b] - disables mod in ALL saves (untick the "hidden" filter and the mod will not be visible in the list). You will be prompted to confirm this action. Removing from hidden will not enable it;
- [b]Keyboard[/b]: check the available hotkeys in the About window in Mod Manager;
- [b]Colored mod names[/b]: green - enabled, yellow - required by some of the enabled mods (hover over the mod name, you will see which of the enabled mods require it), red - not available (select it and in the info panel you will see red text - this is the reason), grey - hidden;
- [b]Icon on the right indicates the mod's location[/b] - Steam - downloaded from the Workshop, folder - located in Zomboid\mods, folder with arrow - located in Zomboid\Workshop.

Mod Manager settings location: [i]c:\Users\<user>\Zomboid\Lua\modmanager.ini[/i]
Saved presets location: [i]c:\Users\<user>\Zomboid\Lua\saved_modlists.txt[/i]
Custom tags location: [i]c:\Users\<user>\Zomboid\Lua\saved_modtags.txt[/i]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2694448564/3198117312270264246/]Documentation for modders[/url]

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]
Game version: [b]Build 41.65+[/b]
Not compatible with other mods that modify ModSelector.lua.
Controller is not supported.

The mod is translated into:
[list]
[*]English, Russian
[*]Brazilian Portuguese - by Shinobinu - 忍犬.
[*]German - by OGDD
[*]French - by Maple
[*]Italian - by Jackobbe
[*]Korean - by RelationLife (Taewook Yang)
[*]Polish - by Blakrajder
[*]Spanish - by Tyrantbit
[*]Simplified Chinese - by TinyHugh
[*]Traditional Chinese - by Snake
[*]Turkish - by SariserpitoTR
[/list]
Know other languages or want to correct an existing translation? [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2694448564/3198117312270399314/]Look here for the information.[/url]

2945221351.title: Mod Manager: Enhanced Load Order
2945221351.description:
This mod adds onto [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2694448564]Mod Manager[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725216703]Mod Manager: Server[/url] to make the mod load order window much more bearable to use. By adding the options to move mods at greater increments, it reduces the number of clicks you need to move through those big modlists you have.

Requires the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2694448564]main mod[/url] to work.

[h1]HEY YOU, COMMENTING ABOUT A NEEDED FEATURE[/h1]
[h3]IM NOT A UI WIZARD - I NEED HELP BECAUSE I DONT KNOW HOW THIS CRAP WORKS! I'VE GOT NO TIME BETWEEN A DEGREE AND A JOB FOR FIGURING IT OUT! THATS WHY I UPDATE LIKE EVERY OTHER MONTH[/h3]
Please consider helping me out, or commissioning some basement dweller, or figuring it out on your own, or something.

[h1]Future Plans[/h1][list]
[*]If you really want another feature to this doinky 30-minute mod I made, then don't solely rely on me to do it and contribute something. Every little bit helps.
[*]People want a search bar, because apparently one isn't enough. I'd never use it, but why not do it anyway? BUT, long story short, things go KABLAM and BOOM and I need someone experienced with this game's UI to help me figure out how to "dim" the list elements darker, with opacity or something. I'll probably look into it myself once I get back to modding during a long vacation, but your help might make this thing happen faster!
[/list]

[h1]Compatibility[/h1][list]

[*]Only functions in main menu (multiplayer & save-game irrelevant)
[/list]

[h1]Languages[/h1]
If you would like to have your language included, please create your own translations and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2945221351/3785877016601593044/]provide them to me below[/url]. Thank you!

3112199765.title: Mod Manager: Load From Collection
3112199765.description:
Now you can paste a link to your Steam collection and mods from it will be automatically activated.

This addon for [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2694448564]Mod Manager[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725216703]Mod Manager: Server[/url] makes it much easier to activate mods from a Steam collection.

Now you don’t need to constantly Alt-Tab, copy the name of the mod and search for it in the mod list, repeating this a couple of hundred times.

[h1]How to use[/h1]
[olist]
        [*]Install and activate [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2694448564]Mod Manager[/url] or [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725216703]Mod Manager: Server[/url]. If you use Mod Manager: Server, place it before the addon in the mod load order.
	[*]Make sure your Steam collection is Public or Unlisted.
	[*]Click on the "From collection" button in the Mod Manager.
	[list]
		[*]If you're not subcribed to all of the mods from the collection, enable the "Skip unsubscribed mods" option.
                [*]If you want to keep current active mods, disable the "Disable current active mods" option.
	[/list]
	[*]Paste your Steam collection link and click "OK". If your collection has many items, be patient, don't click or press anything. Mods from collection will be activated automatically.
	[*]If there are some workshop items that have more than one mod, you'll be asked to manually activate the mods you need from a separate list of mods, which is divided into categories with workshop item names.
[/olist]

[h1]Note[/h1]
If you subscribe to mods from collection while in Zomboid, you'll need to restart the game to refresh mod list.

[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
Compatible with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2945221351]Mod Manager: Enhanced Load Order[/url] and any other mods.

[h1]Contact[/h1]
@paranoid in the [url=https://discord.com/invite/theindiestone]Project Zomboid Discord Server.[/url]

[h1]Credits[/h1]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/NoctisFalco]NoctisFalco[/url] for creating Mod Manager and for the clean, readable code.

I do not claim ownership of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2694448564]Mod Manager[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725216703]Mod Manager: Server[/url]. All credit for the original mods goes to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/NoctisFalco]NoctisFalco[/url].

[img]https://i.imgur.com/cKVBRWw.gif[/img]

[url=https://ko-fi.com/B0B7RZ3XY][img]https://i.imgur.com/2uTskWl.png[/img][/url]

2725216703.title: Mod Manager: Server
2725216703.description:
An extension for [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2694448564]Mod Manager[/url] that makes the process of editing server mod lists much easier and faster. Now you will never forget to add required mods to your server's  config!

[b]If you appreciate my work, please support me:[/b]

[url=https://www.patreon.com/NoctisFalco][img]https://i.imgur.com/RW3Vg8M.png[/img][/url]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/noctisfalco][img]https://i.imgur.com/1xL45if.png[/img][/url]

[h2]Features[/h2]
[list]
[*]Filters, sorting and search;
[*]Separate presets for server mods;
[*]Keyboard navigation;
[*]And more.
[/list]

[h2]Details[/h2]
[b]Left panel:[/b] mods that you have.
[b]Mods from the Workshop are prioritized[/b]: if you have mods with the same ID in your Steam mods folder and in [i]Zomboid/Workshop[/i] or [i]Zomboid/mods[/i], Mod Manager: Server will display the mod from your Steam mods folder. Other functionality is the same as in Mod Manager.
[b]Middle panel:[/b] Workshop IDs in your server config. Hover your mouse over to see a tooltip with its name in the Workshop and currently added mod IDs.
[b]Right panel:[/b] mod IDs in your server config. Hover your mouse over to see a tooltip with its name and Workshop ID.

Changes can be saved using the [b]Save[/b] button (cannot be undone). Selecting a different server config or going [b]Back[/b] cancels all changes (unless you saved them earlier).

You can add mods you are not subscribed to by typing their Workshop ID and mod ID in the text input fields below the server mod lists.
If your server config contains mods that you are not subscribed to, they will be colored red. This doesn't mean they are broken, just makes it easier to manage the list.

[h3]Presets[/h3]
Presets are saved in the same format as the server config ini files. So you can just copy two lines from the presets file and paste them in your config.
[b]Note[/b]: when loading a preset Mod Manager: Server will NOT warn you about broken or missing mods.

Saved presets location: [i]c:\Users\<user>\Zomboid\Lua\saved_modlists_server.txt[/i]

[h2]Maps and Spawn Regions[/h2]
[b]IMPORTANT:[/b] This mod doesn't change [b]maps used by the server[/b] and [b]spawn regions[/b]! If you add or remove mods containing maps and/or spawn regions, you have to edit the [b]Map[/b] and/or [b]Spawn Regions[/b] sections of your server config manually in the vanilla [b]Manage Server Settings[/b] window (or directly the ini config if you know what you're doing).

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]
Game version: [b]Build 41.65+[/b]
Requires: [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2694448564]Mod Manager[/url][/b]
Controller is not supported.

If you want to translate the mod check [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2694448564/3198117312270399314/]this discussion[/url].

[h2]FAQ[/h2]
You [b]do NOT need to add this mod (and Mod Manager too) to your server's mod list[/b]. It only works in the main menu and does nothing when you play.

If you get an error when clicking the [b]Server[/b] button in [b]Mod Manager[/b], make sure you have the latest version of it (currently [b]2.1.1[/b], you can check it in Mod Manager itself). If not, then unsubscribe from Mod Manager, wait before Steam finishes downloading (it says so even when uninstalling) and subscribe again, restart the game.

- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2725216703/3192490350130170127/#c3192490350130230252]How to edit a dedicated server's config[/url]
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2725216703/3192490350130170127/#c3192490350130705807]How to import presets from Mod Manager to Mod Manager: Server[/url]

2169435993.title: Mod Options (Build 41)
2169435993.description:
ModOptions WIP (paused)!

Allows other mods to be customized.
Any mod author can add custom options to their mod.

[h1]Requirements[/h1]
(!) THIS MOD IS COMPATIBLE ONLY WITH BUILD 41
(!) For Build 42 see [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3386860561]here[/url].

[h1]Steam Workshop Issues[/h1]
1. Quit the game.
2. Unsubscribe. Wait ~1 minute.
3. Subscribe. Wait ~1 minute.
4. Make sure the mod version is [b]1.4.4[/b]

[h1]Minimal Code (for modders)[/h1]
Put it in subfolder media/lua/client of your mod folder.
[code]
-- These are the default options.
local OPTIONS = {
  box1 = true,
  box2 = false,
}

-- Connecting the options to the menu, so user can change them.
if ModOptions and ModOptions.getInstance then
  ModOptions:getInstance(OPTIONS, "MyModID", "My Mod")
end

-- Check actual options at game loading.
Events.OnGameStart.Add(function()
  print("checkbox1 = ", OPTIONS.box1)
  print("checkbox2 = ", OPTIONS.box2)
end)
[/code]
This mod should be enbaled.
But note that your mod will work without this mod!
So you do not have to create a hard dependence on this mod.

For more info, see [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2169435993/4260919351480715709/]Guide[/url].

TODO:

- Option like edit input.
- Option like change color.
- Possibility to add custom tab
- Possibility to tune by server admins only (using UI)
- [strike]Sandbox options.[/strike] (done)

2859296947.title: Moodle Framework B41
2859296947.description:
Makes it easy to add moodles for modders.


[h1]Moodle Framework Configuration[/h1]
If you want colors to be easier to distinguish, you can set to white the reference color for moodles.
This applies to both vanilla and modded moodles.
You can also deactivate various displays to enhance mod compatibility.
Modded Backgrounds with small extensions right or down are now handled too.


[h1]How to create a new moodle[/h1]
If you wanna create a Moodle * then follow the next steps, replacing * by your moodle name.

[h2]1/ Moodle Texture[/h2]
Add Moodle *.png under media\ui.
Should be 30 by 30 pixels png with alpha enabled.

[h2]2/ Texture[/h2]
Add the following text under media\lua\shared\Translate\EN
[code]Moodles_EN {
    Moodles_*_Good_lvl1 = "text_1",
    Moodles_*_Good_desc_lvl1 = "text_desc_1",
    Moodles_*_Good_lvl2 = "text_2",
    Moodles_*_Good_desc_lvl2 = "text_desc_2",
    Moodles_*_Good_lvl3 = "text_3",
    Moodles_*_Good_desc_lvl3 = "text_desc_3",
    Moodles_*_Good_lvl4 = "text_4",
    Moodles_*_Good_desc_lvl4 = "text_desc_4",
    Moodles_*_Bad_lvl1 = "text_1",
    Moodles_*_Bad_desc_lvl1 = "text_desc_1",
    Moodles_*_Bad_lvl2 = "text_2",
    Moodles_*_Bad_desc_lvl2 = "text_desc_2",
    Moodles_*_Bad_lvl3 = "text_3",
    Moodles_*_Bad_desc_lvl3 = "text_desc_3",
    Moodles_*_Bad_lvl4 = "text_4",
    Moodles_*_Bad_desc_lvl4 = "text_desc_4",
}[/code]
You can implement only a subset of this as long as you call only the implemented part.

[h2]3/ Moodle object creation[/h2]
Add these lines in your mod:
[code]require "MF_ISMoodle"
MF.createMoodle(*);[/code]

[h2]4/ Moodle value updates[/h2]
Access your moodle from your code with
[code]require "MF_ISMoodle"
MF.getMoodle(*,playerNum):setValue(myNewMoodleValue)--float[/code]
0.0 <= myNewMoodleValue <=1.0
Missing playerNum will make the mod incompatible with SplitScreen.

[h2]For tuning options [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2859296947/3380536561724844838/]see dedicated discussion[/url][/h2]


[h1]Limitations[/h1]
[list]
[*]Not tested with multiplayer. (it is expected to work)
[*]Not tested with splitscreen. (it is expected to work since last version)
[*]Oscillations are not based on vanilla value and the behaviour may depend on performances.
[/list]


[h1]Credits where it is due[/h1]
[list]
[*]This is inspired from the (removed) mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2665369300]Zombie Camouflage[/url] moodle management by the awesome [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Dislaik/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]Dislaik[/url].
[/list]


[h1]Known mods using this[/h1]
[list]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1299328280]More Traits[/url]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2584991527]Auto Sewing[/url]

2685168362.title: More Description for Traits [b41 & b42.8]
2685168362.description:
[h1]NOW COMPATIBLE with 42.8[/h1]

- Corrected the duplication bug
- Refactored the free recipe code so it's limited per crafting category and better to visualize
- Added Inventive description

[hr][/hr]

This mod is intended for players who are confused about what effects each trait and profession has on the character.

It adds description to the traits that need it to describe their effects on the character in detail, instead of leaving people guessing with vague sentences. This way, players can have an easier time imagining their own builds by themselves.

It also adds the description on mouse hover in the character's info screen, in game. This works with descriptions of traits from other mods too, like Banjo's item kits or Dynamic traits for example.

This is based on a combination of my own knowledge, the game's non-exposed Java files (that I learned how to decompile),  the game's exposed Lua files,  your feedback, and the wiki of PZ.

Most of what I added in the traits' descriptions are in parenthesis so you can distinguish what is vanilla description and what is not.

If you notice a typo, or know of an effect that is not listed, or spot something that is wrong or poorly worded, please leave a comment to point it out to me. I don't think I got every single effect that could be listed, and I may have made a mistake somewhere, so I'm relying on you guys for that.

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
Works with build 41, in multiplayer b41. DOESNT WORK with 42.8.
It should be compatible with any mod that adds traits or skills.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Translations[/h1]
B41 translations are CLOSED.
B42 translations are open , but be advised that it risks becoming obsolete soon as B42 gets more matches, and I will most likely take a couple weeks to add the translation.

Anyone is welcome to volunteer to translate to their language.

[hr][/hr]
[h1] Foraging stats:[/h1]
The mod details the foraging stats bonuses for each trait and profession.
Stats are : Foraging radius bonus, Weather Effect reduction, and Darkness Effect reduction and also Specialisation bonuses for every foraging category.
All foraging stats are added dynamically, which means any balance changes will be automatically updated, and other traits that get foraging stats in their descriptions (if they have foraging stats).
Source file: media/lua/shared/Foraging/forageDefinitions.lua

[hr][/hr]
[h1] Character Info Screen Tooltip:[/h1]
The mod displays the detailed description of each trait in the character's info screen window on mouse hover. Works for professions too (except Unemployed since it doesn't have an image).
Works with traits of other mods too! Although their descriptions probably won't be as detailed.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Dynamic Free recipes[/h1]
Free recipes have been dynamically added to each trait and profession description, which means any future free recipe changes in vanilla will automatically show up on this mod, without needing to update the mod.
Modded traits will also have their free recipes added to their description, just like the foraging stats. And modded recipes will also dynamically show up if they are given for free to a trait or profession.
As of 42.8 I limited the number of recipes that can show up on one trait.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Mod Options[/h1]
There are now 3 mod options :
[list]
[*]Show more description 
[*]Show Free Recipes
[*]Show Foraging Stats
[/list]
So you can now disable the things you don't want to see.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Give your feedback[/h1]

I've tried to be as exhaustive as possible, but I'm sure I've made some mistakes or interpreted things wrongly here and there. Please tell me in the feedback & bug reports discussions , or just leave a comment.
[hr][/hr]


Workshop ID: 2685168362
Mod ID (b41): MoreDescriptionForTraits4166
Mod ID (b42): MoreDescriptionForTraits42

3162566044.title: [B41/B42] More Immersive Vehicles
3162566044.description:
B41/B42

Project Zomboid is quite a realistic game, but the developers missed one point. Vehicles in the world appear only with closed doors, raised windows and closed trunks. This mod adds more immersiveness and atmosphere to the game! Vehicles can now have doors open, windows down, or trunks open.

I highly recommend using this mod along with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2807356025]Shark and Cytt's Kentucky Car Overhaul[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2490220997]vehicles by KI5[/url].
Don't forget to adjust the probabilities in the sandbox settings!

Update from 06.08.2024
You can now separately configure probabilities for vehicles in a parking stall, as well as on the road or in traffic jams!

[b]This mod can be added and removed from your saves without any problems.[/b]

[b]WORKS IN SINLEPLAYER AND MULTIPLAYER![/b]

[b]COMPATIBILITY[/b]
Should be with all vehicles. If it is not, please let me know.

[b]INCOMPATIBILITY[/b]
Not sure, but possible with mods that add a new part that can be opened.

2812491628.title: More Loot Settings v1.3.6 [41.78]
2812491628.description:
[h1][u][b]v1.3.6[/b][/u] (Nov 25th 2023) :[/h1]
- Fixed incompatibility with 'The Workshop' mod in multiplayer
- Fixed female zombie loot not being affected by custom zombie loot


[h1][u][b]Please check the mod's description before asking questions.[/b][/u][/h1]

This mod adds custom loot options to the Sandbox Settings, including:
- A [b]zombie loot[/b] multiplier (affects loot of generic zombies, special zombie outfits, and bags)
- A [b]global chance of attached/lodged weapons[/b] on zombies (default is 6%)
- A [b]chance of attached/lodged long blades[/b] on zombies (default is 1)
- A [b]chance of attached/lodged hunting knives[/b] on zombies (default is 5)
- A [b]days passed required for attached/lodged weapon spawns[/b] on zombies (can be none, quarter, half, normal or double)
- An option to set the number of [b]max rolls[/b] for ALL loot tables (see Max Rolls section for more info)
- An option to set the number of [b]max rolls[/b] for FOOD loot tables (see Max Rolls section for more info)
- [b][u]13 different item chance multipliers[/u][/b] for many categories of items (they don't affect zombie loot)
- An [b]exceptions list[/b] ( a semicolon-separated list of items that will not be affected by the multipliers above)
- A [b]specific items multipliers list[/b] ( a semicolon-separated list of items with multipliers)
- The [b]number of cigarettes[/b] found per loot (default to 20 in vanilla)
- Specified loot modifiers displayed for vanilla rarity settings: Extremely Rare (x0.2), Rare (x0.6), Normal (x1), Common(x2) and Abundant(x3).

[h1]"I just want less loot than Extremely Rare"[/h1]
[list]
[*] Still set everything on "Extremely Rare"
[*] Set the Global Max Rolls option at 1, 2 or 3
[*] Set all the chance multipliers to a value below 1
[/list]

[h1]"I just want less food"[/h1]
[list]
[*] Still set Fresh Food and Canned Food on "Extremely Rare"
[*] Set the Food Loot Max Rolls option at 1, 2 or 3
[*] Set the Food Chance Multiplier to a value below 1
[*] Also set the House Story Chance on Extremely Rare
[/list]

[h1]WARNING:[/h1]
The chance multipliers are applied [u][b]ON TOP OF[/b][/u] the standard loot rarity options. (Insanely Rare, Extremely Rare, Rare, etc.)

[h1]Exceptions List:[/h1]
A semicolon-separated list of items IDs. Useful is you want to spare an item from the loot multipliers. Looking at you, Sledgehammer.
[u]Example:[/u]
[i]Base.Sledgehammer;Base.Sledgehammer2;Base.Saw;Base.NailsBox;farming.HandShovel;camping.CampingTentKit[/i]
[b]Note :[/b] The items in this list will still be affected by the Specific Items Multipliers List below !

[h1]Specific Items Multipliers List:[/h1]
A semicolon-separated list of items IDs and multipliers values. Useful to apply individual nerfs or buffs to the loot chances of specific items. Also applies to the items in the exception list above.
[u]Example:[/u]
[i]Base.Sledgehammer:5;Base.Sledgehammer2:5;Base.Saw:0.5;Base.NailsBox:2;farming.HandShovel:0.1;camping.CampingTentKit:0.1[/i]
[b]Note:[/b] you could also remove an item from the loot tables by giving it a chance multiplier = 0.

[h1]Global Max Rolls and Food Loot Max Rolls:[/h1]
Rolls affect loot tables, not item chances like the chance multipliers.
All loot table have a "rolls" key. Most tables have its value at 4, but some have it at 1, 2, 3 or 5. It is directly linked to how many items the table will spawn.
If set at 3, all tables with a rolls value at 4 or 5 will be set to 3. But not those who have their rolls value at 1 or 2. It is a "MAX rolls" setting.
Since most tables have a rolls value of 4, here's what you can expect for each setting:
[list]
[*] 1 : loot will be reduced by ~75%. (basically what "Ridiculously Rare" mod does.)
[*] 2 : loot will be reduced by ~50%.
[*] 3 : loot will be reduced by ~25%.
[*] 4 : only a few unimportant tables will be affected. Pretty much no impact on the loot.
[*] 5 : default vanilla value.
[/list]

[h1]Items added to zombie loot[/h1]
A semicolon-separated list of items IDs and chances that will be added to generic zombie loot. (the "inventorymale" loot table) (Added AFTER the multipliers are applied)
[u]Example:[/u]
[i]Base.Money:0.01;Base.Hammer:0.001;Base.Nails:0.05[/i]
[b]NEW in v1.2[/b] There are now many options for many zed categories (military zeds, police zeds, medical zeds...). As well as a customized list of outfits that will drop a custom list of items. The format is the same as the example above. If you want to know which outfits belong to which category, see the list of zed outfits in the Discussion.
[u]Warning:[/u] With these lists, if you make a typo and an error occurs (red box bottom right), it is possible that the distribution tables completely reset to their vanilla state.
[u][b]CHECK THE LOOTZED TOOL IN DEBUG BEFORE REPORTING A BUG.[/b][/u]

[h1]The mod "Time Decreases Loot" is INCLUDED in More Loot Settings.[/h1]
[IMG]https://i.imgur.com/rOYTt5k.png[/IMG]
For more info on this, check out the standalone mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2836575002]Time Decreases Loot [/url] .

[hr]
[IMG]https://i.imgur.com/q2soh0H.png[/IMG]


Some people say it works good. Other people say they have their sandbox settings get reset to their default value. This can be avoided by directly changing the default values in the mod's files.
I can't test it myself so I don't really know.
Time Decreases Loot can be finnicky in multiplayer. You MUST disable the trigger on dead bodies and the trigger on proximity. Yoy may also need to disable triggers on vehicles.
[hr]
[IMG]https://i.imgur.com/hH2PGen.png[/IMG]


- Map mods like [b][u]Pitstop[/u][/b] : As of v1.1.1, fully compatible
- [b][u]Better Sorting[/u][/b] : Fully compatible.
- [b][u]Ridiculously Rare[/u][/b] : Fully compatible. (rolls are set to 1)
- [u][b]Smoker[/b][/u] : you will need to set the 'number of cigarettes' option to 1.
- [u][b]True Music[/b][/u] : As of v1.3, fully compatible.
- [u][b]Better Sorting[/b][/u] : fully compatible.
- Mods that change item display categories (except Better Sorting) will work but item chances may not be multiplied correctly as intended.
- Mods that add items or tweak distributions: Compatible, as long as they set standard display categories for them.

[hr]

It's recommended to run my other mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3033301901][u]"Vanilla Loot Tables Fixed"[/u][/url] along with this, but it's not strictly necessary.

[hr]

Workshop ID: 2812491628
Mod ID: MoreLootSettings

2729427093.title: More Maps (Updated 2024)
2729427093.description:
[h1]B42 version is released on a separate mod[/h1]

Click here for the b42 version : [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3390897023]More Maps b42[/url]

This mod adds map items of vanilla map locations and modded map locations.

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Update: June 2024 [/h1]
[list]
[*] Made new lootable map items for 9 modded maps, bringing the number of mods accounted for to 131.
[*] Heavier nerf of vannilla Louisville maps
[*] Fixed some inconsistencies

[/list]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Sandbox Settings[/h1]
Lootable map items can be removed through Sandbox Settings if you don't think a specific location should have a map.
[b]Note:[/b] If the related mod is not enabled, the related lootable map items will be automatically be removed, EVEN if the tickbox is checked.

Also, a loot multiplier is available to tweak how the maps' loot chances. 
If you enable the Louisville District Maps option, the vanilla Louisville maps spawn chance will be heavily nerfed

Maps can be removed from Foraging tables as well.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Lootable map items of vanilla map locations:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Valley Station
[*] Valley Station - Mall Area
[*] Valley Station - Summer Camp (rare)
[*] Ekron (compatible with the mod "New Ekron")
[*] Riverside Country Club  (uncommon)
[*] Scenic Grove Mobile Park 
[*] Dixie Mobile Park
[*] Pony Roam-O (uncommon)
[*] Warehouse Complex (south west of muldraugh)
[*] Eastern Railyard 
[*] 5x Cabins (very rare, not found in the usual places)
[*] Camp grounds (rare)
[*] Louisville (COMPLETE map of louisville, VERY rare)
[*] 15x Louisville Districts (15 maps of different districts, uncommon)
[*] Western Farmlands (rare)
[*] Western Abandoned Factory (rare)
[*] Military Base (very rare, not found in the usual places)
[*] Kentucky (COMPLETE map of Knox Country, INSANELY RARE, DISABLED by default, must be enabled in sandbox options, not found in the usual places)
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Lootable map items of modded map locations: [/h1]
131 mods. (9 new)
Not enough space here. See the discussion: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2729427093/4035850170399907541][u][b][i]"List of modded map locations accounted for"[/i][/b][/u][/url].

[hr][/hr]

Some mods have not added the ingame map feature to their map zones yet, so I can't make map items for them.
Once they have mapped their mod, I will add the corresponding item (if they haven't already).

[hr][/hr]

[h1]WARNING : READ THIS[/h1]
If you want to use one of these map items:
Eerie Country maps, Slocan Lake maps, Fort Knox linked to Eerie Country, West Point Expansion, Glenport
you will need the mod : "IngameMaps" by alree_unjammer.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Where can I find these maps?[/h1]
[list]
[*] in vehicle gloveboxes,
[*] on magazine racks,
[*] in sidetables that aren't in bedrooms (very rare),
[*] in survivor bags, hiking bags, duffel bags, school bags, golf bags and satchels,
[*] in mechanics crates and shelves (rare),
[*] in crates containing random junk (rare),
[*] in crates of map factories,
[*] On the following zombies :raiders, hunters, survivalists, police officers, private militia, military soldiers and officers, mechanics, fishermen, campers, bikers, bandits, ambulance drivers, park rangers, cyclists, tourists, traders, postmen, air crew (varying chance for individual maps relative to the outfit : military maps and big maps on military zeds, town maps on town zeds, countryside maps on country side zeds):
[*] through Foraging (as junk category, starting skill level 4, can be disabled in sandbox options)
[/list]

Some mods (Bedford Falls, Pineville, Taylorsville, Trelai, Monmouth County, St Bernard's Hill...) already have a lootable map item. When that's the case, I add it to the loot tables above, but only if the mod author hasn't already done so.

[hr][/hr]

Workshop ID: 2729427093
Mod ID: MoreMaps

3147442677.title: More Zombie Death Animations (B41)
3147442677.description:
Have you ever felt like cutting down a horde of zombies felt a little underwhelming? Perhaps seeing the same death animation repeat over and over again took away some of the fun and enjoyment that you would have otherwise gotten. Thanks to this mod, cutting down hordes of zombies will be as exciting as ever, featuring both quick and dramatic death animations to enhance your zombie slaying experience.

Features:
-Changes and adds various zombie death animations utilizing unused developer assets. (five in total)
-The animations are tied to a zombie's walk animation, allowing for more animation variety than in vanilla.
-Works with melee, ranged, and even throwable weapons
-Works with zombies who die to fire and explosives
-Compatible with popular animation mods such as Authentic Animations, True Actions, and
 Fancy Handwork
-Should be fully compatible with any mod that doesn't make changes to the zombie death animations or the zombie falldown and walktoward folders

[b]Important[/b]: This mod works best when zombie speed is set to fast shamblers (default) or sprinters. Zombies set to shambler speed will only have three out of the five death animations.

Works with multiplayer.  Server-sided.
Safe to add or remove from an existing save game.

[b]Information Regarding Build 42[/b]: 

Hello everyone,

First of all, I just wanted to thank all of you for the support and kind words in the comment section. I'm glad my mod was able to bring enjoyment to your various Zomboid playthroughs. As I have stated previously, I was originally planning to update this mod to build 42 as long as the developers didn't make any major changes to the animation system.

However, during my brief testing of build 42's unstable build, it seems that the developers have completely overhauled the part of the animation system that I made modifications to. Their new system seems to take both the weapon type and swing direction into account when a zombie is killed, making my mod inferior to their new system. Additionally, the animation rework that the developers introduced in build 42 was actually my original goal when making this mod. 

It is for these reasons that I have decided to not update this mod to build 42. It will stay on the Steam page for those of you who prefer to play on build 41, but it will not receive any further updates.

Thanks again for the support, and have fun in build 42!

Workshop ID: 3147442677
Mod ID: More_Zombie_Death_Animations

2801575579.title: MoreBrews!
2801575579.description:
[h1]Getting Started with Homebrewing Beer in PZ[/h1]
I have been diligently putting this together to share one of my personal hobbies with the PZ community. I did my best to capture the process of brewing beer from start to finish.

[h1]WINE ME UP! - 3.01 Edition:[/h1]
A very large edition to the mod basically doubling the foundation of MoreBrews. This includes the ability to create/ferment/age/bottle a variety of different wines. Here is the following list of new alcoholic beverages:

[h1]Wines & More:[/h1]
[list]
  [*]Pinot Nior
  [*]Merlot
  [*]Cabernet Sauvignon
  [*]Pinot Grigio
  [*]Riesling
  [*]Sauvignon Blanc
  [*]Banana Wine
  [*]Peach Wine
  [*]Pear Wine
  [*]Pineapple Wine
  [*]Rosehip Wine
  [*]Strawberry Wine
  [*]Wild Berry Wine
  [*]Honey Mead
  [*]Hard Cider
[/list]

[h1]What else happened:[/h1]
This was designed as a branch build so you can choose between only beer or only wine or select to have both. They function together or accommodate being on their own. Tested to function with version 41.73 and also still works with 41.71 to accommodate MP servers.
[list]
  [*] New Vintner trait can be earned or selected on character creation
  [*] 5 New Wine making Magazines to learn how to interact with the content
  [*] Streamlined fermentation process, much more reliable than previous iteration
  [*] Naming convention, icons, and tooltips adjusted to create clearer directions
  [*] Distribution reimagined to ease those loot tables but Wine/Brewing kits got an upgrade on its contents
  [*] 15 different custom bottle textures, 6 wine box textures, and varying barrel textures added
  [*] Heavy lean into foraged goods + make use of those corks you find (plus new bags of them added)
  [*] 1 Gallon batches lead to 5 bottles and Large barrels lead to 20 - aging red and white wine mechanic included
[/list]

[h1]Is it safe to add / remove?[/h1]
Previous carboys will have disappeared due to item change to fix the fermentation process. Was tested with an old save, in 41.71 and within 41.73. Otherwise no original items were edited, should be able to add or remove this mod at any time. Safe to say you will lose any items you gained from this mod if you remove it. [b][i]NOTE: This has not been thoroughly tested against other mods or in MP[/i][/b]

[h1]Where do I find supplies[/h1]
Brewing/Wine Kits will be found mostly in Gigamarts but rarely in garages. A few supplies will be found in tool shops (Bottle Capper + Can Sealer). Beer and wine bottles will be in bars and in a minimal amount of fridges. The remaining supplies will need to be crafted or obtained through kits.

[h1]Additional Information[/h1]
Most likely will be adding in a distilling process for spirits. Then adding in cocktails to work nicely with future updates. Growable plants are not in the near future, I need to have a better grasp of the code surrounding farming as it impacts gameplay and I would hate to break a save/server.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1660101375273576639/0C12E325C464F5DC166E5FF2AB70A43581BED64F/[/img]

I appreciate your interest in my mod, please don't forget to rate it. If you feel especially inclined, donating a [url=https://ko-fi.com/ryanhayes]coffee[/url] goes a long way for me.

[url=https://ko-fi.com/ryanhayes][img]https://i.imgur.com/2uTskWl.png[/img][/url]

[b]Other workshops by me:[/b]

[table]

3150779947.title: Multiple Generators
3150779947.description:
[h1]Multiple Generators[/h1]
Combine power of multiple generators.  With this mod, generators can work in parallel, so that they consume less fuel.  Game will recognize what items are within range of more than one generator and split fuel usage across them proportionally. Check how generator info data changes when you turn on more generators.

Finally your frozen rabbits are safe and you can safely go scavenging.

As an extra feature, stove power consumption depends on temperature setting.  Probably more fine-tuning options will be added later. 

Generator info window is slightly more neat so that you can easily see the list of devices on their power usage. 

Additionally you can see a graph for historical data of power usage. If you you solar panels mod then you can see the effect of the failsafe that was triggered. Also check my [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3209239259]sensors mod[/url] that introduces a lot of house automation related to lights and other devices that help you conserve fuel and improve your life in other aspects. 

Works with Generator Time Remaining and Generator Range mods.
Can be added mid-game. Works single and multiplayer.

If you like my work:
[url=/ko-fi.com/M4M7SGR4P][img]https://storage.ko-fi.com/cdn/kofi2.png?v=3[/img][/url]

Workshop ID: 3150779947
Mod ID: MultipleGenerators

Mod ID: MultipleGenerators

2857842616.title: Music for the End of the World [True Music]
2857842616.description:
[h1][b]Note: The current version's loot spawning system is a little buggy and isn't always functional. We are currently working on a huge update, Music for the End of the World 2.0, which will hopefully fix these issues. Hang in there![/b][/h1]

[h1]Note 2: This mod is about 4 gigabytes. If that's too much for you, consider a smaller pack. It's a lot of music files, it's going to take up space on your computer and there is no smaller I can make it.[/h1] 

[h1]Music for the End of the World seeks to be the ultimate lore-friendly True Music pack for those who just can't get enough tunes in their Apocalypse.[/h1]
This monolithic True Music mod is the result of dozens and dozens of hours of work and tons of helpful requests from the Project Zomboid community. It's based on Tsar's True Music framework, and was originally titled "Rose Music", and produced for the enjoyment of the Ravenrose RP community. However, the mod far outgrew its original scope, leading to a public release.

[h1]This True Music mod adds 1,000 tracks, listed [url=https://pastebin.com/s8KJJxSN]here.[/url][/h1]
This mod's features include:
- [b]725[/b] completely lore-friendly tracks from the year 1993 or before.
- [b]250[/b] more tracks in the 'Extended' expansion which are mostly from between the years of 1994 and 2000, but with a few between 2001 and 2004.
- [b]25[/b]...? tracks in the Silent Hill expansion, which adds a collection of songs from across the series... and some extremely rare extras from another 2008 horror game that drop from zombies (though this can be toggled).

- Vinyl covers for every single track from the Main and Extended branches.
- Three different kinds of rare 'loot boxes' to find that contain either 50, 25, or 10 of their respective music item.
- A completely unique loot distribution system designed to account for the vast amount of items added by this mod.

- Total customization. You can customize:
-- Whether or not Cassettes or Vinyls spawn
-- How many, and how frequently, they spawn
-- Whether cassettes can drop from zombies, and how frequently they do
-- The weight of all cassettes, vinyls, and the Boombox
-- The rate at which Boomboxes consume batteries
-- Whether or not 'loot boxes' can spawn, how many items they give, and how often they spawn

All of the mods in this pack are optional [b]except for Music for the End of the World: Core or MusicfortheEndOP[/b] which is [b]required[/b] for [b]any[/b] of the packs to function. It contains no music itself, only code handling loot distribution, sandbox settings and the 'loot boxes'.

[h1]Want a tasteful dash of modern songs? Check out [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2915429368]Music for the End of the World: Home Labelled![/url][/h1]

[h1]Credits[/h1]
[b]Lea[/b], myself, did most of the creative legwork behind the mod, as well as all of the grunt work collecting, converting, and implementing songs, writing some portions of code, and generally 'designing' the mod. If you have questions or need to get in contact about the mod, I am the one to contact.
[b]Albion[/b] wrote a great majority of the unique code that gives MFTEOTW its many powerful features, particularly the loot distribution system and item boxes. Check out her workshop page [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/demiurgeQuantified/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]here.[/url]
[b]Alphadin[/b], my friend who wrote a bunch of regex for me that made updates much less time-consuming at the scale we're working at.
[b]Corvo[/b], the person who got me into making this mod in the first place and who gave me a tremendous RP experience on Ravenrose RP.
[b]Tsar[/b] himself, for making True Music so easy to use and work with.

If you enjoy this mod, consider liking and favoriting it. Thank you!
If you'd like to tip me for my work, you can do so [url=https://paypal.me/audreyglyph]here.[/url]

Workshop ID: 2857842616
Mod ID: [b]MusicfortheEndOP[/b]
Mod ID: MusicfortheEnd
Mod ID: MusicfortheEndEX

[h1]Terms[/h1]
This item is not authorized to be repackaged or posted anywhere other than this Workshop page without my permission. Please comment below if you have some kind of special circumstance that requires you to repack this mod. Taking this mod, expanding its tracklist and reuploading it is also [i]not permitted[/i]; simply make your own expansion with True Music, it's easy.

[h1]Please read the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2857842616/3722820118825993891/]Frequently Asked Questions[/url] before commenting. If you ask a question that is answered by the F.A.Q. or description, I will not answer it.[/h1]

3173081439.title: Musical Menu Framework
3173081439.description:
[h2][b]B42 unstable is supported.[/b][/h2]

[b]This mod does nothing on it's own. You only need it if another mod requires it.[/b]

This is a simple framework that enables modders to add as much music to the main menu as they like, and they will play at random.

[h1]It's rather simple to create a mod that uses Musical Menu Framework[/h1]
1. In mod.info, set: require=MusicalMenuFramework
2. Place your sounds in media/sound. Give them unique names.
Example: YourModId_Artist_Title.extension

3. Create a lua file in media/lua/client. Give it a unique name: YourModId_MenuMusic.lua
Example code:
[code]
require("RYUKU_MMF.lua")
MMF_AddMusic("YourModId_Artist_Title", "YourModId")
[/code]

And that's it!

[h2]Support is available via the Discord link below.[/h2]
[url=https://discord.gg/jWCsPcjWrR][img]https://i.postimg.cc/VvjnMPmN/ryukus-workshop.png[/img][/url]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/ryumods][img]https://i.postimg.cc/mrsRkDGx/kofi-steam.png[/img][/url]

Workshop ID: 3173081439
Mod ID: MusicalMenuFramework

3101668503.title: Mutie's Context Menu Icons
3101668503.description:
[h2]Functionality[/h2]

It just adds icons to tooltips. There are no options or the like to modify the behaviour currently.

Full list of context menu options covered:

- Attach (in inventory and on hotbar)
- Drink (including the submenu "All", "1/2", and "1/4"
- Drop item
- Eat (including the submenu "All", "1/2", and "1/4")
- Equip (primary, secondary, in both hands, and on back)
- Favourite (and unfavourite)
- Inspect clothing
- Apply make up
- Place item
- Read
- Rename map, bag, and food
- Smoke
- Unequip
- Wear clothing
- Sitting on ground
- Sleeping
- Walking to
- Turning on appliances and switches
- Turning off appliances and switches

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]

Should be compatible with any mod that changes context menu options. If you find any exceptions, please write a comment!

[h2]Translation[/h2]

The mod uses the in-game translation strings to find your context menu options in whatever language you play in. Should be compatible with any language.

[h2]Promotion[/h2]

Also check out my other mods:
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2845019579]Mutie's Bait Tooltips[/url]

2822983942.title: Named Literature
2822983942.description:
[h3]More flavor text and functionality for literature items found in game.[/h3]

[url=https://ko-fi.com/chuckleberryfinn][img]https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ChuckTheSheep/chuckImages/main/kofi.png[/img][/url][url=https://discord.gg/SReMnbV4V7][img]https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Chuckleberry-Finn/chuckImages/main/PZmodCommBanner3.png[/img][/url]

[h3][b]This mod does not use item scripts. Everything is lua based.[/b][/h3]
[B]What this means is that loot-tables are not overwhelmed or flooded with books.[/b]
Applied to: Books, Magazines, HottieZs, TVMagazines, Comic-Books, Newspapers, Wordsearches, Crosswords.

[list]
[*] Titles are applied randomly to books from a list of over 3000+ titles.
[*] The 3000+ titles are sorted by year/decade/century written, with a preference for modern (1993); include every century up to the 4th.
[*] Book descriptions and tooltips will also include author and publication date for extra flavor (text).
[*] Magazines utilize a similar system but just of magazine titles from a list of 60+ titles.

[*][B]Additional Features:[/b]
[list]
[*] Literature items can be re-read for a diminished stress/boredom/unhappiness relief. (If given enough time you can re-read for full amount.)
[*] Literature items are color coded (based on a seeded process), colors should always be consistent. [b](Coloring 3D models not yet working/may not be possible.)[/b]
[/list]
[/list]

[url=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Chuckleberry-Finn/chuckImages/main/bingo.png][img]https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Chuckleberry-Finn/chuckImages/main/readThrough.png[/img][/url]

3054443004.title: Nihilist's Silencers
3054443004.description:
Introducing silencer attachments for specific firearm calibers, obtainable in the world or through crafting. They vary in effectiveness by caliber, such as 25% noise reduction for shotguns and 40% reduction for 9mm pistols by default. They're intentionally scarce and challenging to craft to maintain game balance, but you can freely customize them to suit your preferences.

Currently, it supports [b]all base game firearms[/b] (exceptions: Sawn-off and Double Barrel Shotguns) and several mods such as [i]Vanilla Firearm Expansion[/i].

[h3]★ Can be added/removed mid-save![/h3]

[h3] [b]Important[/b], you [i]only[/i] need to enable [b]"Weapon Sound Only - For Addons"[/b] in game mods menu for this mod to work. You DON'T have to enable main "Weapon Sound Expansions" mod.[/h3]

[h1]Added Firearm Attachments[/h1]
[list]
[*] Silencer (.22)
[*] Silencer (9mm)
[*] Silencer (.44 Magnum)
[*] Silencer (.45 ACP)
[*] Silencer (.38 Special /.357 Magnum)
[*] Silencer (.223 / 5.56x45mm)
[*] Silencer (.308 / 7.62x51mm)
[*] Silencer (Shotgun)
[/list]

You need to have a screwdriver to attach these.

[b]Important[/b]: you cannot use a silencer designed for one caliber on a weapon with a different caliber. However, you can convert between them using conversion recipes.

[h1]Supported Mods[/h1]
[list]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2667899942]Vanilla Firearm Expansion (B41)[/url]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2873405334]Gunrunner's Weapon Pack (A VFE Expansion)[/url] 
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2893333090]VFE - S.T.A.L.K.E.R pack[/url] 
[/list]

[h1]Sandbox Customization (all the details, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3054443004/3882724699526957719/]Here[/url])[/h1]
▸ for each silencer attachment
[list]
[*] change [b]effectiveness[/b] in % [i](See [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3054443004/3882724699526957719/]Here[/url] for further details)[/i]
[*] increase [b]base sound radius[/b] [i](Default, 0)[/i]
[*] enable/disable [b]crafting recipe[/b] [i](Default, true)[/i]
[*] change [b]loot rarity[/b] [i](See [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3054443004/3882724699526957719/]Here[/url] for further details)[/i]
[/list]
▸ for crafting and conversion recipes
[list]
[*] adjust [b]metalworking[/b] level requirement for crafting recipes [i](Default, 6)[/i]
[*] adjust [b]aiming[/b] level requirement for crafting recipes [i](Default, 2)[/i]
[*] enable/disable all [b]conversion[/b] recipes [i](Default, true)[/i]
[*] adjust [b]metalworking[/b] level requirement for conversion recipes [i](Default, 5)[/i]
[*] adjust [b]aiming[/b] level requirement for conversion recipes [i](Default, 2)[/i]
[/list]
▸ miscellaneous settings
[list]
[*] adjust [b]base loot modifier[/b] for all silencer types [i](Default, 1.0)[/i]
[*] enable/disable [b]multiplayer sound radius limitation[/b] [i](Default, true)[/i]
[*] enable/disable [b]overriding base firing sounds[/b] [i](Default, false)[/i]
[/list]

[h1]Next[/h1]
[list]
[*] make [i]Weapon Sounds Expansions[/i] mod optional ? I must find good sound effects tho...
[*] make some of the silencer models smaller
[/list]

[h1]Credits[/h1]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561199178116693/]Satispie[/url] for the sound mod!

2508327382.description:
Remove any chance to fall for any clothing item.

[h1]Details[/h1]

[*]Requires [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2510747487]Item Tweaker[/url] mod to be active.

3027064433.title: Noir Rifle Slings Tweak (Wear 4 slings)
3027064433.description:
A little tweak of Noir's Rifle Slings Mod that makes it so that all positions of the slings are wearable.

The slings do however take up the Middle Left and Right Fingers and the Ring Left and Right Fingers. So you won't be able to wear rings with them which won't be an issue for most.

All of the slings no longer take up the sling slot, so you can wear something from another mod.

If the tweak isn't working then you need to use Mod Manager to change the load order and make sure that this tweak is loaded after Noir's mod. It won't work if it doesn't override. The 3rd screenshot shows how it should look.


Workshop ID: 3027064433
Mod ID: Noir Sling Tweak

2754567348.description:

    -Weapon

    -Utility Left
    -Utility Right
    -Left Side
    -Right Side
    -Container
    -Small Container Left
    -Small Container Right

3056481712.title: On the Door
3056481712.description:
[h1][b]In Build 42, keys no longer spawn on doors. However, the logic for obtaining keys from doors remains intact. Therefore, this mod has been updated to be compatible with Build 42 in case door key spawning is reintroduced in the future. It's difficult to check the implementation frequently, so if you can confirm that spawn on the door have been restored with this mod for B42, please let me know![/b][/h1]

[h1]Overview & Features :[/h1]
Car keys spawn in the ignition, glove box, buildings near the vehicle, on the ground, and on zombies, but there is also a low probability that they will spawn on the "vehicle door". However, when it spawns on a vehicle door, there is no way to confirm that it has spawned, and it seems that the key can only be retreived under certain conditions.

Therefore, this mod will add the feature to automatically retrieve the keys from the door and notify the player with a message when the player attempts to enter a vehicle whose keys are spawned on the door, regardless of the conditions.
[b][i]Confirmed to work with Build 41/42 and also work on MP.[/i][/b]

[h1]Q&A :[/h1]
[list]
[*][h2]What is the probability of a key spawning on a vehicle door?[/h2]
It is 1/4 probability compared to the spawn to the glove box. Of course, spawning keys on the door is not a feature of this mod, but of vanilla. This mod only reteives keys that have already spawn on the door.

[*][h2]Is it possible to retrieve the key from the door without using this mod?[/h2]
Yes, it's possible. If a key is spawned on the door, it can be retrieved when trying to enter through a locked door. However, there is no notification, and the key is only silently added to your inventory.

[*][h2]Do I need to try entering through every door to retrieve the key from the door?[/h2]
No, as long as the key is spawned on the door of that car, the key can be retrieved by entering through any door.

[*][h2]Does it work even if it's enabled in the middle of the save data? Or do I need a new game?[/h2]
This mod makes it easier to get keys spawned on doors, rather than having them spawned on doors. Therefore, a new game is not required.
[/list]

[h1]Options :[/h1]
These options are available with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url] in B41.
[list]
[*]Finding Message Notification : Can specify whether to enable or disable.
[*]Sound Volume (Found) : You can adjust the sound volume when you find the key on the door.
[/list]

[h1]Known Issues :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Nothing
[/list]

[h1]Future plans :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Bug fix (if it exists)
[/list]

[h1]Release Notes :[/h1]
[list]
[*]v1.5 - Compatible with Build 42.
[*]v1.4 - Added Sound Options.
[*]v1.3 - Added ranslation (ES).
[*]v1.2 - Added sound effect file for replacement.
[*]v1.1 - Added ranslation (KO, PTBR, TH).
Please refer to "Change Notes" for the older history.
[/list]

[code]
If you enjoy this mod and would like to support its development, you can do so through the services below. Your support helps keep me motivated and allows me to continue improving and updating the mod. All contributions will be used for development purposes, such as AI service subscriptions.

[/code]

Hi survivors!
I am Woldren and this is my map: Over the River

The bridge has a town above it, as in Fallout 3.
Warning: place the generator on the roof, check the pictures above to see where it is.
The bridge is a giant building, so if you place it on the street, you'll receive damage, since the street is part of the building.

The bridge is connected to a ship, that has secret passages, secret rooms etc etc.

Through the ship you can reach the land on the other side of the river.
Cell 38x20 contains Walter White's house, from Breaking Bad.
Cell 38x19 contains a large military base.
Cell 39x20 contains a logging  factory.
Cell 39x19 contains Grove Street, from GTA San Andreas.
The military base contains a new hospital
Inside the base there is also an underground bunker full of loot.
