2281256511.title: Paint Your Ride
2281256511.description:
Tired of boring uniform colors? Want something shiny? Get ready, we're about to Paint Your Ride!

[h2]Features[/h2]
[list]
[*]25 spray paint colors
[*]white paint + 7 tinting paints to mix any color
[*]vehicle sanding and priming
[*]spray and tinting paint catalogues
[/list]
[b]Only civilian vehicles[/b] from the vanilla game and supported mods can be painted.

[h2]How To[/h2]
Before you paint vehicles you need to learn how to do that. Read Autostyle Magazine - Vehicle Painting: volume 1 teaches how to paint vehicles, volume 2 - how to mix paint. Mechanics (or any other) skill doesn't matter.

Then you need to do the following:
[olist]
[*]Wash your car if it's dirty.
[*]Uninstall all windows from it.
[*][b]Sand vehicle:[/b] remove old paint and rust. Requires Wire Brush.
[*][b]Prime vehicle:[/b] prepare surface for new paint. Requires Spray Primer.
[*][b]Paint Your Ride![/b] You have two options:
  [list]
  [*]Paint with ready-to-use sprays - 25 predefined colors for you. Find HSV Spray Paint Catalogue to preview the available colors;
  [*]Mix any color you want.
  In order to do that you need Automotive Paint White and any Tinting Paints (7 available, or you can paint with just clear white paint), and, of course, Spray Gun (requires battery to operate) to apply. Find HSV Tinting Paint Catalogue for tints proportions for some colors.
  [/list]
[/olist]

Every step (except washing) requires personal protective equipment. One of the following:
[list]
[*]Dust Mask and Safety Goggles;
[*]Gas Mask;
[*]Nuclear Biochemical Mask.
[/list]
Safety first!

[h3]Paint amounts[/h3]
One paint can has 10 units of paint.
The larger the car, the more paint is required. Ranges from 21 (2.1 cans) to 45 units (4.5 cans) for the vanilla vehicles.
One tinting paint bottle has 100 units of paint.
To mix a color you can use up to 100 units of each tint. You can achieve same color with different tints combinations.

[h3]Items spawn[/h3]
Spray and tinting paints are distributed mostly in boxes: open them to get up to 4 spray cans of one color or up to 8 tints (6 different + 2 black). There is a chance to get full cans/bottles.

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]
Game version: [b]Build 41.60+ (works only in single for now)[/b]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2675429658]1970 Ford Mustang Boss 302[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1510950729]Filibuster Rhymes' Used Cars![/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2661819460]Ford Crown Victoria 1999 (beta)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2664866820]Nissan 240sx (beta)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2698931985]Nissan Skyline GTR R34[/url]

[h3]For modders[/h3]
If you create recolorable vehicles and want them to be supported by this mod, see [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2281256511/3198118671848972118/]this discussion[/url].

This mod is translated into:
[list]
[*]English, Russian
[*]Brazilian Portuguese - by ZL18k
[*]French - by Bobitec
[*]German - by 0xM4RC3L
[*]Polish - by Eggon
[*]Spanish - by Siowar
[/list]
You know other languages or want to correct an existing translation? [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2281256511/3001047413720483356/]Look here for the information[/url].

[b]Thanks to Aiteron[/b] for the ideas!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/cKVBRWw.gif[/img]

[b]Developing mods takes a lot of my free time and I would appreciate it if you could give me more motivation to create quality content by supporting me:[/b]

[url=https://www.patreon.com/NoctisFalco][img]https://i.imgur.com/RW3Vg8M.png[/img][/url]

[url=https://discord.gg/pQWytxRmUJ][img]https://i.imgur.com/MQBcH2s.png[/img][/url]

[b]My other mods:[/b]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2694448564][img]https://i.imgur.com/Ftm27X1.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2657661246][img]https://i.imgur.com/N60VTc8.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2643751872][img]https://i.imgur.com/AnQBQMI.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2651600962][img]https://i.imgur.com/pT8HC9G.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2619072426][img]https://i.imgur.com/DP2f9VP.png[/img][/url] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2289429759][img]https://i.imgur.com/vS5zAf0.png[/img][/url]

2869928441.title: Pantry Packing Add-on - Smorgasbord
2869928441.description:
A smorgasbord of 'recipe' additions to cover things like skill books, canned goods and other suitable packables added by other mods using the most excellent Pantry Packing system by darkmoriarti.  Requires Pantry Packing, as this mod contains no models, textures, etc.--just added item packing recognition.  Additionally, if you have Better Sorting, this will follow its category formatting for boxed goods too!

Current mod coverage:

-Advanced Sodas
-Better Literacy: A Literature Overhaul (Literacy Skill)
-Driving Skill
-Extra Books
-Le Gourmet Revolution (Box up Hunting books and 4 kitchen additions!)
-Literacy Mod - Learn to Read, Read Faster
-Literacy Skill
-MoreBrews! (Box up Brewing & Wine Making books!)
-More Skill Books (Heavily Nerfed)
-Pomp's Items / Pomp's Items - Just the Food
-Sapph's Cooking (Box up 19 different kitchen additions!)
-Scavenging Skill
-SoulFilcher's Building Time

Note: Only use ONE of the three Literacy mods if you're going to use one (I have no idea why you'd want to try to use more than one, but if you do they're not going to get along.)

In addition, this adds packing coverage for new vanilla items previously missing from the core Pantry Packing module, and for Better Sorting users applies categories to Pantry Packing's recipes which were missed by Better Sorting's integrated mod support.  Hurray!

I'll continue to add additional entries as I become aware of them and will endeavor to follow the same packing conventions Pantry Packing establishes for vanilla items.  Many thanks to darkmoriarti for a most excellent mod!

3183799205.title: Pineville
3183799205.description:
[h1] Pineville [/h1]

This mod adds the town of Pineville to the standard map.

It was once a small village, but now you can see it in the process of being reborn into a big city. The center was filled with apartments, and the hospital acquired a new block to receive guests from neighboring settlements.

[h2] The town is divided into 4 areas: [/h2]
[list]
    [*]Downtown with apartments, commercial buildings and a hospital.
    [*]Suburb.
    [*]Trailer park with car junk yard.
    [*]Farms.
[/list]

[h2] Town Location: [/h2]

Pineville is located west of Rosewood.

[h2] Description: [/h2]

When I created this map, my goal was to make a city that would not stray from the style of vanilla cities.
Each building was created by me personally, but with an eye on existing buildings in the game, so that the feeling of the integrity of the map is not lost. Some shops and restaurants have already been found in the game, while others were invented by me and this is my special pride.

In the city you can find many decorative items such as paintings that I painted in real life, replicas of weapons that can be hung on the wall and various furniture, which I personally really missed before.

[b] The town of Pineville has hidden secrets and interesting places. [/b]

[h2] The map uses cells: [/h2]
(13x30);
(13x31);(14x31)
(13x32);(14x32)
(13x33);(14x33)

[h2] And it conflicts with such city maps as: [/h2]
Cathaya Valley, KY; Finnegan Mental Asylum; St. Paolo's Hammer; Lincoln Regional Airport; Prepper Island.


[h2] P.S.: [/h2] [b] The city is fictional and the coincidence of the name with a real one is accidental. [/b]

Stay inside and play on your scavenged arcade machines!

Fragmotion

3146046428.title: Plumb Helper PLUS
3146046428.description:
[h2] About B42: [/h2]
I have a working version for B42 [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3386961288]here. [/url] As far as I can tell, the new rain collectors haven't been fully integrated into the build yet, unfortunately. The mod seems to work just fine, but doesn't detect water sources other than the city water, which would explain why plumbing doesn't work at the moment (confirmed with multiple reports).

I've made some changes to the mod, and I'll be bringing them to 41 after I translate them. STAY TUNED!

[h2] Check out the infomercials! [/h2]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fBXSlMIrL60]Plumb Helper [/url]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EUEtNrG2Dsg]Plumb Helper PLUS[/url]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/TKWRvF9.png[/img]
[h1][b][i] A SIMPLE TOOL FOR  A SIMPLE JOB! [/i][/b][/h1]

With a [b]pipe wrench[/b] in your inventory, an option will appear in your context menu. The first option will activate a cursor that shows where water sources are and whether or not the tile is considered "Indoors" [i](the two requirements for plumbing sinks).[/i]

If the Kentucky Water Supply is still active and your Find Rain Collectors cursor is on a sink that can be plumbed to it, a new icon of a city with a water drop will appear.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/CNAVxdK.gif[/img]

[h1][b][i]BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE![/i][/b][/h1]

Now there's a [i]SECOND OPTION![/i] Select it to activate a cursor to find your faucets one floor below! No more running up and down stairs trying to figure out where that sink is!
Sink to new levels with Plumb Helper Plus!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/P0PT6l7.gif[/img]

[h3]Tooltips:[/h3]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/z1ynTgO.png[/img]
[b]^The Find Rain Collectors tooltip will show whether you're currently indoors[/b] 
[i](only checks when you open the context menu- does not update in real-time to preserve performance)[/i]
[b]and whether the KY Water Supply is active[/b] 
[i](sandbox option to disable if you find it unimmersive)[/i]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/hSOk5Y5.png[/img]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/TKWRvF9.png[/img]
[h2][b] Frequently Asked Questions: [/b][/h2]
[list]


[*][h3][b]Does it work in multiplayer?[/b][/h3] 
  Indeed it does!

[*][h3][b]Does it work with a controller?[/b][/h3] 
  You know it!

[*][h3][b]I found a bug/ran into a problem, what should I do?[/b][/h3] 
 Report it [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3146046428/4139439249275543591/]here[/url]!

[*][h3][b]What's new?[/b][/h3] 
 Check out [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/changelog/3146046428]the changelog[/url]!

[*][h3][b]Can I put this in my server's modpack?[/b][/h3] 
  Sure! (Credit and links appreciated)

[*][h3][b]Are there any known incompatibilities?[/b][/h3] 
  Not that I'm aware of. Tested with over 350 mods both online and in solo! 

[*][h3][b]Is it safe to add or remove mid-save?[/b][/h3] 
  Yes! The option to show the KY Water Supply status is enabled by default, but can be changed at any time using a mod like [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2894296454] Change Sandbox Options (by Star) [/url]

[*][h3][b]The Texture looks bad, what gives?[/b][/h3] 
  If you want cleaner textures, you'll need to disable "Texture Compression" in the Display settings (this also removes the problem of the floor having a visible grid at different zoom levels). This may come at a performance cost, unfortunately.
[/list]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/TKWRvF9.png[/img]
[h2] Translations: [/h2]
Since there were very few lines, I went ahead and translated it into every language PZ is available in. This was done using Google and DeepL, so the results may not be great, but it should be usable. Any improvements are welcome and appreciated. 
Thank you to juni2335 for reminding me about encoding and fixing the Korean translation!
Thank you to Inferno for fixing the Spanish translation!
Thank you to toomanynights for fixing the Russian translation! Check out his excellent QOL mod [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3162507273]Dig Worms[/url]!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/TKWRvF9.png[/img]
[h1][i]Thanks for stopping by, and stay tuned for more mods![/i][/h1]
Don't forget to rate! It helps the mod more than you'd think!
[img]https://i.imgur.com/BaUyxax.gif[/img]


[b]Tips are never expected but always accepted![/b]

[url=https://paypal.me/PlunkDone] [img]https://i.imgur.com/FupUCpg.gif[/img] [/url]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/TKWRvF9.png[/img]

3118159023.title: Plumbing
3118159023.description:
[h1]What's new[/h1]

[b]April 28 - You can now repair or disassemble the pump. Sinks can now store more water.
April 04 - Bugfix, check release notes for more info.
March 29 - Use pipe wrench (instead of propane torch) to build or remove pipes.
March 21, 2024 - You can now pump water FROM rain collectors.
March 13, 2024 - You can now connect whole buildings by connecting pipe to edge of the building. [/b]

[h1] Plumbing Mod [/h1]

This mod lets you build a network of pipes to obtain water or fuel for various needs. You can transport water from rivers, lakes, wells, rain collectors and deliver it directly to barrels, connect whole houses to restore water after shutdown and also to irrigate farms. You can also transport fuel from gas stations to metal barrels. 

I spend hundreds of hours with this mod just for my pleasure. And if you like my work, you can [url=/ko-fi.com/M4M7SGR4P][img]https://storage.ko-fi.com/cdn/kofi2.png?v=3[/img][/url]

It is OK to add this mod in the middle of the game. It works for single and multiplayer games.

[h1] How does this work [/h1]

[h2] Pumps [/h2]
Every network must have at least one pump. Pumps are the only means of moving the water of fuel. In particular, this means, that the liquid will not move from barrels to anywhere else without a pump

[h3]Building a pump[/h3]
To build a pump, you need to access the "Plumbing" menu from the main context menu. The menu will be accessible once you have read Metalworking Magazine vol 2. 

Pumps must be build next to water or fuel sources. The only water sources pump can work with are: a water tile (lake or river), a well or a rain collector barrel. Fuel sources are gas pumps. 

Once you have built the pump, select "Attach water source" or "Attach fuel source".  Water tiles (lakes, rivers) will provide with tainted water, wells with fresh water. 

Now you can click "Pump info" to see details about the pump. 

[h3]Powering the pump[/h3]
In order to function, the pump needs electricity. You can use a power generator, but Immersive Solar Arrays mod will also work. Global power before blackout will not work. A running pump will consume 0.09L/h of fuel. When you open "Generator info" the pump will be listed as "Other". Click "Turn on" to start the pump. 

[h3]Pump efficiency[/h3]
The pump you built, will have a starting efficiency depending on you metalworking skill. You will get 10% of efficiency for every skill level. Pump efficiency will very slowly decrease over time, lowering the volume of liquid pumped. 100% efficiency is 12L/10 mins. Pumps below 20% will be additionally susceptible to emergency stops or in rare cases will start fire. Never build pumps close to your base!  A 100% healthy pump needs several months to wear out completely. Repair the pump to regain the efficiency.

[h3]Water filtering[/h3]
By default, a pump provides with tainted water. If you want the pump to deliver drinkable water, you can click "Add Charcoal Filter" if you have charcoal in your inventory. Water filter will be slowly used over time. Use pump info to see the current status of the filter. Water is filtered as long the status of the filter is above 0%. When pumping fuel, filters do not play any role. 

[h2] Collectors[/h2]
Collectors are objects that have the ability of storing liquids. This mod has an explicit list of in-game vanilla object that are recognized as water collectors. This list includes small and big rain collector barrels, sinks, baths, toilets and washing machines. To collect fuel, build a Fuel Tank. To fill the collector a pipe must reach to it.

[h2] Connecting Buildings[/h2]
If the pipe reaches edge of the building, then all water collectors on every level of that building will be filled. The water will fill collectors one by one until full, not paralelly. Self-built houses cannot be connected. Each building must be connected individually, because building are ends of the network and will not relay water further. "Plumb" option is not necessary at all. If you pump tainted water, it will also be tainted in the sinks.

[h2] Pipes [/h2]
Pipes are the only means of transportation liquid from pumps to collectors. Pipes must be placed in a consecutive manner forming a pipeline. No other objects will relay liquid. In particular, this means, that if there is a barrel between the pipes, if will receive the water, but it will not relay it any further. Similarly a connected building is the end of the network and can't relay water to other structures.

[h3]Building pipes[/h3]
To build a pipe, use the "Plumbing" menu again.

The pipes you place will adjust visually automatically. The first pipe will be a cross, but the next one you place next to it will fix both pipes. You can build a simple network, or network with multiple forks, you can even make a loop but then you computer may explode. 

Pipes can be built on multiple floors. Check the screenshot gallery how to achieve this. Just place the pipes in the shown order.

If you build a pipe close to a collector object, the pipe should snap to it correctly. If that does not happen it means that the object is not recognized as a collector. 

To remove a pipe click "Remove Pipe", you will get you pipe item back. 

[h3]Water movement[/h3]
If the pump is on, and the pipes are connected to it, liquid will start flowing. Every in-game 10 minutes, liquid will be transported to the end(s) of the network. 

If you networks forks, the liquid amount will be split. The split may be unequal in certain situations. For example if there are 13 units of water to be split across 2 pipes, one will receive 6 units, and the other will get 7 units. If there are too many consecutive splits, some pipes will not receive liquid at all, that happens when
there is only 1 unit of liquid that needs to be split. 

You network can split liquid, but also join streams from multiple pipelines. Note, that the pipe however has a maximum throughput that is equal to the amount of five 100% efficient pumps. Joining streams strategy is effective if you want to transport large amount of liquid from multiple pumps using one shared pipeline.

If you mix gasoline and water in one network, the network will not work. 

[h2]Valves[/h2]
Every pipeline intersection has valves that can be changed. Valves are present on each ending or a pipe, so a T-shape pipe intersection has 3 valves, and the cross shape pipe has 4 valves. Valves are named by their placement, so there can be north, east, west and south valve. 

Each of these valves can operate in two modes
[list]
[*] Two-way valve - will allow liquid to flow in both directions
[*] One-way valve (receiver) - will allow liquid to flow in one direction, it will allow liquid only to come in this pipe, and not come out to pipe connected to this end. 
[/list]
Valve settings will have impact on how liquid is split or merged on intersections. 

To access valve information use context menu on the intersection and click "Valve info". This information is updated not immediately, but every 10 in-game minutes.

Similarly, to change valve settings, use context menu on the intersection and click "Change valves".

[h2]Farms irrigation[/h2]
Farms built one square next to straight pipes will be watered automatically. Some portion of transported water will be used but only if the plant needs it. It works on vanilla farms,
but also with other mods using standard farming system such as Mo Crops or Farmable Trees. 

[h1] Troubleshooting [/h1]
[olist]
[*] If there are problems, launch the game in a debug mode. In context menu, there will be more options you can use for debugging such as a map of your network.
[*] Incompatibility with Hydrocraft, fix: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3152142389
[/olist]

Workshop ID: 3118159023
Mod ID: Plumbing

3184471683.title: Post Flag
3184471683.description:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Raise or lower the post flag depending on the contents of the post inside.
[b][i]Confirmed to work with Build 41/42.[/i][/b]

If there are items inside, the post flag will stand.

[h3][b][img]https://imgur.com/bfxjRMM.png[/img] In the case of Mid-Save, a post on a map that has already been loaded is displayed with the flag down, regardless of whether there are items inside or not. In this case, moving the item in the container will return it to the normal display.[/b][/h3]

[h1]Known Issues :[/h1]
[list]
[*]There was a bug where, if a flagged post was destroyed by a vehicle, both the original graphic and the destroyed graphic would remain. This bug has already been fixed, but in saves from before the fix, flagged posts may still appear this way.

In such cases, you can remove the original graphic by taking items out of the destroyed post.
[img]https://imgur.com/uO4QfWG.png[/img]
[/list]

[h1]Future plans :[/h1]
[list]

[/list]

[h1]Remarks :[/h1]

2730158335.title: ProjectElevator
2730158335.description:
Elevators!

This makes it so elevators around the map actually "function".
Basically, if the building has power (need generator if electricity is out) you can right click on an elevator and itll give you an option to go up or down only if there is an elevator tile above/below your current location. After a short wait and sfx, your character will be brought to the appropriate floor.

Lemme know if you find anything borked. Potential Future additions would include making the elevator require being repaired before use, or maybe button press animation. Hope you Enjoy!

If a modder uses their own custom imported elevator sprite it won't work though (which I doubt is common anyway) Contact me if you need a hand making your map's custom elevator sprite to work with this. Or if you just need some specific elevator for your map or something, feel free to gut this to work for your project.

Shout outs to Chopper and Barney for helping test this in MP environment

I just made a little autorun mod too! if you want something like that check https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2732374884

Just a simple mod, feel free to do what you want with it! That said I would appreciate a shout out if you end up re-using my work in your own <3

2815966702.title: Rabbit Hash, KY
2815966702.description:
[h1]About the Map: [/h1]
A generally quiet river town, Rabbit Hash is known for its iconic General Store. Here, you will find all manner of goodies to help you out on your journey along the rural route to Louisville. 

Rabbit Hash is a real-world location in KY, although it has been displaced a bit geographically and now finds itself a fair ways down the river from its former home.

[h1]Map Features: [/h1]
[list]
    [*]🗺️ In-game map support
    [*]🔍 Foraging Zones
    [*]🚙 Modded 'military' vehicle spawn zones
    [*]🥾 Lots of 4-wheeler trails to sneak between various POIs
    [*]🌽 A big fancy farm with several facilities to explore
    [*]🏪 A really cool general store with custom tiles for the sign
    [*]⛵ A variety of docks & other infrastructure to support your boating habits
    [*]👮‍♀️ A Police Station
[/list]

[h1]Technical Stuff:[/h1]
Rabbit Hash and its particular geometry and layout seemed to fit well into the chosen cells & surrounding road system. I feel like the map does a decent job of filling in some dead space between Riverside & West Point.

This is our first map & as such it only uses the vanilla tiles (aside from the awesome sign). The map may have some errors, feel free to comment and I'll do my best to fix anything. You may also feel that the loot is too heavy or light as I built a majority of the buildings as I went, so feel free to voice any bugs/loot/etc issues as well. Expect semi-frequent updates early on as I finish refining & polishing the map after some play-testing.

[h1]Compatibility:[/h1]
So far, the only map I've found that Rabbit Hash conflicts with is North Peak. The cell is included in that map, but isn't used. Simply load Rabbit Hash before North Peak and both maps should work fine.


[b]Like the map? Please show your support, it helps a lot![/b]

[url=https://discord.gg/dXGSVBnNKE] DURST Mapping Discord [/url]

Cells: 30x24 - 31x24

2956146279.title: [B41/B42] Rain Cleans Blood
2956146279.description:
Tired of zombies splattering their brains all over your pretty lawn? Well no more! Just wait for some rain or snow and watch it all fade away.

[h1]What does it do?[/h1]
This mod makes it so that when it's raining or snowing, blood will slowly fade away from floors and walls nearby.

[h1]Doesn't Rain Wash do this already?[/h1]
That mod cleans your clothes and recent car. This mod complements that.

[h1]Does it work in multiplayer?[/h1]
Yes, it does!

[h1]What about ash?[/h1]
Same as blood, ashes will also slowly be cleaned when it's raining.

[h1]Can I add this to my current game?[/h1]
Yes, you can add or remove this mod whenever you like. It contains no save-breaking features.

[h1]How does it work?[/h1]
Every game tick the mod will look at the current weather and if it's moderately raining or snowing, it will randomly select 8 tiles in the same chunk as you and clean them if they are bloodied.

[h1]Why not always?[/h1]
Because immersion is important to me. I also opted for a more gradual process to save on performance and to give the feature the feeling of "washing away".

2196102849.title: Raven Сreek
2196102849.description:
This adds the port city of Raven Creek to the vanilla game world.
______________________

[h1]WARNING! READ ALL BEFORE DOWNLOAD!BY SUBSCRIBING TO THIS MOD, YOU CONFIRM THAT YOU HAVE FULLY READ THE DESCRIPTION, AND YOU HAVE NO PROBLEMS WITH IT.[/h1]

FOR VERSION 41.71


[u]What you need to know:

After EACH update for avoid bugs, you MUST start a new game. Sad but true.

You need to turn this option OFF in sandbox (Randomized house chance - set never)

Turn ON in the game settings (Double-sized textures: Yes)[/u]


  There are three zones of various difficulty on the map. They have a different spawn number of infected, and other features. This map may be too hard for some people, it is not designed for beginners. Some spawn points can be very difficult, others easy. It depends on your luck. Sometimes you may appear surrounded by zombies.

  Still do not forget that you personally adjust the difficulty of the game in the sandbox, if it seems to you that the map is too hard or easy, then change your own settings.

  This mod does NOT conflicts with Fort Redstone. But mod conflicts with the All-In Zomboid Map Pack (AIZ), New Denver (Slocan Lake) and every other map mod that replaces the same game cells (see last screenshot).

  There is a lot of loot on the map. The map was created to gain a different experience from vanilla, where there will be more action, and where there will be a lot of everything - from infected to weapons. The city was planned for fast raids with friends (or solo), and not to establish a base here.

[h1]How do I get in from the standard map?[/h1]
 Straight west from Rosewood(upper left corner on the PZ map) until you see a road sign indicating the city.

[h1]You will need a sledgehammer to get out of town[/h1]

Unfortunately, the text in the description is limited, click on the link below to read the description in full. (Learn about zones, download the map in HD, and get more details about the map)

https://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php?/topic/27752-raven-creek/

  [b]If you like the mod, don't forget support it. Thanks and enjoy the map.[/b]
________________________

Этот мод добавляет портовый город Raven Creek на стандартную карту разработчиков.

[h1]ВНИМАНИЕ! ПРОЧИТАЙТЕ ВСЕ ПЕРЕД СКАЧИВАНИЕМ! ПОДПИСЫВАЯСЬ НА ЭТОТ МОД, ВЫ ПОДТВЕРЖДАЕТЕ, ЧТО ПОЛНОСТЬЮ ОЗНАКОМИЛИСЬ С ОПИСАНИЕМ, И У ВАС НЕ ВОЗНИКЛО ПРОБЛЕМ С ЭТИМ[/h1]

ДЛЯ ВЕРСИИ 41.71

[u]Что нужно знать:

После КАЖДОГО обновления во избежание багов нужно начинать новую игру.

ВЫКЛЮЧИТЕ эту опцию в песочнице - Шанс найти убежище: выберите Никогда

ВКЛЮЧИТЕ двойной размер текстур в настроиках игры. [/u]


  На карте есть три зоны различной сложности. В них разное кол-во зомби и другие особенности. Эта карта может оказаться слишком сложной для некоторых людей, она не предназначена для новичков. Некоторые точки спавна могут быть очень сложными, другие - легкими. Это зависит от вашей удачи. Иногда вы можете оказаться в окружении зомби.

  Тем не менее, не забывайте что сложность игры вы лично настраиваете в песочнице, если вам кажется что карта слишком сложная или простая, значит измените свои настройки.

  Этот мод НЕ конфликтует с Fort Redstone. Но мод конфликтует с All-In Zomboid Map Pack, New Denver и всеми остальными модификациями карт, которые заменяют те же игровые ячейки (см. Последний снимок экрана).

  На карте много лута. Карта создана для получения иного типа опыта, где будет больше действий и изобилие всего - от зомби до оружия. Город был спланирован для быстрых рейдов с друзьями (или в одиночку), а не для создания здесь базы.

[h1]Как попасть в город со стандартной карты?[/h1]
 Идите прямо на запад от Роузвуда (верхний левый угол на карте PZ), пока не увидите дорожный знак, указывающий на город.

[h1]Вам нужна кувалда чтобы покинуть город[/h1]

  К сожалению, текст в описании ограничен лимитом, нажмите на ссылку ниже, чтобы прочитать описание полностью. (Узнать о зонах, скачать карту в HD и получить более подробную информацию о карте)

  https://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php?/topic/27752-raven-creek/

  [b]Если вам понравился мод, то не забудьте лайкнуть его.Спасибо и надеюсь вам понравится.[/b]

Mod ID: RavenCreek
Map Folder: RavenCreek

2845952197.title: Read While Walking
2845952197.description:
[list]
[*] You can read while walking.
[*] You can set reading speed in sandbox options.
[/list]

[h3]Bonus Features[/h3]
[list]
[*] Also you can start/stop reading a book by pressing "R". So you can read/fight almost simultaneously using just keyboard.
[*] You can start reading even if the book is in a container nearby, you will take it.
[*] The key "R" is configurable, but it'ok as is, no conflict with building mode and reloading:[list]
  [*] B41: if you have [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]ModOptions[/url]. 
  [*] B42: native - OPTIONS --> MODS[/list]
[*] Pressing the key "R" just doesn't work for reading if you have a gun in you hand or you are in the building mode:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/5C6CeF5.png[/img]
[/list]

[h3]Key "R" priority[/h3]
[list]
[*] Favorite books have more priority. But unfinished book has the most priority.
[*] Inventory books have more priority over books in backpacks, and backpacks have more priority over containers.
[/list]

[h3]Reading Fog and restrictions[/h3][list]
[*] Now reading will enable dark "foraging fog" (see the screenshot).
[*]You can tune the darkness while reading in sandbox options.
[*] You can't read in search mode.
[*] Also your fatigue affects your view radius while reading.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/dWEMVpn.png[/img]
[/list]

[h3]Compatibility[/h3]
It's compatible with future updates of the game (e.g. with build 42+) and any good mods. You may safely enable/disable it. Works in multiplayer. Compatible with the rude mods. The read speed effect (if set) from this mod is accumulated with other mods and their mechanics.


Workshop ID: 2845952197
Mod ID: SimpleReadWhileWalking41

2699828474.title: Rebalanced Prop Moving
2699828474.description:
Do I really need a hammer to move a couch?
I wish I could move this desk, but I haven't taken any carpentry classes!

This mod removes the nails holding your furniture and appliances to the floor!

Details:
- Furniture and appliances require no skill/tool to move.
- Fixtures like cabinets and shelves still require skills/tools.
- Break chance for props requiring skills/tools has been reduced to 30% at skill level 0, 20% at 1, 10% at 2, and 0% for >=3.
- Break chance for props not requiring skills/tools is now 0%.
- Sinks in vanilla have no associated skill and receive a 25% break chance default. Changed to 0% since apparently no skill is required!
- All the above only applies to "pickup" and "place" actions. Disassembly should not be affected by this mod.

The mod works by "whitelisting" props if their name matches certain patterns. This implies that the patterns may catch too much or too little, so feel free to provide feedback if you think some props should or should not require a skill/tool.

Note: Not compatible with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2685057281]Safer Prop Moving[/url]

Disclaimer: There could be big bugs in this mod! The vanilla lua code has numerous edge cases, please comment if you discover issues.

Workshop ID: 2699828474
Mod ID: RebalancedPropMoving

2687515849.title: Refined Hotwiring
2687515849.description:
Ever regretted hotwiring that sweet sportscar? Ever got your hotwired car stolen by your friend and who then (somehow) managed to flip it? Or do you just want to become a local car key salesman, perhaps a famed car keysmith?

Then you're in the right place!

Refined Hotwiring allows you to un-hotwire your hotwired car or, with a little metalworking knowledge, create keys for them, all from the comfort of your vehicle radial menu.
Completely works and supports your favourite (vehicle radial menu-using) mods:
- Better Lockpicking
- Harry's Functional Tow Truck
- Autotsar Trailers
and more!

Features and skill requirements:
- Now featuring Custom Sandbox options, made singlehandedly by albion! Change the skill requirements of un-hotwiring and keycrafting to better fit your playstyle!

- Un-hotwiring! Removes the hotwiring from the car, allowing it to be started using a key.
Requires Electrical 2 and Mechanics 3 and takes 500 units of time to complete.

- Key crafting! Gain a key to the car you're sitting in.
Requires Electrical 1, Mechanics 2 and Metalworking 3, and takes 1250 units of time to complete.

- Base hotwiring is unchanged!
It still requires Electrical 1, Mechanics 2 or the Burglar skill, and takes 200 units of time to complete.

The time needed to complete these tasks get shorter the higher your Electrical knowledge is!

Does something not work as it should?
Please visit the mod's github page and open an issue under the "Issues" tab, or comment below using the Steam Workshop comments system. I will do my best to help!

Please give feedback on the mod!
For now, the Burglar trait does not allow you to bypass skill requirements for un-hotwiring or crafting car keys, because in my mind, Burglars learnt to break into homes and cars, but not how to delicately craft car keys or undo their damage. If you think this should be changed, please make yourselves heard!

Mod's github page: https://github.com/VilcsiTH/refinedhotwiring

Originally based on raz's "Harder Hotwire" mod, it has been completely rewritten to better follow vanilla skill requirements and better compatibility for Build 41.65+ aswell as other mods.(This means it also works for 41.78!)
This rewrite is, in no small part, thanks to raz and other talented people such as iBrRus and Aiteron, whose mods helped shape this mod into what it is today.

Please check them out and give them lots of love!
Harder Hotwire by raz: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2164926937
Autotsar Trailers by iBrRus: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2282429356
Better Lockpicking by Aiteron: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2368058459

Special thanks to these awesome people for translating the mod!
Turkish by zizaderien: https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198056212111
Português Brazilian by ZL18k: https://steamcommunity.com/id/deibig

Workshop ID: 2687515849
Mod ID: refinedhotwiring

2901962885.title: Reorder Containers - Backpack Orders [B42/41]
2901962885.description:
[b]Reorder Containers[/b] is an inventory mod that allows you to customize the order in which containers and backpacks appear in the inventory.

Simply drag and drop the container icons to rearrange them to your liking.
They'll even remember their preferred order if you drop the backpack and re-equip it later.


You also have the option to rearrange containers in the loot window, [b]but you need to turn it on using the options at the bottom of the loot window (next to the lock)[/b]

Lastly, you can manually set the sorting priority for containers if you need to. Just select the container and click the options icon at the bottom right of the window (next to the lock)

The drag and drop system will automatically handle the sorting priority by default.

3006882690.title: [B41] Repair Wall
3006882690.description:
[h2]Now works with 'More Builds' and 'Improved building menu' too![/h2]

To be honest, this should be in vanilla long time ago...

Just right click on whatever you've built, and hover on "Repair" menu and repair your WALLS!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/1geL0fn.png[/img]

[h2]Features[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Works in [b]Multiplayer[/b] / Coop / Singleplayer
 [*] Safe to be added / removed for any save.
 [*] Potential repair is based off your Carpentry/Metal Working level. The higher you have, the more you repair.
 [*] 'Handy' Trait makes your animation faster. (I made this for later expansions)
 [*] You can keep your items not only in your inventory, but also in backpack/bags/containers that you wear.
 [*] Fully Animated.
 [*] Nice-looking Menu with colorful tooltips.
 [*] Menu appears when object has less than 100% health.
 [*] [b]Show Wall Health[/b] is not required, but highly recommended. 
[b](REQUIRED IN MULTIPLAYER!)[/b]
[/list]

[h2]Balance[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Before creating this mod, I didn't know exactly what I should put as needed items to repair broken walls because I wanted it to be useful. Walls are quite easy to make, so why would you ever repair them at huge cost? That's why I decided to stick with simple items like planks and metal pipes, which are really easy to come by. The amount to be repaired is as small as possible to convince you to repair them instead of making a new one.
 [*] Tool condition/fuel will not be taken after use. 
[/list]

[h2]Mod Compatibility[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Modded items such as hammers or blowtorches should work for needed items. 
 [*] Every mod that adds "Destroyable" things should work for repair. 
(Examples: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2923027740]Destroyable World Fences[/url])
 [*] If you want to make sure the mod is compatible, the object instance must be "IsoThumpable" AND must include material in Data such as "Wood" or "Metal".
[/list]

[h2]Translation[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Every language has partial translation, but some of them are made using "Google Translator" which can make some words incorrect.
 [*] MY LANGUAGE SUCK! - You can contribute to the mod and add your own correction to the language. To do that, please join Discord (click on the banner below) and tag me there!
 [*] Github with available languages and templates - https://github.com/Kamer5555/Translation/tree/main 
[/list]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/1geL0fn.png[/img]

[h2][b]Want more?[/b][/h2]
Join me on Discord to stay up to date!
You can suggest or report anything there, you can also join the pz modding community ;).

[img]https://i.imgur.com/gohg4Xu.png[/img]
[url=https://discord.com/invite/fkCzCTDXdD][img]https://i.imgur.com/uIkpv0k.png[/img][/url]
[url=https://discord.gg/tNzcyyDCkH][img]https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Chuckleberry-Finn/chuckImages/main/PZmodCommBanner1.png[/img][/url]

* Mod_ID: KAMER_RepairWall
* Version: 1.3.3

2807152393.title: Research Facility, KY [B41]
2807152393.description:
The Research Facility, KY is a full expansion and redesign of the secret military base that can be found to the west of Rosewood, KY. It's design is inspired by the sprawling complex of Black Mesa from the Half-Life series, as well as from the town of Eureka from the TV show Eureka (2006).

[img] https://i.imgur.com/EEVrGqY.gif [/img]

The facility conducts advanced research in the areas of high tech aerospace engineering, plant sciences and advanced biomedical research. The facility contains a several large research facilities, a satellite launch facility, a small heliport, a military outpost and a company town to house the employees of the facility.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The entire facility is surrounded by double wide, unclimbable military grade fence, and at the time of gamestart the facility has been placed on a full lockdown. This means it will be impossible to get past the main gate with a car until you [b] have a sledgehammer [/b] (you can still climb the front gate). The zombie population are very high within the facility, but there are many valuable looting areas and many army vehicle spawns making it a much more attractive late-game looting spot compared to its vanilla counterpart.

[b] "The Biomedical & Engineering Facilities are on full lockdown with shutters blocking off all entrance and exits, if the system worked the infection will be contained" (hint: there are ways in/out without a sledge) [/b]

You can spawn within the base, but the spawns are VERY high so it will be a very tough start in terms of numbers if playing on normal or above.

[b]An optional addon is included that connects the Research Facility to Rosewood via a proper main road (see worldmap image for cells)[/b]

[h1]Compatability[/h1]
The map uses the cells 18,41 / 18,42 & 19,41 / 19,42.

Works well with...
[list]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1516836158] Fort Redstone 2.0 [/url] - This mod was specifically designed to support the new incarnation of Fort Redstone, and does not overlap any of its cells at time of writing.
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2196102849] Raven Creek [/url]  - [b]LOAD Raven Creek AFTER THIS MOD![/b] Tested with this mod and works fine (they come up right against each other but dont overlap)
[/list]
Incompatible with...
[list]
[*] Slocan Lake (Sort of works, you must put Slocan Lake (and Raven Creek etc) AFTER Research Facility.
[*] Rosewood Access Road (breaks half the map) and is not needed (This map contains its own access road).
[/list]
[h1]Multiplayer / Server [/h1]
Make sure you go into the server settings, map, and then add this map to the list and move it up to the top of the list to ensure it prioritizes generating the new area rather than the base map (not sure why its an issue within this map). 


[h1]Special Thanks[/h1]
DaddyDirk for his tile mod, and his excellent YouTube series that taught me how to map!

[h1]Support Updates and More Content[/h1]
Like the map and want to see more? Checkout my tabletop games company where we have recently published our first tabletop roleplaying game. We are also working on a new card game too.

[h2]Those Who Dare RPG - Founders Edition[/h2]
[img] https://i.ibb.co/tpVqccK/TWD-Banner.png [/img]
[url=https://www.friendsofthetable.com/thosewhodare] [/url]

2986067947.title: Restore Utilities
2986067947.description:
[h1] The B42 port is here! Please read below for info [/h1]

For the time being, the B42 port is placed as its own workshop entry. It is (for now) missing the map mods contained within the B41 version of the mod.

Feel free to play with the update, but please read the workshop description before downloading. I've explained how to use the mod now that you can't repair at the designated buildings anymore. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3409422147]Click here to go to the B42 page[/url]

enjoy :) please leave comments for that build over there

[h1] Bring the power and the water back! [/h1]

This mod adds the ability to restore the power and water grids in Knox Country, optionally comes with both a custom power substation and water treatment building to restore their respective utility at!

To repair the power or water, you'll need some electric skill, along with electronic scrap and optionally any "fuses" you come across that will give various bonuses to your repair. But be aware that your patchwork repairs will only last so long, you'll have to come back and repair it again at some point!

To initiate repairs, find the building that houses the utility you're trying to repair and head into the room with the PC in it (with the brown square floors), then simply right-click anywhere while standing in the room and you should see more information on how to repair!

Alternatively, if you don't want to use my map mod, there are alternative options for setting up repair zones. See [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2986067947/4363501716021462652/] this guide [/url] for more details!

[h2] Maps that support this mod [/h2]

If not using any of the following, you can enable the Restore Utilities Map submod (included in the mod download) to add 1 place to repair each utility at, locations can be found in the mod preview screenshots on the steam workshop page.

Thank you to you wonderful map makers who have added support for this mod in your maps :D

[h3] Maps where you can restore the power [/h3]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2802755864] Trimble County Power Station & La Grange [/url]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3170914649] McAlpine Locks and Dam [/url]

[h3] Maps where you can restore the water [/h3]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3279818805] Filtration Plant [/url]

[h1] Known conflicts [/h1]

[h2] Map/mod conflicts! [/h2]

[b] Map tiles used for my power and water stations are: 19, 37 and 37, 27 [/b]

Known map conflicts: Fort Redstone, Santuario, Anthem, Perfect Shelter, Cherokee Lake, Aardmore Farm, Fort Forest, Complex Z-17, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3347096716]Constown[/url]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2956046897]Sandbox Settings Sync Fix [/url] is potentially incompatible, try removing it if you're running into issues with your sandbox settings reverting.
My [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2987767645]Random Shutoff [/url] mod, has built-in compatibility for this mod though, so don't worry about running both they'll play nice together :)
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3156268584]Blackouts[/url] and this mod were previously not playing nicely together, but this should now be fixed and they should be friends again :)

[h2] Existing savegame compatibility [/h2]

Should be fine to install in an on-going playthrough. Though if you've already generated the chunks where the utilities are then I don't think they'll regenerate as my mod's buildings, so you'll have to add coordinates where you can repair by yourself (enable debug mode in singleplayer or have admin powers in mp)!

[h2] MP Compatibility [/h2]

Works perfectly fine in MP, both dedicated host and local host! Though for larger servers you may want to consider adding your own repair locations in harder to reach areas than default. You may also want to consider changing the default sandbox settings!

Also probably incompatible with your immersion if you enjoy a hyper-realistic zomboid, power and water networks require a lot of smart people in a lot of different places, a single person probably wouldn't be able to do it all. :p

Also probably incompatible with your immersion if you enjoy a hyper-realistic zomboid, power and water networks require a lot of smart people in a lot of different places, a single person probably wouldn't be able to do it all. :p

2922087098.title: Rosewood VHS & Gun Stores
2922087098.description:
Since Rosewood is missing a VHS store and a guns store, this mod adds one of each, south of Rosewood.

The VHS store is right next to the southern gas station, with an appartment on the second floor.

The gun store is quite isolated in the woods, and to get inside, you'll need a sledgehammer.

There is no spawn point to directly spawn there. Just spawn in Rosewood and head south.

Zombie density is slightly increased compared to vanilla. 

The cell used is 27x40.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
I haven't found an other map that uses this cell. If you do, share it in the comments.

Compatible with:
[list]
[*]Rosewood Expansion
[*]Rosewood Cabins
[*]Rosewood Military Hospital
[*]Westwood
[*]Save Your Station!
[*]Access Road (Research Facility)
[*]...And many more
[/list]

NOT Compatible with:
[list]
[*]10 Years Later (it changes the entire map)
[*] SecretZ's Rosewood Fossoil Blockade.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

[b]Do you like this? Try my other map : [/b]
[list]
[*] [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2721653030]West Point Trailer Park & VHS Store[/url][/u] : It adds a VHS store south of West Point since it's missing one.
[*][u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3025055056]West Point Gated Community[/url][/u] : It adds a rich gated community North of West Point.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]"We want to use this map in a mod pack, do we have permission ?"[/h1]
Yes, as long as it's a private mod pack.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]"Can I add this midgame ?"[/h1]
If you haven't visited Rosewood in your saved game, yes.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]"How do I get in the gunstore?"[/h1]
Sledgehammer your way in.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]For Multiplayer: instructions given by a comment below :[/h1]
How to get the mod to work:
1. Go to the "Map" section of sandbox settings.
2. Choose the map ("Rosewood VHS Store") from the dropdown menu under "Add an available map to the list".
3. Click on "Muldraugh, KY" in the "Maps used by this server" box and click "Move down" until it's at the bottom of the list.

[hr][/hr]

Workshop ID: 2922087098
Mod ID: RosewoodVHSGunStores
Map Folder: Rosewood VHS Store

2822286426.title: RV Interior
2822286426.description:
[h1] READ THE INSTRUCTIONS BEFORE ENABLING THE MOD[/h1]

Simulate interiors of some vehicles. Support over a 100 vehicles.

Each vehicle has 25 fully-customizable independent spaces.

The power is tied to the car battery. Some trailers have no battery of their own, and need to be attached to another vehicle to have power.

Some vehicles are entered from the back (trunk area) via the radial menu or hotkey. The trunk can be locked to avoid entry.

An interior with a sink has water collector on the roof available for plumbing.

[h1]Instructions[/h1]

[hr][/hr]

[b][list]
[*] /!\ FOLLOW [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2547762158]THIS GUIDE[/url] TO ADD THE MOD TO AN EXISTING SAVE. FOR MP FOLLOW [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2822286426/5260782129623793867/]PHONEY'S GUIDE[/url] IN THE DISCUSSION.

[*]Non-standard maps (such as Challenge maps) are not supported.

[*]In Multiplayer, the map file "vehicle_interior" needs to be put in top priority. Map=vehicle_interior;OtherMaps;Muldraugh, KY;

[*]In Multiplayer, Anti cheat Type 2 and 12 might need to be disabled.
[/list][/b]

[hr][/hr]

[b]Enable the mod "RV Interior".[/b]  The same mod works in both singleplayer and multiplayer. RV Interior - Vanilla Addon is an optional add-on for vanilla vehicle support.

Enter a vehicle and open the vehicle radial menu.  If the vehicle is of a type that has an interior map, an "Enter" option will appear.

To exit an interior, right click on the ground and select the "Exit" context menu option.

With the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url] mod installed, a hotkey can be defined to enter and exit the interior (Options -> Keybindings -> Vehicle)

The safe zombie distance to enter can be configured (or disabled) in the Sandbox options.  Players in SP who want to change these mid-game can use the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2670674997]Change Sandbox Options[/url] mod.


[b]At least one of the following mods is required:[/b]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1510950729][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1858302765098369302/2AD41673AD33AA4577A68E4A3F872819A1AE3DF2/?imw=128&imh=128&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2592358528][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1679268304887504641/B0AEB746D367D26452D40ED0F1F89B3A2A3D1729/?imw=128&imh=128&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2282429356][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1769330649144127450/AA61A2E407205DA2DA5107DAC7A5281D76A582D5/?imw=128&imh=128&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2392987599&searchtext=aquatsar][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1751307626426656639/9ABB466419FDFBE3FF5D76CCB86A39F644D7FB6E/?imw=128&imh=128&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2623855083][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1890975936757144903/BD3F8EFDB11823CDD1ED25520547D924C26963C7/?imw=128&imh=128&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2809058492][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1777256363206228227/71DC6168164653B51D5A5D6A020E5372BB649DC9/?imw=128&imh=128&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2618213077][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1754734980975942757/CBC6EBD45C12EE1ED3EAE299506DCCB2D5C2C3D6/?imw=128&imh=128&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2870394916][img]https://steamuserimages-a.ak Full list available [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2822286426/3722819643259204956/]here[/url].

[h2]Recommended Mods[/h2]

[table]
[tr]
[th][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1917995851086737008/0B87330676C5526DEE21E8ACB4AB176DC8FF7972/?imw=80&imh=80&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][/th]
[th][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2843308688][img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1896596869155936660/AAF30CD3936048A108B0677387E130E230C932B2/?imw=80&imh=80&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=true[/img][/url][/th]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td] allows a hotkey to be defined to enter and exit the interior (Options -> Keybindings -> Vehicle)[/td]
[td] allows you to take a trait to start the game somewhere random on the back-roads of Kentucky with an RV. (SP ONLY)[/td]
[td] Spawns additional vehicles in locations appropriate to their type.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]


[h1]Credits[/h1]

2832136889.title: Sapph's Cooking [41.78+]
2832136889.description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/ZB1RCUx.png[/img]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/sapph_][img]https://i.imgur.com/ETH9cZg.png[/img][/url]
[h2][b]Since i'm not that active here on Steam, if you find any bugs or have any suggestions, feel free to add me on steam, discord(#sapph) or join my [url=https://discord.gg/8QNfE3FE46]my Discord[/url][/b][/h2]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3409143790][img]https://i.imgur.com/ZRLZklW.png[/img][/url]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/4IfyYC2.png[/img]
This mod expands the vanila options for the Cooking category, adding more recipes, weapons and food related item drops.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/Kgy35iX.gif[/img]

What can i expect downloading this mod?
[list]
    [*][b]+40 [/b] Types of new drinks.
    [*][b]+500 [/b] New food recipes.
    [*][b]+500 [/b]New Items.
    [*][b]+10 [/b]New weapons.
[/list]
As Project Zomboid is constantly updating, if any recipes i've added are put into the game, i'll make sure to remove them.

Check out this mod's Wiki:
[url=https://sapphcooking.miraheze.org/wiki/Main_Page][img]https://i.imgur.com/PmyFixm.png[/img][/url]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/E7H4L2T.png[/img]

Changelog (July/2024):
[img]https://i.imgur.com/yhSBOVr.png[/img]
[b]hello~, first of all, thank you all so much for 3000+ Ratings! i'm not really good at words, but i really appreciate all the love!~
now, this update is bringing some really requested features so... enjoy~[/b]
[b] [/b]
[b]New stuff:[/b]
[list]
 [*] Added Stress/Boredom reductions when cooking.
 [*] Added Cheese Making.
    + Recipe for Cheese Preparations, where you can strain it into Mozzarela Cheese or age it into Parmesan or Blue Cheese in Pots, Buckets or Cheese Molds.
 [*] Added more models and animations when cooking and eating.
 [*] Added Homemade Sauce that can be made made when mixing Spices.
 [*]Added Chef Aprons: 18 Unique Aprons that allows for weapons and tools attachments.
    + Can also be worn around waists.
 [*] Added 6 Types of Cakes (Chocolate, Carrot, Red Velvet, Black Forest, Strawberry, Birthday).
    + You can add Candles on them.
    + You can slice them into 5 pieces.
 [*] Added Lettuce Wraps.
 [*] Added Stuffed Peppers.
 [*] Added Can of Whipped Cream (thanks Cooks117!).
 [*] Added Can of Spray Cheese.
 [*] Added Crab Sticks.
 [*] Added Truffles as a rare forageable.
 [*] Added Recipes for Cocktail Mixers with Metalworking.
 [*]Added Recipes for Taco Shells.
 [*] Added Macarons (thanks Xianah!).
[/list]

[b]Wiki[/b]
[list]
[*] Started work on a Sapph's Cooking Wiki Page, it is not yet finished, but it'll be updated from time to time, so ~ please check it out at the top of the page!
[/list]

[b]**Since new things have been added,some translations will be missing![/b]
[b][h1]You can read all tweaks,fixes and addition[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/changelog/2832136889] here![/url][/h1][/b]



[img]https://i.imgur.com/5gWe2L8.png[/img]
[list]
    [*]Do i need to restart my save for this to work?
[/list]
[b]You don't have to, but you'll need to explore new areas for the new items.[/b]
[list]
    [*]Does this work on Multiplayer?
[/list]
[b]It works on version 41.78.[/b]
    [*]How can i cook using oil pans?
[/list]
[b]I've added a new way to cook in some recipes(not all of them require this), now needing a hot pan.[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/l672qy4.gif[/img]
[b]And remember, turn OFF your ovens![/b]
    [*]Will this work with "x mod"?
[/list]
[b]It should work with any other mod on the workshop, but if it doesn't, feel free to let me know! [/b]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/9IPH57n.png[/img]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2313387159][img]https://i.imgur.com/VUPy9RS.png[/img][/url][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2335368829][img]https://i.imgur.com/RAhB8Aj.png[/img][/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3042138819][img]https://i.imgur.com/EYeDWtl.png[/img][/url]

[b]If you're having any problems remembering/learning recipes, i recommend trying [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2787291513]Craft Helper[/url], it'll make things easier![/b]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/NnWp67b.png[/img]
Currently avaliable translations are:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/c6amHzp.png[/img] [b] - Brazilian Portuguese[/b].
[img]https://i.imgur.com/bMgzIGt.png[/img] [b] - Traditional Chinese [/b] (Thanks to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198111339201]Smokedfish[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561199060254848]冷沔泠-35P[/url])

2398274461.title: Save Our Station!
2398274461.description:
[h1]Save Our Station![/h1]

This mod adds a [b]new gameplay mechanics[/b] to the Automated Emergency Broadcast System (AEBS) along with [b]new areas[/b] to explore in the vanilla Knox Country Map.

[hr][/hr]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/3582810?utm_source=sos][img]https://www.dandelionvoid.com/hosting/sos/sos_wishlist.gif[/img][/url]

Save Our Station has been a blast to work on, and we intend to keep it up to date, but we've also been working on our own title we think you'd be interested in. [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/3582810?utm_source=sos]It's called Dandelion Void, and you can wishlist it here![/url]
[hr][/hr]
[h2]Please Read - Build 42 Development[/h2]
[quote]
[b]Yes, B42 support is planned. No, we don't have an estimated time for it.[/b]

We will not be pushing any more patches for B41, as we've already committed to the B42 code structure internally, and have not run across any relevant issues in the last year. Any announcements regarding B42 Development will be posted here and also on the various PZ discords.
[/quote]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Repair the Emergency Broadcast System[/h2]
[quote]
Do you...
[list]
[*]...find yourself late in the game with nothing to do?
[*]...want new areas to explore in Knox Country?
[*]...take your hourly weather updates and air traffic alerts for granted?
[/list]

[b]Save Our Station[/b] spices up your survival experience by causing the Automated Emergency Broadcast System to occasionally suffer service outages. Travel to weather stations scattered around Knox Country to find, diagnose, and fix the broadcast system.

Whilst the AEBS is built with emergency scenarios in mind, the backup systems can only last so long...
[/quote]

[h2]How it Works[/h2]
[quote]
At the end of every emergency broadcast, the system's integrity will be reported, communicating the status of the Emergency Broadcast System.

Once the power shuts off in Knox Country, there's a chance the Emergency Broadcast System will fail.

[b]System Faults[/b]

When a system fault occurs, the network will run a self diagnosis - a process that may take several days. Upon completion, a location and diagnostic code will be broadcast. 

Refer to NWS - National Weather Service - Diagnostic Manuals and NWS Registers to find and troubleshoot the issue. 

The NWS Diagnostic Manual will tell you what is wrong, and the items needed to resolve thefault. The NWS Register will tell you where to find the weather station in trouble. 

Enter the control room of the appropriate weather station, and perform the repairs by right clicking on one of the weather terminals. Once the repairs are complete, the next Emergency Broadcast will be broadcast loud and clear... until the next fault occurs!

[b]System Inturruptions[/b]

For a more punishing experience, system interruptions can be enabled from within your sandbox settings. These interruptions are temporary system faults, during which the Emergency Broadcasts system will be unavailable.
[/quote]

[h2]What's New in Knox Country[/h2]
[quote]
Five new locations have been added to the vanilla map, in the outskirts of West Point, Riverside, Muldraugh, Rosewood, and [spoiler]REDACTED[/spoiler]. In addition to weather stations, each location includes additional points of interest, such as a dirt race track, a diner, secluded homes, [spoiler]REDACTED[/spoiler], and much more!
[/quote]

[h2]New Items[/h2]
[quote]
To troubleshoot faults in the Emergency Broadcast System and find weather stations, two new items have been added to the game.

[b]- NWS Diagnostic Manual -[/b]
[list]
	[*]The National Weather Service Diagnostic manual provides the information you need to interpret the diagnostic codes thrown by the Emergency Broadcast System during a fault.
[/list]
[b]- NWS Register -[/b]
[list]
	[*]The National Weather Service Register contains the locations of all civilian weather stations, as well as a general layout of the major roads in Knox Country.
However, you will not find [spoiler]REDACTED[/spoiler] on a typical NWS Register - but with some luck, someone may have written it down before the Knox Event started...
[/list]

Since these are technical publications with a niche appeal, they are pretty rare.
Try your luck at the local bookstore, library, or home bookshelf. If you happen across a weather station, there's a good chance you'll find them in the control room, or in the trunk and glovebox of parked weather service vehicles.
[/quote]

[h2]Sandbox Options[/h2]
[quote]
[b]Save Our Station[/b] now supports [b]Sandbox Options[/b] for customizing your play style, such as:
[list]
	[*]Toggle for the Knox-Power Grid failure requirement.
	[*]Toggle for enabling/disabling Faults and Interruptions individually.
	[*]Reliability profiles for determining the frequency of faults and interruptions.
	[*]Time multiplier, for increasing or decreasing how rapidly faults and interruptions progress.
[/list]
These options can be changed at any time, on both Dedicated and Host-Mode Servers, via the Admin Menu. Singleplayer users can set them when starting a new game, or can use a mod like [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2894296454]Change Sandbox Options (by Star)[/url] to edit them in an existing world.
[/quote]

[h2]Mod & Map Compatibility[/h2]
[quote]
[b]Save Our Station[/b] is compatible with [i]many[/i] map mods.
Please see the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2398274461/3785877016600078243/]stickied post in the Discussions section[/url] for a comprehensive list, and the Map Cells that are in use.
[/quote]

[h2]Frequently Asked Questions & Issues[/h2]
[quote]
[i]We have moved the [b]FAQ[/b] into the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/discussions/2398274461]Steam Discussions section[/url]. Please see the appropriate stickied post![/i]

If you are running into a bug/issue, [b]please use our [url=https://github.com/BrianOstrander/pz-save-our-station/issues]GitHub Issue Tracker[/url][/b]. Your issue may have already been resolved.
[/quote]

[h2]What languages are supported?[/h2]
[quote]
The following languages are already supported, with more on the way!
Check out the stickied post below to help localize Save Our Station.

[list]
	[*]English - EN
	[*]German - DE
	[*]Spanish - ES
	[*]French - FR [i]Update Needed![/i]
[/list]

If you see English where it shouldn't be, it's because we need more help localizing this mod. See the relevant Steam Discussion Post for further information.
[/quote]

[h2]Credits[/h2]
[quote]
[list]
	[*]Spacew00t - Original mod creation, mapping, texturing, and Lua scripting.
	[*]YoshiWoof22 - Maintaining, code overhauls, Interruption system, Sandbox Options, German localization.
	[*]Krukrapok - Texturing the weather terminal and all around advice for improving my own textures.
	[*]throttlekitty - Answering my endless questions and providing awesome tiles!
	[*]Daddy Dirkiedirk - Textures and quality feedback.
	[*]Konijima & Chuck - Lua debugging for multiplayer support.
	[*]Xianah - French localization.
        [*]Nitropic - Spanish localization.
	[*]Lexx - Minor bugfix.
	[*]Olipro - Fixes for v41.78 update.
	[*]UNKNOWNFOX & Skizot - Vehicle texture help.
	[*]Special Thanks to everyone in the #mapping Discord channel, y'all are great!!!
[/list]
[/quote]

[hr][/hr]

3032108907.title: Scoop Da Water
3032108907.description:
[b][h1]Scoop Da Water[/h1][/b]
[b]Grab your bucket & scoop em![/b]

[h2]Problem[/h2]
[list]
[*]Farming in zomboid get tedious once your water depleted and need a refill.
[*]Filling water from barrels, lake & river feels the same with all water containers.
[*]Even containers like bucket or bowl where in real life we can just scoop em!
[/list]

[h2]Solution[/h2]
[list]
[*]This mod make containers like bucket or bowl able to take water faster.
[*]Bottle is still faster than normal but slower than a bucket or a cup.
[*]As long as water is being taken from barrels, lake or river.
[*]Tags are added to water containers for different scooping speed.
[/list]

[h2]Installation[/h2]
Subscribe to this mod normally and enable it.

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]
Build 41.78+

[h2]Known Issue[/h2]
None that I know of.

2851764922.title: SearchModeAPI
2851764922.description:
Framework for "search fog" mods compatibility, e.g. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?edit=true&id=2845952197]Read While Walking[/url]

How to use (for modders):
[code]
SearchModeAPI.Register("my_mod_name", 0.5) -- only once! the second parameter is your priority

.............
-- low priority mods will be igonred
SearchModeAPI.Lock("my_mod_name")  -- you're the ruler, locks the fog for you
..........
SearchModeAPI.Unlock("my_mod_name") -- you don't need fog anymore


................
-- your code must be marked:
SearchModeAPI.Activate("my_mod_name") -- all stuff now is related to your mod
local mode = getSearchMode():getSearchModeForPlayer(0)
getSearchMode():setEnabled(0,true)
mode:getBlur():setTargets(0.5, 0.5)
mode:getDesat():setTargets(0.5, 0.5)
mode:getRadius():setTargets(3,  3)
mode:getDarkness():setTargets(0.1, 0.1)
SearchModeAPI.Deactivate("my_mod_name") -- end of code from your mod
[/code]

The priority is the number. You need high values if your mechanics is very specific, e.g. you enables it only on certain actions. And you need low values if your mechanics is common, e.g. you use the fog all the time. This concept allows to lock searchmode manager for some/all mods.

Some values of priority:
-100: default value for all unknown mods, also is applyed to vanilla search mode.
10: Read While Walking mod.

P.S. It was quite hard to make this mod.

Workshop ID: 2851764922
Mod ID: SearchModeAPI41

2815560151.title: Share Annotations
2815560151.description:
[b]Compatible with version 42.2.0 and 41.78.16 (solo & multiplayer).[/b]

This mod allows you to share your map annotations with your friends using any piece of paper in a lore-friendly way.

Features:
[list]
    [*] write down annotations using pen and paper to share with others
    [*] trade and store annotations as a regular item
    [*] memorize Annotated Maps to your own map
    [*] pick which sets of annotations you'd like to see on your map
    [*] easily forget learned annotations if needed
    [*] opt-in to loot fully annotated maps off player corpses
[/list]

Officially compatible with:
[list]
    [*] Draw On Map (see caveat below)
    [*] Map Symbol Size Slider
[/list]


Muchas gracias to HawK for the Spanish translation!
謝謝 UnsetLay for the Traditional Chinese translation!
Merci Furthick for the French translation!
Спасибо FREEMAN96REG for the Russian translation!
Teşekkürler Neo Wolffe for the Turkish translation!
Díky NarcisSally for the Czech translation!
Obridago Hicaro for the Brazilian Portuguese translation!
Grazie Art Tippet for the Italian translation!

Enjoy!

[u][b]Compatibility with Draw On Map[/b][/u]

Draw On Map works by adding a LOT of "dot" annotations to your map to simulate drawing lines. This can lead to thousands of symbols created.

Project Zomboid has a 2,097,152 bytes limit for player objects when saving them to the database. Player objects include inventory, which may include a Shared Map created with this mod. Now, if you created a map containing thousands of symbols, you may hit the 2MB limit, meaning that your player cannot be saved anymore. If that happens, you will see a red box error in the bottom right corner.

This simply means that you cannot keep that map item in your inventory, because it contains too much data (the thousands of "dots" created by Draw On Map). After using the map (e.g. remembering annotations), you can drop it on the ground, store it or delete it, and your character should be fine again.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/E0TTrTs.gif[/img]

[url=https://ko-fi.com/I2I6D0YS4][img]https://i.imgur.com/ULMwSUt.png[/img][/url]
Enjoy!

Workshop ID: 2815560151
Mod ID: BLTAnnotations

3002666175.title: [B41] Show Wall Health
3002666175.description:
[h2]Part 1 of Sandbox Settings Update is up! Check comments for more info.[/h2]

Have you ever wondered how long your gate/wall/anything lasts? Well, now you know and you can prepare for the next horde.

Just right click on whatever you've built, then hover on the "Check Status" menu, and if you're closer you can just hover over his options to see its health.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/1geL0fn.png[/img]

[h2]Details[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Works in [b]Multiplayer[/b] / Coop / Singleplayer
 [*] Safe to be added / removed for any save.
 [*] Checking health works for everything you built from right click menu and some other objects like doors.
 [*] Have preview like generator, so you can see on which wall you looking.
 [*] If you're too far, you won't have the health on hover. You need to click on the button or get closer by yourself.
 [*] Cool-looking menu.
 [*] Sandbox settings
[/list]

[h2]Known Issues[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Some names might be junky like "MetalWindow1", they named them like that. I might do my translation after some time.
[/list]

[h2]Mod Compatibility[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Every mod that adds/change "Destroyable" things should work with it. 
(Examples: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2923027740]Destroyable World Fences[/url])
 [*] If you want to make sure the mod is compatible, the object instance must be "IsoThumpable" / "IsoDoor".
[/list]

[h2]Translation[/h2]
[list]
 [*] Every language has partial translation, but some of them are made using "Google Translator" which can make some words incorrect.
 [*] MY LANGUAGE SUCK! - You can contribute to the mod and add your own correction to the language. To do that, please join Discord (click on the banner below) and tag me there!
 [*] Github with available languages and templates - https://github.com/Kamer5555/Translation/tree/main 
[/list]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/1geL0fn.png[/img]

[h2][b]Want more?[/b][/h2]
Join me on Discord to stay up to date!
You can suggest or report anything there, you can also join the pz modding community ;).

[img]https://i.imgur.com/gohg4Xu.png[/img]

2852704777.title: Simon MDs Tiles

3052668642.title: [B41] Simple Overhaul: Melee Weapons (SOMW)
3052668642.description:
[h1]Simple Overhaul: Melee Weapons (SOMW)[/h1]
For Project Zomboid ver. 41.78 [B41]. Works in both Singleplayer and Multiplayer.
Included translations: EN, RU, CH, CN, IT, DE, KO, UA, TH, PTBR, ES, AR, JP, TR, PL.

[h2]FEATURES:[/h2]
- New fresh models and textures for almost all melee weapons from game. Everything is created and optimized for better quality without losing performance!
- Over 40+ new lore-friendly weapons which exists in 1993. Nothing weird or futuristic, just real tools and weapons!
- Melee weapons from the original game has been gently and carefully rebalanced. Now every weapon feels bit unique and different from each other!
- Slightly adjusted mechanics for Short Blade and Short Blunt weapons to make them better. Now you don't have to run around with crowbars or axes, because they are simply stronger than the rest.
- Fixed icons. Finally, the color of Screwdriver on the icon is the same as its game model!
- Now you can use Tree Branch as weapon. Yes, you read it right!
- Fixed blood overlay. Now blood on weapons will appear where it should - at the point of impact!
- Spears made from branches and spears made from planks are now visually different now. Small but nice detail!
- New recipes for upgrading your Baseball Bats. Wanted to wrap some wire around a bat? Now it's possible!
- New recipes for creating improvised weapons. Make Axe from Shovel, convert Broom into a spear, and saw a Long Metal Pipe into a short version!
- Fixed recipes for creating spears. Now you can make spears with good condition, also making spears does not depend on the Carpentry skill, and weapons can also be attached with Scotch Tape!
- Submod "Easy spear Attachments" will allow you to attach weapons to spears with Twine and Adhesive tape!

The full list of changes can be found [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3052668642/3882725182509908122]here[/url].

[h2]COMPATIBILITY:[/h2]
- Everything about mods compatibilty [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3052668642/6770657890633738221]HERE[/url].

[h2]FAQ:[/h2]
[b]Is it safe to add or remove a mod from a current game?[/b]
I recommend starting a new game with the mod, but it's not necessary.
You can add mod in current game, but most changes will only affect weapons that have not yet been found by the players. All Tree Branches will disappear, because their item type was changed.
You can remove mod from current game, but most changes will only affect weapons that have not yet been found by the players. All Tree Branches will disappear, because their item type was changed. All spears made from planks will disappear.

[h2]CREDITS:[/h2]
[b]Hea[/b] - coding, models, textures.
[b]Acid Finesse[/b] - models, support.
[b]Star[/b] - assisting with code.

Translators:
IT - Lore11
PTBR - Wel "Gravedigger"
TH - Riko Prushka
CH, CN - ZeroPhoenix
KO - Blumountain
AR, ES - Peppercat
DE - Xan
JP - Flandre Mayor
TR - Er-rayn
PL - Angelard, pek1gn

[img]https://i.imgur.com/cKVBRWw.gif[/img]

You can check out my other works:

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3246515001][img]https://i.imgur.com/BL5YjXo.png[/img][/url]
