3048902085.title: True Music improves Mood
3048902085.description:
Music lowers stress, boredom and unhapiness. ~ now with 100% more sandbox options!
Fork of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2954996592]Poltergeist's mod[/url] with some new features.

The effects are triggered every 10 in game minutes while listening to True Music.
Adjust your settings as needed. Default balancing expects a 1 hour day.
Can be safely added/removed with existing saves.

Optional Modifiers:
- Boredom
- Happiness
- Stress
- Panic
- Fatigue
- Pain (Reduction only)

If you want to disable something, set it to zero.

If zomboid ever adds Morale/Sanity this will get an update too.

Workshop ID: 3048902085
Mod ID: TrueMusicMoodImprovement

3118990099.title: True Music Jukebox B41
3118990099.description:
This version of True Music Jukebox is for Build 41. Norby has now updated it for Build 42 as well, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3398874593]and it can be found here.[/url] Keep in mind that [b]Build 42 does not have multiplayer yet.[/b]

Are you tired of swapping cassettes and vinyls after every track? Is the effort to find batteries doing more damage to your sanity than the zombie apocalypse, itself? Well, now you can load hundreds of cassettes and vinyls from the infamous True Music into a handy multipurpose jukebox and dance until you're undead! And the music syncs on multiplayer!

1. [i]First[/i] [b]remove[/b] [i]and then[/i] [b]unsubscribe from[/b] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3059476842]the old version of True Music Jukebox[/url]! (!!!)
2. Get [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2613146550]True Music[/url] (and it's prerequisites)
3. Subscribe to some good True Music track packs.
4. Find or build yourself an epic jukebox (but don't forget electricity)!
5. Turn it on, fill it with cassettes and vinyls, and crank it up to ELEVEN! *

[h2]How to Use Jukeboxes[/h2]

To use a jukebox, simply interact with it once after finding or placing it in the world and turn it on. This will convert the jukebox into a container object. After that, you can move (or "load") True Music cassettes and vinyls into the jukebox. Once tracks have been loaded, you can play them using either any loaded track's inventory menu or the jukebox interaction menu. Powered jukeboxes will play continuously. You can create a queue of specific tracks that will play next in the loaded playlist, and you can lock the queue if you want to loop through a subset of loaded tracks.

Jukeboxes can hold ELEVENTY arbitrary Zomboid weight units (110 AZWU) of your finest tapes and vinyl records. There is no track limit.

By default, zombies will be attracted to the sound of the jukebox up to 50 squares away. The range at which zombies can hear a jukebox at full volume can be set using sandbox options.

* Jukebox sound is controlled by Ambient Volume in sound settings.

[h2]Jukebox Therapy and Nutrition[/h2]

Jukeboxes can be given the power to improve the moods and health of players who hear them in many ways; they can even quench your thirst if you want them to be that magical. These features are off by default; enable them in sandbox options if they are up your alley!

[h2]Jukebox Icons[/h2]

This mod features icons to help people navigate its menus nonverbally. All buttons still do what their button text says they will do; buttons that say "play", "enable", or "turn on" do exactly that. However, the icon for buttons that toggle things on and off will reflect the CURRENT state of that option, [b]not[/b] the state it will be in after it's pressed. We made this decision because we wanted the icons to appear "on" when the associated toggle is "on" - e.g., the Jukebox icon is green when it's on. This pattern can be inverted on our game options page.

[h2]Portable Jukebox Keys[/h2]

Want to remotely access a jukebox's playlist and queue? Simply enable portable jukebox keys via sandbox options, add a jukebox to your key ring via the jukebox's main menu, and open the context menu on your (or any) key ring to control the box at any range. You may rename jukeboxes to remember locations more easily. Controller input is supported via the in-game keyboard.

[h2]Range Options[/h2]

In sandbox options, you can determine the audible sound range of the jukebox (a special setting exists for zombies); note, however, that our option for players will only work if you use our custom sound mode (the default sound mode of this mod). If you are using Project Zomboid's 3D sound effects, however, be aware that we are not able to control the sound range; it will drop off in volume according to whatever is deemed realistic by Project Zomboid.

[h2]Jukebox Hero[/h2]

Want to get a jukebox as fast as possible? Just choose the Jukebox Hero trait at character creation, and you will spawn with a Jukebox Starter Kit for building your very own jam station! You will also learn a recipe for making jukeboxes out of scrap.

[h2]3D Audio Effects[/h2]

True Music boomboxes and cassette players use 3D audio effects that many people find annoying because they have excessive bias toward one ear, and that ear is often the wrong ear (it's based on player position, not head orientation). We do not like the sound of that audio, so we replaced it with something we like much better. [b]However[/b], you may enable that form of 3D audio using both game options (for the individual level) and sandbox options (if you want to force your entire server to use the same 3D sound as True Music). Just be aware that we do not control the audible range of that sound mode.

[h2]Multiplayer Sync[/h2]

We have spent many hours confirming that you will hear the same songs as other people, and tracks will change at [i]almost[/i] the same time. Feel free to contact us if you believe you have ideas that can significantly improve this aspect of the mod!

We have not seen any desync in testing lately; however, if for some unexpected reason a jukebox does become desynced for one or more players, there are two things that will likely fix this. If the data is only wrong clientside, reconnecting should fix the issue; if the jukebox data is somehow corrupted serverside, then picking up a jukebox and putting it back down will reset its data.

[h2]Game Options[/h2]

True Music Jukebox now has its own page in the Game Options menu, where players can control a wide range of settings from jukebox volume to hiding menu options.

[h2]Translations[/h2]

We want True Music Jukebox to be available to every player in every language! Please learn more via [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3118990099/4035852798885773535/]our permanent discussion about language support[/url].

[h2]Update Schedule[/h2]

We will push feature updates on [b]Sundays at 10 PM EST[/b] whenever those updates are ready.

[h2]Discord Server[/h2]

Come join [url=https://discord.gg/3a3dWFB6yw]the True Music Jukebox community[/url] on Discord! In the future, we plan to warn people there if we need to do an unscheduled update for any reason (such as bug fixes that we consider urgent). We are also able to respond to usage questions, bug reports, translation requests, and feature suggestions faster on Discord. Please join us!

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]

This mod was written and will continue to be improved with compatibility as a high priority. It was tested alongside hundreds of mods, and it was fully compatible with all of them. It also integrates smoothly with Lifestyle: Hobbies. If you have any information regarding a potential incompatibility, please visit us on Discord and ping us!

You can add this midsave. Starter kits and manuals will not spawn in places that the server has already initialized with items.

[h2]Modpacks[/h2]

Please [b]read[/b] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3118990099/4139439021818677235/]our Modpacks discussion[/url].

[h2]Other Mods by Norby007[/h2]

See my other mods for mixed insanity:

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2878074695]SuperGigaMart[/url] - It's like shopping on Black Friday!

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3042138819]FunctionalAppliances[/url] - Now with More Brews!

[h2]Other Mods by Burryaga[/h2]

Burryaga is a Wookiee. Check out [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/zendachi/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]his Steam Workshop[/url] for a variety of useful mods!

Workshop ID: 3118990099
Mod ID: TrueMusicJukebox

3100475013.title: True Music Radio
3100475013.description:
[h1]True Music Radio Default Radio Stations:[/h1]

    [h3]94FM (92FM in B42) plays from the global list or the Terminal A playlist at the station[/h3]

    [h3]94.2FM (92.2FM in B42) plays from the global list or the Terminal B playlist at the station[/h3]

    [h3]94.4FM (92.4FM in B42) plays from the global list or the Terminal C playlist when activated by an admin at a terminal[/h3]

    [h3]94.6FM (92.6FM in B42) plays from the global list or the Terminal D playlist when activated by an admin at a terminal[/h3]

    [h3]94.8FM (92.8FM in B42) plays from the global list or the Terminal E playlist when activated by an admin at a terminal[/h3]

    [h3]True Music MTV TV Ch.211 in B42 plays from the global list or the Terminal MTV playlist when activated by an admin at a terminal[/h3]

Stations can now be changed in the sandbox settings, it is possible to change them mid-playthrough but you will need to restart a server if involved or replace the sandbox file in a solo game.

These radio stations were made compatible with the True Music player mod and it's cassettes and vinyl.

[h1]Without True Music song mods loaded, you will only hear the game's theme song and the terminals will only have a single tape and a single record.[/h1]

New! Song announcements, weather reports, and Horde Night compatibility. When using Horde Night, the radio will display a warning every hour on the hour. You can turn these off in sandbox settings and in solo games in mod options.

Horde Night!
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2714850307

If you make the trip out to this station in the west end of Riverside, you can update two special terminals next to the computer. Drop your music items into the terminal and update the music list. The only limit to the number of tape/vinyl tracks added is the weight that the terminal can hold.

Alternatively all the radio stations start with a default list of all the True Music mod packs you have in your mod list. The terminals can also revert the music back off the playlist if you want to change it back. If you switch the terminal options, all radios on those channels will update and play a new song. So you can use it to resync immediately or switch songs but it's always random.

Just added in v1.11 the terminals will now start with some random music media in them but it does not pull tracks to the terminal channels immediately. You still need to make the trip out. Also the terminal on the western wall has an option to eject media. It will allow random spawns of media from that terminal. I will be working on a way to choose a title in the future so you can download the songs of your choice. The new sandbox settings allow control of the amount of media found in each terminal. The west terminal eject system is also limited to the same spawn amounts and the ability disappears once empty.

Added in v1.13 play radios everywhere in single player with immediate world sync. In multiplayer the music must stop and be restarted between world switching as radios in inventories and backpacks can only be heard by that player.

Added in v1.18 you can now turn off all TMRadio station music on all radios with mod options. Great for streamers that need to control the music.

Added in v1.21 an admin can now activate terminals to control the 94FM and 94.2FM stations that are not at the station. This will help custom maps to control the music. Even though multiple terminals can change the music, only one can control the music list at a time. The last one that updated will be the one in control.

Added in v1.27 radio stations can be moved in the sandbox settings.

Added in v1.29 an admin can now remove songs from the global list so that the 5 music stations will never play those songs unless overridden by playing them from the terminal list directly. The admin can go through the terminal menu and add and remove songs from the list. The sandbox is also updated to choose to remove the theme music with TrueMusic, the additional songs added by TCCacheMP, or just the holiday music from the TCCacheMP mod.

[h1]Known issues:[/h1]

[h1][b]***On servers you may need to set anti-cheat 21 as false if it kicks players, it seems to be a generic failure involving corrupted mod files that differ from server to client.***[/b][/h1]

They way this works now, no longer needing script codes from the broadcast, just turn on a radio and tune in to one of the 5 stations. It will start a song immediately but if someone already started a song on that station it will be out of sync until the next song is played. Then both radios will be in sync.

Handheld and inventory radios are not heard by other players in multiplayer.

Handheld radios are only heard by the owner in multiplayer but zombies will still hear them unless you use a headset. New in v1.13 zombie attraction has a toggle and is default to off.

Disassembling running radios will cause the audio emitter to detach, have not written a fix for it yet but on the way.

Station location in southwest Riverside: https://map.projectzomboid.com/#4835x6283x6360

[h1]Updates:[/h1]

v1.28
Added - ability for the admin to activate the other 3 channels for control through a terminal, by default only the first 2 could be controlled
Added - ability to turn off the theme music from the radios in the sandbox

v1.29
Added - Blacklist for admins to remove music titles from the lists
Added - Sandbox settings so that the theme music, TCCacheMP music, or just the TCCacheMP holiday music can be removed from the lists

v1.30
fixed - bug with empty blacklist causing client mod data issues on disconnect

v1.31
Updated to b42, work around to get tapes and records to drop until True Music is updated, can be used without True Music or the cache for now.

Updated the terminals at the radio station to control all 5 stations.

Updated to include a mumble removal (this may affect other mods so it needs to load separately).

*** Now compatible with the new mod "TV & Radio ReInvented" as I have added the tuning decorations for those interfaces when that mod is being used in B42 ***

***Warning, some TM add-on mods are causing errors that are caused by old item spawning locations that do not exist in B42, they will need to remove those missing locations from their script files to stop the errors***

[h1]The new multiplayer true music jukebox is now available![/h1]
[b]True Music Jukebox[/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3118990099
Workshop ID: 3118990099
Mod ID: TrueMusicJukebox

2667899942.title: [VFE] VANILLA FIREARMS EXPANSION (B41)
2667899942.description:
[h1]This upload will no longer be updated (I literally can't) but a B42 branch will happen when it's ready. I will keep this mod up for both B41 users and as a memorial. - Vilespring[/h1]

[h2]This mod replaces the models, textures and names of nearly all vanilla firearms, attachments, ammunition and magazines. It also adds several new lore-friendly weapons and items.[/h2]

[h1]⚠️ READ THE FAQ ⚠️[/h1]

As of this version, 23 new firearms (and their magazines), 6 attachments, and two new calibers of ammunition.

[h2]New Weapons[/h2]
SPAS-12 Shotgun - Rare semi-automatic shotgun with a folding stock and 7+1 magazine tube.

M590 Shotgun - Uncommon pump-action shotgun with a 7+1 magazine tube.

R1187 Shotgun - Uncommon semi-automatic shotgun with a 4+1 or 7+1 magazine tube.

MP5 Submachinegun - Rare select fire submachinegun using 30 round detachable magazines. Has a variant with folding stock and a built in flashlight.

MP5SD Submachinegun - Very rare suppressed select fire submachinegun using 30 round detachable magazines.

M10 Submachinegun - Very rare select fire machinegun using 32 round detachable magazines

Uzi Submachinegun - Very rare select fire machinegun using 32 round detachable magazines

Mini-14 Rifle - Uncommon semi-automatic rifle with 20 round detachable magazines. Has a folding stock variant.

W1866 Carbine - Common lever-action rifle with internal magazine of 8+1 rounds of .38 Special.

R92-44 Carbine - Common lever-action rifle with internal magazine of 8+1 rounds of .44 Magnum.

M2400 Combination Gun - Common break action rifle/shotgun. Chambered in .308 and Shotgun Shells.

AK-47 Assault Rifle - Very rare select fire assault rifle with 30 round detachable magazines. Has a folding stock variant.

MAK-90 Rifle - Uncommon semi-automatic rifle with 30 round detachable magazines. Basically a more common version of the AK-47.

FAL Battle Rifle - Very rare select fire rifle with 20 round detachable magazines.

CAR15 Assault Rifle - Very rare select fire assault rifle with 30 round detachable magazines.

TEC-9 Pistol - Uncommon semi-automatic pistol using 20 round detachable magazines.

G17 Pistol - Uncommon semi-automatic pistol using 17 round detachable magazines.

P229 Pistol - Uncommon semi-automatic pistol using 13 round detachable magazines.

CZ 75 Pistol - Uncommon semi-automatic pistol using 16 round detachable magazines.

Mk2 Pistol - Common semi-automatic pistol using 10 round detachable magazines. Has a rare integrally suppressed variant.

SKS Rifle - Uncommon semi-automatic rifle with 9+1 internal magazine. Has a variant with a built in bayonet.

R1022 Rifle - Common semi-automatic rifle using 10 round detachable magazines.

MC-45 Carbine - Common semi-automatic rifle using 7 round detachable magazines.

M24 Sniper Rifle - Very rare bolt-action rifle using a 5+1 internal magazine.

M60 Machinegun - Extremely rare automatic belt fed machinegun using 100 round belts. Requires ammunition with links and will drop the links while shooting.

M16 Masterkey Assault Rifle - Extremely rare select fire assault rifle with 30 round detachable magazines. Features an underbarrel shortened M590 shotgun with an internal tube magazine of 3 + 1.

M9 Bayonet - Uncommon knife. Can be mounted onto an M16 or M590 for use as a bayonet.

Entrenching Tool - Uncommon tool. Can be folded and used as either long blunt or an axe.


[h2]New Ammunition[/h2]
7.62 Ammunition - Used in AK47 and SKS Rifles.

.22 Ammunition - Used in R1022 rifle and Mk2 pistols.

Linked .308 Ammunition - .308 with the M13 Ammunition Link. Used in the M60 Machinegun.

[h2]New Attachments[/h2]
Bipod - Stabilizing bipod that can be attached to SKS, M14, R700, R788, and M24.

Shell Holder - Side mounted shotgun shell carrier to speed up shotgun reloads.

Shell Straps - Statistically the same as Shell Holder, but mounts on some weapons the Shell Holder cannot.

Lightened Stock - Statistically the same as the Fiberglass Stock but without the cosmetic changes.

Coupled magazines - Craftable taped assault rifle magazines to speed up reloads. (5.56 and 7.62)

Brass Catcher -  Cratable attachment for the M60 Machinegun that keeps links from dropping onto the ground.

This mod also rebalances weapon attachments in a manner that makes more sense compared to the vanilla game. (For example, you cannot mount a red dot sight on most handguns, excluding the DE Pistol, and the Magnum Revolver.)


[h2]Reworks to Jamming[/h2]
In vanilla when a weapon jams it consumes a round when it is unjammed. With VFE the round is returned if the gun is completely unloaded before clearing.

Jamming probability curve has been completely rewritten. In vanilla a 90% M16 only has a 50% chance of getting through a magazine without jamming. Now guns only begin to jam at 75% or 70%. They also start to jam more than vanilla guns do at 25% or 20%. Basically high condition guns jam less (or not at all) and low condition guns jam more often.

Manually cycled guns can jam now. Pump shotguns and bolt action rifles do their jam calculations when a round is chambered.

[h2]Zombies[/h2]
Many more zombies in the world can spawn with firearms on them. Survivor zombies have also been given a bit touch up.

[h2]Sandbox Options[/h2]
Quite a few aspects of the mod is configurable via sandbox settings. This is mostly toggles as to where VFE puts its guns, but also contains a multiplier for weapons in normal houses. An option exists to disable spawning of the M60 Machinegun, if such is desired.

This version of the mod is not final, we will continuously update adding new things and changing old ones.

[h2]FAQ[/h2]
Q: Is this mod compatible with Brita's/Arsenal26?
A: No. They are incompatible at the lua level. VFE is also designed around its own balance design, so using both at the same time doesn't make sense.

Q: I took an attachment off a weapon and it won't go back on.
A: You have a soft mod incompatibility. Another mod is overwriting attachments.

Q: A weapon doesn't accept an attachment that makes sense
A: Usually same story as previous question, but there is a chance it was missed. If its still true with just VFE in the modlist, report it. Also make sure you have a screwdriver in your inventory.

Q: Can this mod be installed mid save?
A: Yes and no. The new guns will spawn in unexplored locations, but guns already spawned will still retain their old stats, like damage and range. If you do decide to add it to an existing save you will have to delete and respawn all the guns you already have. The same is true with uninstalling. (when it comes to weapon stats)

Q: Does this mod have suppressors?
A: No. They're not off the table but they are also not a priority.

Q: Why are some guns invisible?
A: Maxwell's suppressor mod causes this when that mod is out of date. That is a problem with that mod, not VFE itself.

Q: Why are some guns tiger striped/rusted/wrong textures?
A: Issue with the texture optimization mod. Basically VFE changes textures for its models, but the texture optimization mod reverts them to vanilla.

[h2]Final Notes[/h2]

If you find any bugs, dislike something, or just have ideas you'd like to see incorporated into this mod, please let us know in the comments!

[h2]CREDITS[/h2]

Stendo_Clip - Models, Textures, Scripts, Lua
Spuchel - Textures, Icons, Scripts, Lua, Animations
Vilespring - Models, Textures, Scripts, Lua

Special thanks to TedEBear of Serious Survival Roleplay for sponsoring the M60 and several other firearms.
Special thanks to Alec for letting us use his magazine models from his mod, Ammo & Magazine icon MOD.
Special thanks to Great Hero J for creating various pixel art sprites that VFE uses as item/interface icons.

Workshop ID: 2667899942
Mod ID: VFExpansion1

2788428718.title: Vanilla Vehicle Enhancer
2788428718.description:
*** NOTICE OF ABANDONMENT ***     *** 03/29/2025 ***

THIS MOD'S AUTHOR IS NO LONGER INTERESTED IN UPDATING THIS MOD.  THEREFORE THE AUTHOR GRANTS ANYONE THE RIGHT TO FEEL FREE TO USE THE FILES CONTAINED IN THE MOD AS THEY SO CHOOSE.  UPDATE THE MOD FOR B42 OR USE THE FILES AS A SPRINGBOARD TO CREATE YOUR OWN MOD, THE AUTHOR GIVES YOU HIS FULL BLESSING.  FEEL FREE TO POST YOUR UPDATES AND YOUR OWN VERSIONS TO THE WORKSHOP.  MAYBE JUST GIVE CREDIT WHERE DUE IF YOU FEEL LIKE.



10/28/2023 The Step Van Update

**** READ! READ! READ! ****
THIS MOD REPLACES SOME STOCK FILES AND TEXTURES. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND STARTING A NEW GAME BEFORE USING THIS MOD. DO NOT BLAME ME IF YOU MESS UP YOUR SAVE FILE.


Over 400 skins based on real world vehicles with realistic paint colors! Included are new wheels as well as textures for the wrecked and crispified versions also!

This mod got started when I got tired of looking at all the weirdly pastel colored cars that spawn in the game by default so I decided to try and make things a bit more realistic. This basic goal got out of hand probably due to a case of OCD and this mod is the result.

This mod replaces all textures for all vehicles in the vanilla game except for the trailer which I might do for a future update. The aim of this mod is to enhance the look of the default vehicles and to add some much needed variety to the vanilla motor pool.

There are now three different types of police cars; a standard police car, a sheriff's car, and a state trooper car. These skins are based on the mod "Proper Police Skins" by Söze with permission. You don't need both mods for this to work but you will have to pick one or the other as they do conflict with each other.

This mod will likely have problems working alongside any mod that messes with the files for the vanilla cars. I have tested this mod with a few vehicle related mods and have encountered issues with two mods for sure: Eggon's Worthwhile Cars and the Crashed Cars mod. Eggon's Worthwhile Cars causes some vehicle's textures to not show up properly and the Crashed Cars Mod causes the textures for the wrecked cars to not show up properly. This issue persisted no matter what order I ran the mods in. If you are fine with these problems you can continue using those mods.

Workshop ID: 2788428718

2757712197.title: Vehicle Repair Overhaul
2757712197.description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/8CRHL5v.png[/img]

[b]B41 and B42 COMPATIBLE[/b]

	[hr]						[/hr]

Find a clunker you love but its one zombie tap from disintegration? Fix it up!

[b]Repair and Salvage - Vanilla Vehicles and all the great Workshop Vehicle Creations!![/b]

Adds many more repair options for Hoods, Trunks, Seats, Doors, Gas Tanks, Lights, Windshields, Windows, Tires, Brakes, Suspension, Glove box, Roof Racks, Trailers, Cargo Containers, Armoured Parts & other Vehicle Accessories or Salvage the whole vehicle too removing it from your path!

[b]New Items included[/b]

Fix A Flat - Tire Repair - This will get you by until you switch out the tires - Can be found in Vehicle Trunks.**You can combine cans that you find**

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h2]This mod is safe to add or remove from your existing saves[/h2]

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1] Repair & Salvage [/h1]

The aim of this mod is to let you repair and fix up your vehicle(s)
[b]and[/b] will bring more focus and choices for the mechanics and metal welders amongst us

 [b]-works in MP and SP (and can be installed or removed anytime)[/b]
 -with a shortage of working cars on some servers you can now fix up what you find
 -have a mechanic in your group? put their skills to use
 -collect cars and restore them to their former glory
 -learn your craft and progress, become that master mechanic you always wanted to be
 -grab your blowtorch and break down many vehicle parts into useable items
 -salvage the complete vehicle for many useful items depending on your skill
 -[b]compatible with all vehicle additions on the workshop [/b]
 -built-in support for Valhalla Vehicle Ownership module

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1]Repair your ride[/h1]

Use varying parts to restore your ride
 -start easy changing tires then with seats, have some ductape, sheets, glue, a spring? you can repair it!
 -Parts have a lot more uses now, from metal bars and springs to rebuild the suspension, light bulbs for light, fabrics for seats and good old ductape for many minor fixes
 -Screws and metal for moderate fixes but progress to using a blow torch and your repairs will be solid!

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1]Salvage of Vehicle and Parts[/h1]

Salvage parts from one vehicle and use the pieces to repair other parts on other vehicles

Grab your blow torch and mask to break down vehicle parts into useable items!

Salvaging Vehicle parts could provide you with several items in return!
Tear up those old stinky seats and you'll have a chance of gaining those dirty Rags, Leather, Denim or Thread!
Grab your blowtorch and mask, uninstall those beat-up doors and salvage them for a chance of Metal Sheets, Screws, Small Metal Sheets or even Electronical Scrap!
Enjoying those mods that introduce Roof Racks? Well now you can salvage those too!
Each Vehicle part can be salvaged with a chance of gaining up to three salvaged items depending on your Mechanic and Welding skills.

[b]Salvage Vehicle[/b] is now included

Right click on a vehicle and choose "Salvage Vehicle"

This option is available once you have Metal Working skill 4 or above, Mechanics skill 3 or above and requires 10 propane units and a Welders Mask. You can salvage all vehicles except Wrecks*.
This option will completely salvage and remove the vehicle clearing the path.
Depending on your Metal Working skill, you will salvage the vehicle faster and receive many useful items the higher your skill.
I do recommend removing as many parts of the vehicle as you can and empty the vehicle before salvage of the vehicle body. This will give you vehicle parts to use, further salvage options for those parts and your character will have gained more knowledge about vehicles and gained more skill XP in Mechanics and Metal Working.

The Vanilla option for *dismantle wreck option is also still available (only for wrecked vehicles), takes less time but your returns are smaller and less varied with less XP too.

The better you are at Mechanics or Metal Welding will mean your talents will produce better results from the Salvage!
A Mechanic knows the parts he wants, gaining skills in Metal Welding means he can better acquire those parts.

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1]Suggested workshop items that add to the experience[/h1]

[b]Many Vehicle mods on the workshop are already supported with this mod ! [/b]
The list below are some of my favs

[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/id/KI5/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]KI5's Vehicles[/URL]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/id/bls13/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]Cyt Vehicles[/URL]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198004947199/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]Sharks Vehicles[/URL]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2719592131]Tread's Water Tank Trucks[/URL]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1539281445]Crashed Cars[/URL]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2787291513]Craft Helper Continued[/URL]
[URL=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2712632417]Viperels Vehicle Spare Parts[/URL]

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1]Compatibility[/h1]

Good with everything!! I do not overwrite vanilla code, I create additions so it plays nice with any other mod you want to use.
**Place this mod after any vehicle mods or towards the bottom of your mod order for best results**

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1]NOTES[/h1]

[strike]Heater repair and Lightbar Repair and Salvage will come eventually to this mod. It requires a different method of coding compared to the regular vehicle repairs and unfortunately I just haven't had the time to incorporate it.[/strike]

For now I suggest the "Easy Heater Repair" and "Easy Lightbar Repair" mods. (B41)

The B42 version now has updated versions of [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2602450182]Easy Heater Repair[/url] and [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2582648054]Easy Lightbar Repair[/url] integrated into it. Credit to [url=steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198037641428/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]PipMagnet[/url] for the original mods. If they return and want them removed, I will do so.

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1]Contributing on GitHub[/h1]

If you have a translation or want to help add repair options to new vehicles and you know how Project Zomboid scripts work, you can make a pull request on [url=https://github.com/ThisIsSP4RTAN/PZ-VehicleRepairOverhaul]GitHub[/url]

	[hr]						[/hr]
[h1]Thanks to[/h1]

Trealak, DJVirus and all the modders who offer help with code and of course Vehicle creators like filibuster, KI5, fhqwhgad, Diegus, cyt and shark.
Special Thanks to Tofuman!

[h2]Translations[/h2]
Polish Translation by ?DOM.0?
French Translation by KwerTTY
Russian Translation by Macintosh.
German Translation by Thanit.
Chinese Translation by UnsetLay.
Brazilian Portugese Translation by peteR 75hz.
Thai Translation by Riko Prushka.
Turkish Translation by GKarahan.
Updated Italian Translation by Falbor

2793164190.title: Vehicle Spawn Zones Expanded
2793164190.description:
This mod adds new vehicle spawn zones and spawn lists around KY. These new spawn zones range from adding some vehicle spawns to areas that did not have any, to adding new themed spawn areas that provide a more specific set of vehicles. In total, there are over 1000 new spawn zones scattered around the map. Note: the preview screenshots were all taken with vehicle spawn rate set to High, to better showcase the new spawn areas.

[h1]This mod was originally made for my car pack [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2791656602]here[/url] and has support for it.[/h1]
Vehicles from the pack are also featured in the screenshots. This started as a means to more reliably find the very rare cars from the pack without increasing their overall spawn rate, and sort of expanded from there into its own mod. Many of the spawn lists here were made for cars in the pack, so they work well together.

This mod primarily does 2 things:

The first is placing more spawn zones around the map, both vanilla spawn lists and new ones detailed in the next part. These are mostly in areas that didn't have spawn zones already, such as rural houses, small neighborhoods on the outskirts of towns, and other locations that seemingly should have spawn zones.

The second is adding new themed spawn lists that provide more specific selections of vehicles. These spawn zones are placed all around the map, and are usually consistent with their respective vehicle themes. Check the discussions for a description of each of the new spawn lists and where you might find some of the spawn zones.


Supported Vehicle Mods (For the new spawn lists):
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2788635598]KV's Vehicle Bonanza[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2809058492]1993 American Vehicle Pack[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1510950729]Filibuster Rhymes' Used Cars![/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2759339330]W900 Semi Truck[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2567438952]'89 911 Turbo (930)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2478247379]'67 Cadillac Gage Commando[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2618213077]'89 Oshkosh M911[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2734164805]P.A.R.C.[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1687801932]DeLorean DMC-12[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2771297715]Skizot's Riding Mower[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2768264215]Skizot's Go Kart (manual spawn version recommended)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2835977984]Marc's Bugatti EB110[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2791656602][img]https://i.imgur.com/RJXyg7i.png[/img][/url]

Supported maps (For the new spawn zones):
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2707344076]Redstone Raceway[/url]

[b][u]Big thanks to Funnypig for the support for these following mods[/u][/b]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2783373547]Skizot's Ice Cream Truck (Freezer version)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2783580134]Skizot's Garbage Truck[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2781895054]Skizot's AE86[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2689292423]'89 Toyota Supra (A70)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2756615186]'89 Mazda RX-7 (FC)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2727969941]ZAW Sputnik 26 (Trabant 601)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2748047915]VW Transporter (T3)[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/KI5/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]Various KI5 Vehicles[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198386727404/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]Various Mr.Danny and ATA Vehicles[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2282429356]Autotsar Trailers[/url]
Various [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/bls13/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]cyt[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198004947199/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600]shark[/url] vehicles

[b][u]Big thanks to Panopticon for the support for the following mods[/u][/b]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2849455153]Special Emergency Vehicles & FBI for Filibuster Rhymes' Used Cars![/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2930796403]Fox's Extra Police[/url]
Several more KI5 vehicles

[h1]Note about some mod vehicle's spawns[/h1]
Some mod vehicles use farm as an alternate spawn zone, particularly military ones since there was no official military/army zone for a while. This mod uses farm spawn zones quite often, so I've included some optional mods that will attempt to disable the farm spawns of some mods. I'll likely try to add more, so please report any odd farm spawns in the discussions or comments.

I'll be adding support for other vehicle mods and along the way, and other modders can use these spawn lists in their own vehicle's spawn lists and map mods. Supporting custom maps is also something I would like to implement in the mod.

[h1]FAQ[/h1]

[b]Q: How does it interact with map mods in Knox Country?[/b]
A: It can be used with map mods, but currently there are no new spawn zones for new areas added by maps. As long as the maps don't significantly alter vanilla towns/neighborhoods layouts it should be fine, and worst case scenario is that the spawns will be in odd spots. It will also work with Ekron, since I did not place any spawns in that area.

[b]Q:Can it be used with any mod/map, even if it's not on the supported list?[/b]
A: Yes! Mods not listed will still benefit from the newly placed zones for vanilla spawn lists, they just will not be in the newly added spawn lists. Maps will still work normally, check the above Q.

[b]Q:Does it work with other spawn zone mods (Military Vehicle Spawn Defs, Vehicle Scenes, KES Town Specific spawns, etc.)?[/b]
A: Yes, it should work with them. I will adjust any overlapping spawn zones I find, but it should be OK to use with such mods.

[b]Q:Where should the map be in the map order?[/b]
A: The map (MotoriousExpandedSpawnZones) can be anywhere in the map order, but it might work best just above the base game map (Muldraugh, KY). Addon maps for other map mods should be [b]above the original mod's map[/b] or the zones will not work. Remember though that the base game map should be at the [b]bottom of the in-game map list, or the end of the server .ini map list,[/b] as with all map mods that add to the base map.

[b]Q:It says I'm missing a required mod, what gives?[/b]
A: [h1][b][u]No other mods are required for this mod to function. Every addon besides the base mod (ID: fhqExpVehSpawn) is optional, and alters certain aspects of the mod or provides compatibility for something else.[/u][/b][/h1] If you don't know what the required mod is, disable the sub mod that requires it. The descriptions for each addon will tell you what they do, and what mods they require if they do, but are [b][u]not[/u][/b] required for the mod to work.

Workshop ID: 2793164190
Mod ID: fhqExpVehSpawn
Mod ID: fhqExpVehSpawnGageFarmDisable
Mod ID: fhqExpVehSpawnM911FarmDisable
Mod ID: fhqExpVehSpawnP19AFarmDisable
Mod ID: fhqExpVehSpawnNoVanilla
Mod ID: fhqExpVehSpawnRedRace
Map Folder: MotoriousExpandedSpawnZones

1430463738.title: Vehicle Tweaker API
1430463738.description:
[h1]Compatible with B41 and B42[/h1]

Inspired by and modified from DarkSlayerEX's Item Tweaker API

This modding API allows any modders to make multiple changes to any vehicles , while leaving the rest of the remaining values alone.

WARNING: For now I can't guarantee that most values tweaked are free of bugs, so use and test at your own risk.

Tested and working values: forcedColor, mass, maxSpeed, mechanicType.

For the Simplest Implementation through LUA: 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------Begin File 
if getActivatedMods():contains("VehicleTweakerAPI") then 
require("VehicleTweaker_Core"); 
else return end 

TweakVehicle("Base.CarNormal","mass", "8000");
TweakVehicle("Base.ModernCar","forcedColor", "1.0 0.5 0.5");
TweakVehicle("Base.Van","mechanicType", "1");

TweakVehicleArea("Base.SportsCar", "area SeatFrontLeft", "xywh = 0.6264 -0.1429 1.4725 1.4725")
-----------------------------------------------------------------------End File 
For each vehicle and property you wish to change, create a new line, and place the related values in place. 

There's an example mod here https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1430481582

Join my Discord server to talk about my mods: https://discord.gg/dzbZgzXNTT
And if you can always...
[url=https://www.patreon.com/soulfilcher][img]https://i2.wp.com/spectraartspace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/support-us-on-patreon-button.png?ssl=1[/img][/url]

Workshop ID: 1430463738
Mod ID: VehicleTweakerAPI

2831786301.title: Video Game Consoles
2831786301.description:
[b] Genesis does what NintenDon't [/b]

Adds playable video game consoles.

Includes:
                 Gameboy
                 GameGear
                 Lynx
                 NES

More Game Addons by [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198067113023]Big Al[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3413237147]More NES Games[/url]

3156718127.title: [B41] Video Game Consoles - Insanely Rare
3156718127.description:
[h1]Video Game Consoles - Insanely Rare[/h1]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2831786301][b]Video Game Consoles[/b][/url] is an awesome mod, but they spawn too frequently.
Even if you set your loot to 'Insanely Rare' in the sandbox options, you're still going to find around 10 consoles and 50 games in each school.


With this mod, you'll walk out with 1 handheld console and a few games, if you're lucky.
A true cause for celebration!


Works great combined with the regular Sandbox Options: Loot Rarity > Other > Insanely Rare
(video games & video game consoles are classified as 'other')


If this mod makes them too hard to find, double your chances with the 'Extremely Rare' Sandbox Option!


[hr][/hr]Special thanks to...
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/demiurgeQuantified/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600][b]albion[/b][/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/SpicyApple/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600][b]Spicy_Apples[/b][/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561199218026428/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600][b]Poltergeist[/b][/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Chuckleberry_Finn/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600][b]Chuckleberry Finn[/b][/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/eric1894/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600][b]eric1894[/b][/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198079959669/myworkshopfiles/?appid=108600][b]Panopticon[/b][/url], [b]Вишня[/b],

2949768076.title: Video Game Consoles Addon - More Game Boy Games
2949768076.description:
*** Requires the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2831786301]Video Game Consoles[/url] mod by Spicy_Apples! ***

This mod adds 55 more Game Boy games, for a grand total of 60.
The mod is lore accurate, meaning you'll only find games released in North America before July 1993.

The mod uses 5 dummy items for distribution that, when spawned, get replaced by one of the 60 games. So the loot chance is still the same, meaning you won't have more Game Boy games spawning - there will just be a much greater variety of games.

Download my other VGC addon: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2954956107]More NES Games[/url]

Coding credits:

2901552077.title: Visible Holster
2901552077.description:
[h1]With this mod you can see the holster![/h1]

This simple mod let you see holster on your character, which will add some more realism in how looks equipment on you!

This modification makes Holster and Dual Holster from vanilla visible on the player character.

You can wear the belt with holster in 3 variations: Over the jacket, Without the jacket and Without the belt.

In addition, the mod adds 6 color variations of the holster, which will add variety to your appearance.

Also, the modification allows you to craft a Holster and Dual Holster for the your character!

Modification translated: English, Simplified Chinese (CN), Ukrainian, Polish, Italian, Brazilian Portuguese, French, Spanish, Turkish.

[b]The mod includes 3 versions of itself, for the convenience of using the mod for your purposes:[/b]
mrnvsbhltr - original mod that includes the full version of itself (Holster colors, crafting).
mrnvsbhltrvn - version of the mod that only includes the standard holster color from the original game and crafting.
mrnvsbhltwc - version of the mod that only includes the standard holster color from the original game without crafting.

[i] At this moment, the mod may conflict with other modifications that change the standard position of the pistol in the holster! If you see that the gun is not in the holster when it should be, it is most likely due to this problem. I'm already working on a fix for this bug, give me some time to do this. If you know what mod is causing this problem for you, report it to Bugs, then you will greatly help in fixing the problem![/i]

[h1]Did you like the mod? You can support me if you want! [/h1]
[img]https://i.ibb.co/tQYTw8D/ko-fi.png[/img] [url=https://ko-fi.com/moryan]Support on Ko-fi[/url]

2759339330.title: W900 Semi-Truck
2759339330.description:
Adds a new non-military Semi-Truck and compatible Semi-Trailer in multiple variants to the game.

[b]Features:[/b]
[list][*]New semi-truck in 3 variants (Lite, Sleeper, Box)
[*]New semi-trailer (Van, Fuel Tanker)
[*]Animated vehicle parts.
[*]Multiple texture variants and model parts.
[*]Truck can be outfitted with custom armor and bullbar.
[*]Truck can pull all KI5 semi-trailers except for the fuel tanker.
[*]Trailer lights will synchronize with the towing vehicle.
[*]Custom lightbar.[/list]

[b]Known issues:[/b]
Due to the size of the vehicles, it sometimes may not be possible to open/close the rear door to access the trunk, or open the mechanics interface. If this happens, rotate the vehicle a little bit.

[b]Notes:[/b]
[list][*]Armor works as intended. Bullbar and window covers will make it so vehicle parts will not go below a certain %. That means, up until this % value, they can still be damaged. This is to avoid repair-exploits.
[*]If the trailer has locked doors, you have to disassemble the door via the mechanics menu and add it back in. This will break the lock.
[*]Hooking a trailer is done via the driver seat once the vehicles are in correct position.
[*]KI5 trailers are NOT supported.[/list]

[b]Other mod suggestions:[/b]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2732639855]Water Trailer[/url]
[*]Using [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=2392709985]Tsar's Common Library[/url] will enable a unique sleep- and microwave-, and fridge-option for the semi-truck with sleeper. It will also allow refueling cars from the fuel tanker.[/list]

[b]For server admins, the new vehicles and trailers can be spawned via:[/b]
/addvehicle Rotators.SemiTruck
/addvehicle Rotators.SemiTruckLite
/addvehicle Rotators.SemiTruckBox
/addvehicle Rotators.SemiTrailerVan
/addvehicle Rotators.SemiTrailerCistern

Note: If you get kicked from the server when using the vehicle, you have to adjust the anti-cheat settings.

[quote]
Workshop ID: 2759339330
Mod ID: rSemiTruck
[/quote]

2972287975.title: Wake Them Up
2972287975.description:
Spawn building zombies fast optimizing performances costs.
Problem description in [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UOQaZ0PflZs]that video[/url].
Ducks' Zombie Building Spawn Fix correction explained in [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=foe78LkXOzU]this video[/url].
This mod is a replacement to Ducks' Zombie Building Spawn Fix.
It adds the same improvement but with less drawbacks, see details below.

[h1]Technical stuff[/h1]
[list]
[*]does one room per cycle and suspends once the cell is fully woken up.
[*]continues when the size increases (when new rooms are loaded). The trick is: the size never decreases.
[*]as a primary consequence: the peak cost is only one room's cost. (instead of many as it occures a lot that many pop in one cycle) => that's what reduces / removes the stutters.
[*]as a consequence: each room is only requested once. (instead of constantly)
[*]as a consequence: long time server runs bigroom list is not a problem as the room list is never parsed.
[*]Mimic Vanilla behaviour to avoid spawning Zombies in the player's spawning building.
[*]Mimic Vanilla behaviour to avoid spawning Zombies in specific 'empty' rooms.
[/list]

[h1]Remaining drawback[/h1]
[list]
[*]Spawning zombies faster than vanilla will increase the CPU load. So you have to choose between that CPU cost increase and the risk of last second zombie spawn as described in the video.
[/list]

[h1]Non technical stuff[/h1]
[list]
[*]Credits to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/iwishforducks]Ducks[/url] for the initial solution: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2961467351]Ducks' Zombie Building Spawn Fix[/url].
[*]Picture comes from [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=foe78LkXOzU]this video[/url]'s miniature. Credits to the author for pointing out the problem.
[/list]


[quote]
[url=http://theindiestone.com/forums/index.php/topic/2530-mod-permissions/?p=36479]On Lockdown[/url]
This mod cannot be modified by anyone else, for anything else, at all, ever. Even if the user disappears, he or she would much rather you didn't touch the fruits of their hard labour.
[/quote]

If you wanna support, kind words are very welcome.
If you don't have any, you can still give constructive criticism.

Workshop ID: 2972287975
Mod ID: WakeThemUp

2849467715.title: Water Goes Bad
2849467715.description:
[h1]Water Goes Bad[/h1]
This mod makes the water still stored in sinks, baths, etc after the water shutoff become unsafe to drink after a customisable amount of time. Off-grid water containers, such as water dispensers, stored water containers, and player plumbed sinks are not affected.
This aims to make keeping track of water more engaging. In Vanilla, stored-up water leaves a near infinite supply of easy safe water even after the water shutoff, making keeping up with thirst trivial.
[h1]Water Drain[/h1]
This mod also features water draining from the taps over time to add further urgency to securing a water source.
[h1]Filters[/h1]
This also introduces the need to filter plumbed taps. You'll need to additionally craft and install a filter after plumbing a tap, unless the source has safe water (not rain).
[h1]Customisability[/h1]
Sandbox variables allow you to customise how many days after the water shutoff the water becomes tainted (including instantly). The filtering and water drain features can be turned off entirely, and the rate of drain can be changed.

[h1]Translation Credits[/h1]
Italian translation by [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Art_Tippet]Art Tippet[/url]

Workshop ID: 2849467715
Mod ID: WaterGoesBad

2619072426.title: Weapon Condition Indicator [41.60+]
2619072426.description:
The mod shows condition (durability) of a weapon attached to the hotbar (back, belt, holster, etc.) or equipped in the primary hand. And many other useful features.

[h2]Features[/h2]
- Two types of weapon condition indicators: icon (star or bubble) and progress bar;
- Blinking when condition lowers and shows an overhead notification;
- Overhead notification will also be displayed when your character falls on the ground and drops an equipped weapon;
- Ammo count and battery charge is dislayed in the hotbar and near the equipped item icon (top left);
- Tooltips with a detailed information about an item, ammo and battery when hovering mouse over the hotbar slots or equipped item icon;
- Fully configurable.

[h2]Options[/h2]
You can configure the mod according to your needs. Go to [i]Options -> Mods -> Weapon Condition Indicator[/i] section.

[h2]Requirements[/h2]
Game version: [b]Build 41.60+ (MP supported)[/b]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2169435993]Mod Options[/url] is [b]required[/b] for this mod to work.

[h2]Compatibility[/h2]
May conflict with other mods that override ISHotbar.lua and/or ISEquippedItem.lua.

3025055056.title: West Point Gated Community
3025055056.description:
I like gated communities. So I made a mod that adds one to the north side of West Point, right by the river.

It includes 6 houses/mansions of variable sizes. Some looking richer than others.

A baitshop has also been added nearby.

IngameMap is done. Foraging Zones are done. Zombie Zones are done.

The Spawn Points include houses inside the Gated Comuunity as well as house located right beside the community's fences.

[spoiler] There's also a secret hidden somewhere. Can you find it ? [/spoiler]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Compatibility[/h1]

The cell used is 39x22.
I haven't found an other map that uses this cell. If you do, share it in the comments.

Compatible with:
[list]
[*]Over The River
[*]West Point Expansion
[*]West Point Fire Department
[*]West Point Lighthouse
[*]West Point Trailer Park & VHS Store
[*]West Point Suburbs and Farm
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

[b]Do you like this? Try my other maps :[/b]
[list]
[*] [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2721653030]West Point Trailer Park & VHS Store[/url][/u] : It adds a VHS store south of West Point since it's missing one.
[*] [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2922087098&searchtext=Rosewood]Rosewood VHS and Gun Stores[/url][/u] : It adds a VHS Store and a Gun Store south of Rosewood since it's missing both of them.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]"We want to use this map in a mod pack, do we have permission ?"[/h1]
Yes, as long as it's a private mod pack.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]"Can I add this midgame ?"[/h1]
If you haven't visited that part of West Point in your saved game, yes.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]For Multiplayer: instructions given by a comment :[/h1]
How to get the mod to work:
1. Go to the "Map" section of sandbox settings.
2. Choose the map ("West Point Gated Community") from the dropdown menu under "Add an available map to the list".
3. Click on "Muldraugh, KY" in the "Maps used by this server" box and click "Move down" until it's at the bottom of the list.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]B42 version when ?[/h1]
When the mapping tools are updated by the devs.
And when the vanilla map of build 42 has been exported to tmx by someone else.

[hr][/hr]

Workshop ID: 3025055056
Mod ID: WestPointGatedCommunity
Map Folder: WestPointGatedCommunity

2721653030.title: West Point Trailer Park & VHS Store
2721653030.description:
[u][url=https://pzfans.com/project-zomboid-maps/?map_name=West_Point_Trailer_Park_VHS_Store]Click here to view the map online[/url][/u]

This is the finished version of my first map, "[u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2714931247]West Point VHS Store[/url][/u]".

There is no VHS store in West Point, so this mod adds one that is nearby, next to a trailer park.

The map features :
- [spoiler]A trailer park[/spoiler],
- [spoiler]A VHS store[/spoiler],
- [spoiler]A convenience store[/spoiler],
- [spoiler]A farmer's market[/spoiler],
- [spoiler]A fairly isolated trailer home[/spoiler],
- [spoiler]Two farms[/spoiler],
- [spoiler]And a dirt path through the forest[/spoiler].

It is located in the cell 38 x 24, South of West Point's Pizza Whirled and Zipee Market, right by the road that leads to the crossroads between Dixie and West Point.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Compatibility[/h1]

[b]Compatible with:[/b]
West Point Gated Community
West Point Expansion
West Point Fire Department
Over the River
West Point's Light House

Billionaire Safehouse

[b]NOT compatible with:[/b]
WestPointIncidentOnlyMap (it uses the same cell)

West Point Side (it will cut an access road, but 95% of the map will still be intact.)

[hr][/hr]

[b]Do you like this? Try my other maps :[/b]
[list]

[/list]

Yes, as long as it's a private mod pack.

If you haven't visited that part of West Point in your saved game, yes.

[hr][/hr]

3097650043.title: Where Am I?
3097650043.description:
[img]https://i.ibb.co/bmLb7pQ/Banner-Features.png[/img]

[h1]I'm lost![/h1]
There's so many map mods out there! And what about new Players? How do you know exactly in which town or region of the map you are? With this mod, of course!

[h1]How does it work?[/h1]
Whenever you open the world map, you will find in the bottom left a header that will display the area of the map you are in, regardless if you are in a Vanilla location, or a Modded one!

[img]https://i.ibb.co/yQKWMxh/Banner-FAQ.png[/img]

[h1]Does it work in the Latest Build?[/h1]
Right out of the box!

[h1]Does it work in Multiplayer?[/h1]
Of course!

[h1]Does it work on existing saves?[/h1]
Absolutely!

[h1]Which map mods are supported?[/h1]
This mod is compatible with most popular mods. You can [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3097650043/4035850678063403013/]click here[/url] to see the full list of areas.

[h1]Is the mod compatible with [...]?[/h1]
This mod shouldn't have any incompatibility with other mods.
You can [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/3097650043/4035850678063388960/]click here[/url] to check which mods are known to cause problems.

I also accept Ko-Fi donations. All money is used to develop mods.

2760742937.title: Working Masks
2760742937.description:
This Mod attempts to make masks (such as gas masks) affect the sickness gain from corpses.
It does not protect against engine fumes inside buildings.

Condition of the mask is considered.

Gas Masks offer full protection at 100% condition.
Other specific masks as surgical masks half protection at 100% condition.
Lastly, items such as Balaclavas, Bandanas, etc. offer 25% protection at full condition, if they cover the mouth and Nose.

Currently supported mods:
Authentic Z, Shark's Law Enforcement Overhaul, Shark and Peach's Military Uniform Improvements, Brita's Armor Pack, Swatpack, ADVANCED GEAR, Paw Low Loot, Undead Survivor, Scrap Armor, Toxic Fog, They Knew, Stalker Armor Pack, slyy's Spicy Attire, Asura Chi, Insurgent - Black Ops Profession
See the discussion thread for a detailed list and protection values,
Any masks added by unsupported mods will work normally, but not offer any protection.

Better Masks Mod provides it's own compatibility mod. It uses different protection values than described above.

Feel free to suggest other masks to support or balance changes.

Should be safe to be added to or removed from an ongoing game as no items are being modified.
I have not tested it in MP, any feedback is welcome, if you give it a try.
Feedback so far has been positive.

Adding this mod to a modpack is permitted, if credit is given and a link to this workshop page is included.

If you'd like to contribute, the source code for this mod can be found here: https://github.com/jaype87/WorkingMasks

Special thanks goes to Werlias for creating the video!

Workshop ID: 2760742937
Mod ID: WorkingMasks

2696083206.title: Wring Out Clothing
2696083206.description:
Closed laundromats got you down? Tired of living in pools of sweat? Use that arm-power to twist and squeeze that wetness away!

The amount of water than can be removed from clothing and towels is dependent on a character's strength.

Strength 10: Wring to 10% wetness
Strength 8/9: Wring to 15% wetness
Strength 6/7: Wring to 20% wetness
Strength 4/5: Wring to 25% wetness
Strength 2/3: Wring to 30% wetness
Strength 0/1: Wring to 35% wetness

Usage: Right click a piece of clothing or towel with a wetness value more than the wetness value corresponding to your character's strength and a 'Wring Clothing' option will appear. Of course hard helmets can't be wringed out.

Shout out to the Youtuber Epokk who created the above video detailing this simple mod.

Workshop ID: 2696083206
Mod ID: wringclothes

2929123989.title: zRe Better Lockpicking
2929123989.description:
Original mod: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2368058459]Better lockpicking[/url] by Aiteron and YingSuHuaKai. All honors and applause to them!

[h2][b]TIP:[/b][/h2]
[b]Recomend turn OFF "UI Offscreen Rendering" for better minigame-UI smooth![/b]

[h2][b]zReMod:[/b][/h2][list]
[*]Standalone version ('Profession framework' or original mod not required)!
[*][b]DELETED BobbyPin func:[/b]
- Force unlock;
- Locking function;
- Chance to break lock.
[*][b]Crowbar lockpicking:[/b]
- Available without a book and skill;
- Requirements "Don't have high exertion (stamina <=50)".
[*][b]Crowbar minigame:[/b]
- Fitness level determines stamina expenditure;
- Strength level determines length Green and Yellow zones;
- Strength level determines how much more you fill progress BAR on Green/Yellow/Red zones;
- Lockpicking level add small adjustment to stamina and progress BAR filling.
[*]Detection Crowbars, Screwdrivers, BobbyPins in the inventory and backpacks.
[*]Zombie "Burglar" and "Escaped from prison" can be found rarely in world (contain magazines).
[*]Reinforced doors can't be unlocked with Crowbar, use Screwdriver and BobbyPins!
[*]Locked doors can't be moveable![/list]

[h2][b]zReFixes:[/b][/h2][list]
[*]Burglar profession fixed (trait, level for lockpicking, new character recipes and trait).
[*]Screwdiver lockpicking (abuse windows for exp farm).
[*]Crowbar lockpicking (abuse lockpicking at 0 stamina).
[*]Face position lock on lockpicking object.
[*]Volume of crowbar be reduced, sound stop correctly.
[*]Minigame UI speed (Big thanks to [b]albion[/b] and [b]Js![/b]).
[*]The result of vehicle lockpicking is now synchronized in MP (Big thanks to [b]Chuckleberry Finn[/b]).
[*]Minigame closes correctly when player has been attack by zombies.
[*]Fix for vanilla game: when trunk lock boken, but u can use button inside vehicle for lock/unlock trunk door. Now: u can't![/list]

[h2][b]Compatibility with:[/b][/h2][list]

  - Addon "zRe Better Lockpicking [+ LittleYoschi's Skillbooks: Lockpicking]"!

2914364562.title: [OLD] zRe Vaccine ReMod by kERHUS
2914364562.description:
[h1]zRe VACCINE 2.0 Relised:[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3215662377

[h1]YOU CAN SWITCH ON zRe VACCINE 2.0 WITHOUT PROBLEM![/h1]

[h1]WORK ON PZ v41.78+ (compatible with multiplayer)![/h1]

[h1]NOT COMPATIBILITY WITH:[/h1][list]
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2975848784]Enhanced Environment by Spoon[/url].
-Use [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3012084441]this version from Yummy[/url]![/list]

A pack of redesigned and adapted mods!
[Subscription is not required for these mods!]
1) [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2512119000]Zombie Virus Vaccine[/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2685680439]Zombie Virus Vaccine MP[/url], By Ehue232v and Dr Reaper
2) [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725378876]They Knew[/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2918554995]They Knew Extended[/url] by Afterworlds и [OC] Maccu
3) [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2392676812]Antibodies[/url] by lonegamedev

== Added sandbox settings for most moments;
== Computer crafting added [required for chromatograph to work in main mod];
== Added a rare blood sample to the pool when collecting a sample from zombies:
- Garbage: "LabRecipes.MatTaintedBlood";
== A rare blood sample is needed to improve vaccines and create the last two vaccines;
== New sample icons (hello State of Decay 2);
== Blood in a test tube spoils longer (try using a freezer);
== Added crafting through the muffle furnace (casting molds);
== "ANTIBODIES" mod is integrated and works only if player has "Resistant antibodies" trait;
== Zombies in black chemical suits contain most of the items needed for the mod!

-- Alterations, fixes and other stuff for my taste;
- All recipes related to the vaccine (not chemistry) have been moved to their category "Vaccine";
-- Numbering has been added to the names of the recipes for an intuitive concept of the sequence of actions;
-- Added craft notepad, corks;
-- Added alternative way to get new vaccine levels via recipes:
1) Start studying the section "Vaccine" in recipes!
2) The chance to learn vaccines is now gradual, depending on the level of First Aid in excess of the requirements for the recipe (for example, a vaccine upgrade requires level 4 First Aid, and you have 5, so there will be an increase in the chance) and whether you are a Doctor or not (if doctor +10% chance) [just convention]!

== Vaccine stats have been reworked:
=Level 1: 0% chance to heal. Resets infection up to 15%. Grants 20% virus resistance for one day if used while healthy;
=Level 2: 20% chance to heal. Resets the infection to 10%. Grants 40% virus resistance for two days if used while healthy;
=Level 3: 35% chance to heal. Resets the infection to 5%. Grants 60% virus resistance for two days if used while healthy;
=Level 4: 100% cure. Grants 100% virus resistance for one day if used while healthy;
=Level 5(Serum): 100% cure. Gives a 30% chance to get an "[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2392676812]Resistant Antibodies[/url]" trait.

GUIDE:
1) Find and read all books, build a laboratory, look for chemistry and medical supplies to craft:
- Flasks, Test Tubes, Syringes / Gloves, Aprons, Goggles / Chemistry / Scalpel and Tweezers!
2) We kill zombies - we collect samples, then we use the tabs of the recipes "Chemistry" and "Vaccine"!
3) Create a vaccine, improve the vaccine, create a more advanced vaccine!

GUIDE IN CASE OF INFECTION:
-If you are infected (you can check by doing a test in the vaccines section), then you have an average of 3 days before complete zombification (72 game hours or 100%).
-The first vaccines do not reset the infection, but reset the stage to 20-10%. Take the vaccine at about 80-90% (when you do the test, the percentage of infection is indicated in the name) or ~65 hours after the bite(infected), the main thing is not to miss the moment.
---IF THE VACCINE CLEARED THE INFECTION - Congratulations, that's it all.
---IF NO, GO FURTHER:
-Make albumin, this thing prolongs the effect of the vaccine and pushes back the zombification.
Use a 1 dose of albumin at about 50-60% of the infection.
After an hour or two of game time, do a second test.
This is how you can watch the zombification flow.
When you reach 50-60%, use albumin again.
When the albumin ceases to act, you can inject the vaccine again.
THIS WAY YOU WILL EXTEND ZOMBIFICATION UP TO 6-9 DAYS ON ONE VACCINE (1 lvl) (for example)!
-------------

3071370537.title: Working Air Conditioners
3071370537.description:
[h1] Overview [/h1]
This mod won't let you freeze your butts off during zombie apocalypse. 
Activate air conditioners and stay hot during winters. 
Cooling is also possible but works only in single player games. 

If you like my work:
[url=/ko-fi.com/M4M7SGR4P][img]https://storage.ko-fi.com/cdn/kofi2.png?v=3[/img][/url]

[h1] How does this work[/h1]
[h2] Obtaining Air Conditioners [/h2]
AC units cannot be crafted, but you can find them in game already installed on some building walls. They are usually located on industrial buildings, warehouses, but also there is one in Muldraugh bakery. You will need to simply pick them and take them home to your base. 

[h2] Placing Air Conditioner [/h2]
To activate the air conditioner you do not need to learn any skills nor tools.

Place the air conditioner outside your base on a wall behind which you want heat to be generated. Right click the air conditioner, and select "Attach". This needs to be done only once after placing the unit on a wall. 

[h2] Operating Air Conditioner [/h2]
Air conditioners will naturally work only when power is available. Vanilla generators, but also solar panels will work. Right click air conditioner, and simply select "Turn on". Turning off is similar.

Click "Settings" to access a panel to change temperature and fan speed. Temperature is self-explanatory; the fan speed controls the radius of heat propagation. This mod uses in-game algorithm for heat propagation which is not perfect. You may notice that sometimes heat is blocked for no reason. I cannot fix this but you may experiment with different A/C placements or using more than one unit. 

AC units can also be controlled remotely. To do so, you will need to use a TV remote. Click "Settings" on the remote in your inventory list. The remote will control nearby unit as long as it is not too far. If there are multiple units in range, you will control the one that is closer to the player. The player will face in the direction where the AC unit is, this way you will know that unit is being controlled. You can control units only on the same floor.

[h1] Other [/h1]
Air conditioner will consume a constant amount of fuel. 
Air conditioner does not not to be repaired.
Air conditioners do not generate any toxic gas. 
It is safe to add the mod in the middle of the game. It is also safe to remove it which is not recommended ;)

Please let me know of your ideas in the comments. I will try to implement them. Also please let me know if you find any bugs.

id=3071370537
ModID: AirCond

3209239259.title: Sensors and Traps
3209239259.description:
[h1]Sensors[/h1]

This mod allows you to craft sensors of various types, and apply them to objects to initiate an automatic action. Additionally sensors may trigger sound alarms or initiate explosions.

Examples:
[list]
[*] You can add a light sensor to a lamp so that it turns on automatically during night. Using sensors will allow you to conserve energy. If you you Immersive Solar Arrays, the efficiency of your setup will be improved greatly Additionally you will extend lifetime of your bulbs.
[*] You can add a proximity sensor to a gate so that it opens when player is near. This way you do not need to exit your car to open or close the gate
[*] You can add a power sensor that detects power shortage and turns on a (secondary) generator
[*] You can place a zombie sensor with a electric shock module that will guard your base
[/list]

[h2]Sensor Types[/h2]
[table]
[tr]
        [th]Type[/th]
        [th]Trigger[/th]
        [th]Threshold[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
    [td]Light Sensor[/td]
    [td]The sensor measures daylight value and sends a signal when light level is below given threshold.[/td]
        [td]intensity
(min:0.0, max:1.0)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Player Proximity Sensor[/td]
        [td]The sensor measures the distance between Player and the object and sends a signal when distance is below given threshold.[/td]
        [td]distance[squares]
(min:0, max:10)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Zombie Proximity Sensor[/td]
        [td]The sensor measures the distance between Zombie and the object and sends a signal when distance is below given threshold.[/td]
        [td]distance[squares]
(min:0, max:10)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Player Room Sensor[/td]
        [td]The sensor sends a signal when both the sensor and the player are located in the same room of a building.[/td]
[td]N/A[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Temperature Sensor[/td]
        [td]The sensor sends a signal when temperature on the square where it is located is below given threshold.[/td]
[td]degrees[celcius]
(min: -50, max: 50)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Rain Sensor[/td]
        [td]The sensor sends a signal when rain intensity is below given threshold.[/td]
[td]intensity
(min: 0.0, max: 1.0)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Power Sensor[/td]
        [td]The sensor sends a signal when the power is available to the object the sensor is attached to.[/td]
[td]N/A[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[h2]Applicable Objects[/h2]
[table]
[tr]
        [th]Object[/th]
        [th]Action[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
    [td]Light sources (lamps or lightswitches)[/td]
    [td]If a sensor is attached to a lamp, it will be turned on. If a sensor is attached to a light switch, a related light source will be turned on. [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Vanilla electronic devices[/td]
        [td]The sensor will activate / deactivate the device. The devices are: Generator, Clothing Dryer, Washing Machine, Stove, TV, Radio [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Air Conditioner[/td]
        [td]The sensor will activate / deactivate the a/c unit. Subscribe to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3071370537]Working Air Conditioners[/url][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]Doors and gates[/td]
        [td]The sensor will trigger door gate opening /closing.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]


[url=/ko-fi.com/M4M7SGR4P][img]https://storage.ko-fi.com/cdn/kofi2.png?v=3[/img][/url]

[h2]Using Sensors[/h2]
[olist]
[*] You will need to find "Electronic Magaize vol 5 - Sensors" and read it to unlock recipe for all sensor types
[*] Craft a sensor of any type with 2 electronic scrap and glue. You will need to have at least electric skill level 2
[*] Click on the object you want to add sensor to, and select  "Add Sensor" option
[*] If you want to remove the sensor, simply select "Remove Sensor" option.
[/olist]

[h2]Tuning Sensors[/h2]
To adjust sensor settings such a sensitivity, you will need to use a desktop computer. You must subscribe to "The Computer" by KONIJIMA mod. Turn on the computer and right click on computer keyboard, an option to reprogram the sensor will be available. 

[h3]Threshold levels[/h3]
Not all sensor types have threshold levels and threshold levels min and max values are different for every sensor type. 

[h3]Invert[/h3]
You can check "invert" to invert the threshold rule. For example , for temperature sensor is threshold is 26 it will send positive signal when temperature is below 26C, but when you check "invert" it will send positive signal when the temperature exceeds 26C.

[h3]Modules[/h3]
Sensor has module slots that can be added for extra functionality.
[list]
[*] Battery slot - sensor need power to operate. If there is no external power, the sensor can use the battery. Battery will deplete slowly each time sensor activates. 
[*] Speaker slot - you can add amplifier module, this way sensor will trigger sound alarm when activated. The alarm will bring more attention however.
[*] Arm slot - you can add armed traps here, see below
[/list]

[h3]Armed Traps[/h3]
The traps are danegerous for zombies and players no matter who triggers them. So watch out! To craft armed traps you will need to find and read "Electronic Magaize vol 6 - Traps".

[list]
[*] Shock trap - it will electrocute characters within sensor range. Electrocuted zombies' movement will be limited and finally zombie will become a crawler. Players will fall down and their movement will be limited. No damage is inflicted apart from the damage that is possible due to the bump fall. The trap is persistent, it does not vanish after firing.
[*] Glass trap - it will explode and kill almost all zombies in the sensor range. Players will suffer from deep wounds with glass shards. The trap fires once and then the sensor is gone
[*] Nails trap - similar to glass trap, but without glass shards, but slighly more painful. 
[/list]

Traps will not work on players that are sneaking.

[h2]Roadmap[/h2]
Features below are not implemented yet, but I am thinking about adding them.
[list]
[*] Other sensor types: Time sensor - activate at the given hour/minute
[/list]

[h2]Bugs[/h2]
[list]
[*] Light bug - happens for some external light sources, probably modded ones. Destroy the object where sensor is placed when this happens. 
[*] If you you pick up the object you will lose a sensor. Remove it first, move object and add sensor again. 
[*] If you want gates to work correctly, add sensor to the edge of the gate, where the hinges are, not the center. 
[/list]


Workshop ID: 3209239259
Mod ID: LightSensor

2738969410.title: A hotwire nerf mod
2738969410.description:
Hotwired cars may now stall when starting the engine or driving at high speed(especially offroad). There's a very small chance the hotwire comes loose and must be done again from scratch.
This is separate from the multiple times required to start a car, when the car engine is damaged. This will even apply to 100% cars, as long as they are hotwired.

20% chance to get sparks when starting the car( this will stall the car immediately).
2% chance to get make the hotwire come loose if the sparks fly (so in reality the % is 20% -> 2% ( making it way smaller than 2% )
While driving, the car can have up to 1% chance of the wires getting sparks (when driving on-road it barely goes above 0.5%) and the check is doen every minute, which makes the chance to stall at any time very small.

I made this because I would always hotwire cars, even if I had the keys. This makes hotwired cars a bit more scary to use and makes players prefer keys, if possible.

Workshop ID: 2738969410
Mod ID: ahotwirenerfmod
